en: In a twinkle of an eye the picture of the Chairman of the Driver's Unon came to Labake's mind - a huge-framed, pot bellied individual, smiling and waving cheerfully to the mammy- wagon driver.
yo: Ni iseju aaya kan, aworan alaga awon egbe awako wa si okan Labake - o lara, o nikun agbe, o n rerin-in muse, o si n juwo tayo tayo si awako oko-akeru naa.

en: Labake saw, again, the jumbled mass of second-hand articles at the motor park mini-market.
yo: Labake tun ri awon nnkan aloku ti won n ta ni oja kekere ni ibudoko.

en: She heard, once more, the voice of the traders calling her, inviting her to come and purchase second-hand articles.
yo: O tun gbo leekan si i, ohun awon ti o n pe e pe ki o wa ra nnkan aloku.

en: "Alamu... Alamu...' Labake continued, ""What happened to your job?"
yo: Alamu... Alamu...' Labake tesiwaju, 'Ki lo sele si ise re?'

en: I Lost it Labake. Labake nearly collapsed at all these revelations.
yo: Mo padanu re Labake. Labake ti fere e daku pelu gbogbo ifihan yii.

en: She knew nothing about them, she didn't know Alamu had been contesting his termination of appointment in court.
yo: Ko mo nnkankan nipa won, ko mo pe Alamu ti n du ejo iyonise re nile ejo.

en: She did not know Adio was his lawyer. She did not know Alamu had won the case.
yo: Ko si mo pe Adio ni agbejoro re. Ko mo pe Alamu ti jawe olubori ejo naa.

en: Alamu was just relating all these to her now. Her jaw dropped in disbelief.
yo: Alamu sese n so gbogbo eyi fun un bayii. Enu ya a laigbagbo.

en: And you were smoking and drinking too Alamu.
yo: O si n fa siga, o n mu oti naa Alamu.

en: Yes, Labake to keep the sorrow away.
yo: Bee ni, Labake lati fi le ibanuje kuro.

en: You never told me anything Alamu.
yo: O o so nnkankan fun mi ri Alamu.

en: I thought it would break your heart, Labake.
yo: Mo lero pe a ba o lokan je ni, Labake

en: Each answer from Alamu cut through Labake's heart like a dagger.
yo: Gbogbo idahun ti o wa lati enu Alamu la okan Labake koja bi i ida.

en: That Alamu had kept so much away for so long filled all her veins with pain.
yo: Pe Alamu ko gbogbo nnkan to po bayii pamo fi edun sinu isan re.

en: Finally, you broke my heart Alamu... And all through, your mother was at my throat. Mama?
yo: Nigbeyin gbeyin, O ba mi lokan je Alamu... Ninu gbogbo re, iya re duro le mi lorun, Mama?

en: Yes, Labake related all she had suffered in the hands of Mama, the sense of guilt descended heavily on Alamu and he started mumbling unreserved apology.
yo: Bee ni, Labake so gbogbo iya ti o je lowo Mama, emi idara-eni-lebi ba le Alamu, o si bere si i toro aforiji.

en: There was a knock on the door, the knock was persistent. None of them was prepared for the visitor who knocked and eventually came into the room without waiting for an answer.
yo: Ilekun kan, kikan naa je lemolemo. Ko si nnkankan ninu won ti o ti gbaradi fun alejo ti o n kan ilekun, ti o si jaja wo inu ile laiduro de esi.

en: Mama! She came into the room - followed closely by Esuniyi.
yo: Mama! O wo inu ile - ti Esuniyi si tele e.

en: Esuniyi hesitated for some seconds at the door, then looked round, and started whispering to himself.
yo: Esuniyi duro fun iseju aaya die lenu ona, leyin naa, o wo yika, o si bere si isoro kelekele si ara re.

en: He pointed his forefingers, three times, to Alamu and touched his own chest three times too.
yo: O na ika ilabe re leemeta si Alamu, o si fowo kan aya tire leemeta naa.

en: He bent down, looked Alamu in the face, and started backing out of the room, still mumbling, still whispering.
yo: O bere mole, o wo oju Alamu, o si bere si i feyin rin jade ninu ile, o si n soro wuyewuye.

en: The spell had been cast. Mama smiled, it was a swift operation, just like it had been planned.
yo: Ogun ti se, mama rerin-in muse, ise ti o ya ni, gege bi won ti se gbero re niyen.

en: It did not last more than three minutes. And before anybody had the time to say a word, Esuniyi was already downstairs, trudging away along the street.
yo: Ko ju iseju meta lo, ki enikeni to ni anfaani lati soro kan, Esuniyi ti wa ni isale, o n ja lo ni opopona.

en: Labake moved nearer Alamu and whispered to his ears: Your mother's medicine man.
yo: Labake sunmo Alamu, o si so o si i leti kelekele; Baba onisegun iya re.

en: Brought from the village to cure your malady.
yo: Ti won mu wa lati abule, lati wo aaganna re san.

en: She moved up to Adio again and whispered: Mama's medicine man, brought to cure your friend's malady.
yo: O tun sun mo Adio, o soro kelekele: Baba onisegun Mama ti won mu wa lati wo aaganna ore re san.

en: The three people exchanged quick glances and smiled. Who was mad really? None but this man in apete dress.
yo: "Awon eeyan meteeta paaro iwo firi, won si rerin-inmuse. Ta ni o ya were gan an? Ko si elomiran bi kose okunrin ti o wo ewu ""apete"" yii."

en: How to: Avoid Phishing Attacks
yo: Bi a se le: Dena idojuko Fisiini

en: Last reviewed: 9-6-2017
yo: Itunwo Ikeyin 9-6-2017

en: On your path to improving your digital security, you may encounter bad actors who attempt to undermine your security goals.
yo: Nipase imugboro aabo re lori ayelujara, o le s'alabaapade osere ibi t'o pete lati so aabo re di yepere.

en: We call these bad actors adversaries, or attackers.
yo: Osere buruku ni a pe iru ota, tabi adojukoni bawonyi.

en: When an attacker sends an email or link that looks innocent, but is actually malicious it's called phishing.
yo: Bi adojukoni ba fi imeeli tabi isopo to jo gidi, amo ti o je arankan ni a n pe ni Fisiini.

en: A phishing attack usually comes in the form of a message meant to convince you to:
yo: Idojuko Fisiini saba maa n ri gele bii ise-ije lati tan o:

en: click on a link;
yo: Ki o sira te

en: open a document;
yo: isopo adarieni s'oju iwe miii

en: install software on your device; or
yo: Ki o gba eda ise-airidimu sile sori ero-ayarabiasaa re; tabi

en: enter your username and password into a website that's made to look legitimate.
yo: Ki o te oruko idanimo ati oro-ifiwolee re sori ibudo-itakun to jo ogidi.

en: Phishing attacks can trick you into giving up your passwords or trick you into installing malware on your device.
yo: Idojuko Fisiini le tan o fi ki o fi oro-ifiwolee re sile, tabi tan o lati fi ise-airidimu aidara sori eroo re.

en: Attackers can use malware to remotely control your device, steal information, or spy on you.
yo: Adojukoni le lo ise-airidimu arankan lati fi pase fun eroo re, ji iwifun-un re, tabi fi se alami.

en: This guide will help you to identify phishing attacks when you see them and outline some practical ways to help defend against them.
yo: Itona yii yoo ran o lowo lati tete da idojuko Fisiini mo ni kete ti o ba s'alabaapadee won ati awon ona to wulo ti yoo ran o lowo lati gbaradi fun won

en: Types of Phishing Attacks
yo: Awon oriisi idojuko Fisiini to wa

en: Phishing for Passwords (aka Credential Harvesting)
yo: Fisiini fun Oro-ifiwole (ti a mo si kikoree iwe-eri)

en: Phishers can trick you into giving them your passwords by sending you a deceptive link.
yo: Fisiini fun Oro-ifiwole le tan o ki o s'esi fun won ni oro-ifiwolee re nipa fifi isopo s'owo si o.

en: Web addresses in a message may appear to have one destination, but lead to another.
yo: Ojule itakun agbaye inu ise-ije le dari eni si ibomiran.

en: On your computer, you can usually see the destination URL by hovering over the link.
yo: Lori ero-ayarabiasaa re, o maa ri URL ti o n lo, bi o ba fe te isopo.

en: But links can be further disguised with lookalike letters, or by using domain names that are one letter off from legitimate domain names and may direct you to a webpage that appears to go to a service that you use, such as Gmail or Dropbox.
yo: Sugbon a le dibon isopo ki o jo ara, tabi lilo oruko ibudo itakun ti omo-oro kan ti din ati o le darii re lo si ojuuwe itakun agbaye to jo eyi ti o ti maa n lo, bii Gmail tabi Dropbox.

en: These fake replica login screens often look so legitimate that it's tempting to type your username and password
yo: Awon oju iwe ifiwole wonyi saba maa n ri bi ooto ti yoo tan o lati fi oruko-idanimo ati oro-ifiwolee re sile.

en: If you do, you will send your login credentials to the attackers.
yo: Bi o ba se bee, o o fi ohun-eri ifiwolee re ranse si adojukoni.

en: So before typing any passwords, look at the address bar of your web browser.
yo: Tori idi eyi, ki o to te oro-ifiwole, ye patako adireesi ori ibudo-itakun asawarikirii re wo.

en: It will show the real domain name of the page.
yo: Yoo fi ogidi oruko agbegbe-ikapa oju iwe naa han gbangba.

en: If it doesn't match the site you think you're logging into, don't continue!
yo: Bi ko ba jo ibudo ti o mo tele, maa tesiwaju!

en: Remember that seeing a corporate logo on the page doesn't confirm it's real.
yo: Seranti wipe aworan ile-ise ti o ri loju iwe ayederu ko fi han wipe ojulowo ni.

en: Anybody can copy a logo or design onto their own page to try and trick you.
yo: Enikeni le gbe eda aworan-idanimo si ori oju iwe ti won lati fi tan o je.

en: Some phishers use sites that look like popular Web addresses to fool you: https://wwwpaypal.com/ is different from https://www.paypal.com/.
yo: Awon onifisiini miii maa n lo ibudo to foju jo ojule-itakun agbaye lati tan o: https://wwwpaypal.com/ yato si, https://www.paypal.com/.

en: "Similarly https://www.paypaI.com/ (with a capital letter ""i"" instead of a lowercase ""L"") is different from https://www.paypal.com/."
yo: "Ewewe, https://www.paypaI.com/ (ti o ni ""i"" nila dipo ""L"" kekere yato si https://www.paypal.com/."

en: Many people use URL shorteners to make long URLs easier to read or type, but these can be used to hide malicious destinations.
yo: Opo eniyan maa n lo ayi-atoka-ibudo-itakun di kukuru URL ki URL gigun ba rorun fun kika tabi te, sugbon a le fi eyi se ipamo ibudo buruku.

en: If you receive a shortened URL like a t.co link from Twitter, try putting it into https://www.checkshorturl.com/ to see where it's really going.
yo: Bi o ba gba URL kukuru bii isopo-adarieni t.co lori Twitter, gbiyanju ki o se ayewo idaniloju https://www.checkshorturl.com/ lati tu asiiri ibi ti o n lo gan-an.

en: Remember, it's easy to forge emails so that they display a false return address.
yo: Ranti, o rorun lati se ayederu imeeli ki o ba han ojule idapada imeeli etan.

en: This means that checking the apparent email address of the sender isn't enough to confirm that an email was really sent by the person it appears to be from.
yo: Eyi tumo si wipe isayewo ojule imeeli afise-ije-ranse ko to lati mo boya oloooto ni eni to ri ise-ije ranse tabi ida keji.

en: Most phishing attacks cast a wide net.
yo: Awon fife ni onifisiini saba maa n lo fi sise laabi won.

en: An attacker might send emails to hundreds or thousands of people claiming to have an exciting video, important document, or billing dispute.
yo: Adojukoni le fi imeeli ranse si ogoogorun-un tabi egbeegberun eniyan lati te aworan fidio alarinrin, iwe to se pataki, tabi ariyanjiyan isanwo kan.

en: But sometimes phishing attacks are targeted based on something the attacker already knows about an individual.
yo: Amo nigba miiran a maa n darii idojuko fisiini si eni ti a mo kini kan nipa re.

en: "This is called ""spearphishing."" Imagine you receive an email from your Uncle Boris that says it contains pictures of his kids."
yo: "Eyi ni a pe ni ""Fisiini oko."" Ro o wipe o gba imeeli kan lati odo egbon Boris ti o ni aworan omoo re ninu."

en: Since Boris actually has kids and it looks like it is from his address, you open it.
yo: Niwon igba ti Boris ni omo ati pe ijerii si ojule imeelii re jo eyi ti o mo tele, o si i.

en: When you open the email, there is a PDF document attached to it.
yo: Nigba ti o si i, o ri faili agbasile kekere PDF ti a fi mo on.

en: "When you open the PDF, it may even display pictures of Boris"" kids, but it also quietly installs malware on your device that can be used to spy on you."
yo: Bi o ba si PDF naa, o le fi aworan omo Boris han, sugbon o ti se kelekele gbe ise-airidimu aidara sori ero-ayarabiasaa re ti yoo maa se alami ohun ti o ba n se wo.

en: Uncle Boris didn't send that email, but someone who knows you have an Uncle Boris (and that he has children) did.
yo: Egbon Boris ko lo fi imeeli yen ranse, sugbon eni ti o mo wipe o ni egbon kan to n je Boris (ti o ni omo wewe).

en: The PDF document that you clicked on started up your PDF reader, but took advantage of a bug in that software to run its own code.
yo: PDF ti o sira te, ti aka PDF n si lowo, ni ise-airidimu aidara yii ya lo fi fon oduu re ka sori eroo re.

en: In addition to showing you a PDF, it also downloaded malware onto your computer.
yo: Lafikun si PDF ti o ri, o ti se agbasile eda ise-airidimu aidara sori ero ayarabiasaa re.

en: That malware could retrieve your contacts and record what your device's camera and microphone sees and hears.
yo: Ise-airidimu aidara yen si le ji enimimo ati ka aworan ti ayaworan ati gbohungbohun re gbo sile.

en: The best way to protect yourself from phishing attacks is to never click on any links or open any attachments.
yo: Ona to dara ju fun idaaabobo araa re lowo idojuko fisiini ni lati maa te isopo adari eni tabi si afimo ti a fi mo imeeli.

en: But this advice is unrealistic for most people. Below are some practical ways to defend against phishing.
yo: Sugbon amoran yii ko je nnkankan fun opo eniyan. Awon ona to yanranti fun aabo fisiini wa nisale.

en: How to Help Defend Against A Phishing Attack
yo: Iranwo bi o se le gbogunti Idojuko Fisiini

en: Keep your software updated
yo: Fi afikun fun ise-airidimuu re

en: Phishing attacks that use malware often rely on software bugs in order to get the malware onto your machine.
yo: Idojuko Fisiini alo ise-airidimu aidara saba maa n gbojule odu-asasise ise-airidimu lati gbe ise-airidimu aidara sorii eroo re.

en: Usually once a bug becomes known, a software manufacturer will release an update to fix it.
yo: Lopo igba bi a ba s'akiyesii odu-asasise, onisona ise-airidimu yoo gbe afikun atunse jade.

en: This means that older software has more publicly-known bugs that could be used to help install malware.
yo: Eyi tumo si wipe ise-airidimuu ti tele ni odu-asasise to po ti a le lo fi gbe ise-airidimu aidara sori ero.

en: Keeping your software up to date reduces malware risks.
yo: Gbigba afikun ise-airidimuu re loorekoore yoo din ewu ise-airidimu aidara ku.

en: Use a password manager with auto-fill.
yo: Lo asakoso oro-ifiwole asisefunrare.

en: Password managers that auto-fill passwords keep track of which sites those passwords belong to.
yo: Asakoso oro-ifiwole asisefunrare yoo se apamo ibudo ti o ti n lo oro-ifiwole ohun.

en: While it's easy for a human to be tricked by fake login pages, passwordmanagers are not tricked in the same way.
yo: Bi o se rorun fun eniyan to lati bo si panpe oju iwe ifiwole ayederu, asakoso oro-ifiwole o le e lugbadi iru etan bee.

en: If you use a password manager (including the built-in password manager in your browser), and it refuses to auto-fill a password, you should hesitate and double check the site you're on.
yo: Bi o ba n lo asakoso oro-ifiwole (titi kan asakoso oro-ifiwole to ba asawarikirii re wa), ti o ko lati sise kiko oro-ifiwole funra re, o ye ki o se iyemeji, ki o se atunyewo ibudo ti o wa.

en: Better yet, use randomly generated passwords so that you are forced to rely on auto-fill, and less likely to type your password into a fake login page.
yo: Sibe, lo oro-ifiwole alagbara ti asakoso oro-ifiwole le ko funra re lori oju iwe ifiwole ayederu dipo ki o fi owoo re te e.

en: Verify Emails with Senders
yo: Jerii si imeeli pelu afise-ije ranse

en: One way to determine if an email is a phishing attack is to check via a different channel with the person who supposedly sent it.
yo: Ona kan lati mo bi imeeli kan ba je idojuko Fisiini ni wiwoo ni ikanni miiran lati ye eni to fi ranse wo.

en: If the email was purportedly sent from your bank, don't click on links in the email.
yo: Bi imeeli naa ba wa lati ile-ifowopamoo re, maa te isopo adari eni si oju iwe miiran ti a fi si inu imeeli naa.

en: Instead, call your bank or open your browser and type in the URL of your bank's website.
yo: Kaka bee, pe ile-ifowopamoo re tabi ki o si asawarikirii re ki o si te URL ile-ifowopamoo re si i.

en: Likewise, if your Uncle Boris sends you an email attachment, call him on the phone and ask if he sent you pictures of his kids before opening it.
yo: Bee gege, bi egbon Boris ba fi imeeli ti o ni afimo ninu, pe e lori ero-ibanisoroo ki o beere boya o fi aworan omo re ranse ki o to o si i.

en: Open Suspicious Documents in Google Drive
yo: Si iwe afurasi ninu Google Drive

en: Some people expect to receive attachments from unknown persons.
yo: Awon eniyan n foju sona fun ifimo lati owo eni ti o ko mo.

en: For example, journalists commonly receive documents from sources.
yo: Fun apeere, oniroyin saba maa n gba iwe lati ibi pataki orisirisi.

en: But it can be difficult to verify that a Word document, Excel spreadsheet, or PDF file isn't malicious.
yo: Sugbon o le nira lati se ijeriisi boya iwe Word, atekale Excel, tabi faili PDF ki i se ti buburu.

en: In these cases, don't double-click the downloaded file.
yo: Bi eyi ba waye, o ko gbodo sira te faili ti o gba edaa re sile lerinmeji.

en: Instead, upload it to Google Drive or another online document reader.
yo: Kaka bee, gbe e sorii Google Drive tabi akawe miiran lori ayelujara.

en: This will turn the document into an image or HTML, which almost certainly will prevent it from installing malware on your device.
yo: Eyi yoo yi iwe naa pada si aworan tabi si HTML, ti yoo di gbigbe ise-airidimu aidara lowo lori eroo re.

en: If you're comfortable with learning new software and willing to spend time setting up a new environment for reading mail or foreign documents, there are dedicated operating systems designed to limit the effect of malware.
yo: Bi o ba hun o lati ko imo ise-airidimu tuntun fun kika imeeli tabi kika iwe ile okeere, o ni ero isise ti yoo din ipa ise-airidimu aidara ku.

en: TAILS is a Linux-based operating system that deletes itself after you use it.
yo: TAILS je ti ero isise ti Linux to maa n pa araa re re leyin ti a ba lo o tan.

en: Qubes is another Linux-based system that carefully separates applications so that they cannot interfere with each other, limiting the effect of any malware.
yo: Qubes je ero isise miiran lori Linux ti maa n se jeje ya ise s'otooto ki won ba maa di ara won lowo, ti yoo din ipa ise-airidimu aidara ku.

en: Both are designed to work on laptop or desktop computers.
yo: Mejeeji lo n sise lorii ero-ayarabiasa agbeletan ati agbeletabili.

en: You can also submit untrusted links and files to VirusTotal, an online service that checks files and links against several different antivirus engines and reports the results.
yo: O ko le e fi isopo ati faili ti o ko fokan tan si VirusTotal, ise ori ayelujara aye faili ati isopo wo lati lodi s'oniruuru agbogunti-odu-aranka-abero-ayarabiasaje ti yoo si jihin abajade re.

en: This isn't foolproof - antivirus often fails to detect new malware or targeted attacks - but it is better than nothing.
yo: Eyi ko daju - antivirus saba maa n kuna lati ri ise-airidimu aidara tuntun tabi idojuko - sugbon o dara ju aisii re lo.

en: Any file or link that you upload to a public website, such as VirusTotal or Google Drive, can be viewed by anyone working for that company, or possibly anyone with access to that website.
yo: Failikifaili tabi isopokisopo ti o ba gbe sori ibudo-itakun-agbaye gbogboogbo, bii VirusTotal tabi Google Drive, le je wiwo fun enikeni to ba n sise fun ile-ise yen, tabi enikeni to ba ni aaye si ibudo-itakun yen.

en: If the information contained in the file is sensitive or privileged communications, you may want to consider an alternative.
yo: Bi iwifun inuu faili naa ba je eyi ti enikeji o gbodo ri, o le fe lo omiran.

en: Be Careful of Emailed Instructions
yo: Sora fun alaye inu imeeli

en: "Some phishing emails claim to be from a computer support department or technology company and ask you to reply with your passwords, or to allow a ""computer repair person"" remote access to your computer, or to disable some security feature on your device."
yo: "Awon imeeli Fisiini kan maa n paro wipe ajo alatileyin fun ile ise imo ero ni awon n se, won a si ni ki o fi oro-ifiwolee re sowo, tabi f'aaye gba ""atero ayarabiasa se"" lati wo ero ayarabiasaa re, tabi yo aabo ori eroo re kuro."

en: The email might give a purported explanation of why this is necessary, by claiming, for example, that your email box is full or that your computer has been hacked.
yo: ro nipa idi ti o ye ki o fi gbo si won lenu ni ekunrere ni ohuninu imeeli naa yoo je, fun apeere, wipe apoti imeeli re ti kun tabi wipe ole ti wo inu eroo re

en: Unfortunately, obeying these fraudulent instructions can be bad for your security.
yo: Laibosirere, gbigbo si awon odaran wonyi lenu le se akoba fun aabo re.

en: Be especially careful before giving anyone technical data or following technical instructions unless you can be absolutely certain that the request's source is genuine.
yo: Sora ki o to fun enikeni ni iwifun to le ko o sita bi omo ojo meta ayafi bi o ba daa loju wipe ibi daadaa ni asebeere naa ti wa.

en: If you are at all suspicious of an email or link someone has sent you, don't open or click on it until you've mitigated the situation with the above tips and can be confident it's not malicious.
yo: Bi ifura ba se o nipa imeeli tabi isopo ti enikan fi ranse si o, maa si i tabi sira te e afi igba ti o ba ti gbiyanju awon imoran ti a ka soke wonyi ati bi o ba ri aridaju wipe ki i se ti aburu.

en: How to: Enable Two-factor Authentication
yo: Bi a se le: f'aayegba iferiladi Olona-meji

en: "Two-factor authentication (or ""2FA"") is a way to let a user identify him or herself to a service provider by requiring a combination of two different authentication methods."
yo: Iferiladi olona-meji (tabi 2FA) ni igbese idanimo onlo nipa lilo akojopo iferiladi orisi meji lati lo ise apese.

en: These may be something that the user knows (like a password or PIN), something that the user possesses (like a hardware token or mobile phone), or something that is attached to or inseparable from the user (like their fingerprints).
yo: Eyi le je ohun ti onlo mo (bii oro-ifiwole tabi PIN), ohun ti onlo ni (bii ami ise-aridimu tabi ero-ibanisoroo), tabi nnkan ti a fimo tabi ti ko se e ya s'oto lara onlo (bii iteka won).

en: You probably already use 2FA in other parts of your life.
yo: O o ti maa lo 2FA ninu igbe ayee re.

en: When you use an ATM to withdraw cash, you must have both your physical bankcard (something you possess) and your PIN (something that you know).
yo: Bi o ba lo ATM lati gbowojade, o gbodo ni ike pelebe ile-ifowopamoo re (ohun ti o ni) ati PIN re (ohun ti o mo)

en: Right now, however, many online services only use one factor to identify their users by default - a password.
yo: Ni bayii, opo ise ori ayelujara a maa lo idanimo kan soso fun onlo won gege bii aatoabawa - oro-ifiwole.

en: How does 2FA work online?
yo: Bawo ni 2FA se n sise lori ayelujara?

en: Several online services - including Facebook, Google, and Twitter - offer 2FA as an alternative to password-only authentication.
yo: Aimoye ise ori ayelujara - titi kan Facebook, Google, ati Twitter - n pesee 2FA gege bi ona miiran fun iferiladi oro-ifiwole nikan.

en: If you enable this feature you'll be prompted for both a password and a secondary method of authentication.
yo: Bi o ba f'aayegba ise yii, wa a fi oro-ifiwole ati ona miiran se iferiladi.

en: authentication. This second method is typically either a one-time code sent by SMS or a one-time code generated by a dedicated mobile app that stores a secret (such as Google Authenticator, Duo Mobile, the Facebook app, or Clef).
yo: Ona keji ni okan ninuu SMS tabi odu aloleekan ti aapu ero alagbeeka afohunikoko pamo gege bii Aferiladi Google, Duo Mobile, aapu Facebook, tabi Clef) ti a ya s'oto fun ise yii yoo gba jade.

en: In either case, the second factor is your mobile phone, something you (normally) possess.
yo: Eyikeyii, ona keji ni ero-ibanisoroo alagbeekaa re, ohun ti o saba maa n ni.

en: Some websites (including Google) also support single-use backup codes, which can be downloaded, printed on paper, and stored in a safe location as an additional backup.
yo: Ibudo-itakun-agbaye (titi kan Google) naa nitileyin ipamo odu alaloleekan, ti eda re se e gba sori eroo re, se e te sori iwe, ati fi pamo si ibikan.

en: Once you've opted-in to using 2FA, you'll need to enter your password and a one-time code from your phone to access your account.
yo: Ni kete ti o ba ti f'owo si i lati maa lo 2FA, o nilo oro-ifiwolee re ati odu alaloleekan lati ori ero-ibanisoroo alagbeekaa re ki o to o r'aaye wo isamuloo re.

en: Why should I enable 2FA?
yo: Ki lo de ti mo fi gbodo f'aayegba 2FA?

en: 2FA offers you greater account security by requiring you to authenticate your identity with more than one method.
yo: 2FA n fun isamuloo re ni aabo to peye nipa mimu o fi eri ladi idanimoo re ju ona kan lo.

en: This means that, even if someone were to get hold of your primary password, they could not access your account unless they also had your mobile phone or another secondary means of authentication.
yo: Eyi tumo si wipe, bi enikeni ba ti e gba oro-ifiwolee re mu nipo kininni, won ko ni le e r'ona wo isamuloo re ayafi bi won ba ni ero-ibanisoroo alagbeekaa re tabi r'ona ipo-keji lo iferiladi miiran.

en: Are there downsides to using 2FA?
yo: Nje 2FA ni aleebu?

en: Although 2FA offers a more secure means of authentication, there is an increased risk of getting locked out of your account if, for example, you misplace or lose your phone, change your SIM card, or travel to a country without turning on roaming.
yo: Botilejepe 2FA n fun ni ni aabo to peye fun iferiladi, ewu atimode isamuloo re le e waye, fun apeere, o ko mo ibi ti o s'owoo ero-ibanisoro re si tabi o ti padanuu re, tabi paaro ike pelebe SIM re, tabi rinrin ajo si ilu miiran lai tan irin-kaakiri ori eroo re.

en: "Many 2FA services provide a short list of single-use ""backup"" or ""recovery"" codes."
yo: "Opo ninu ise 2FA ni n pese akasile ""apamo"" kukuru alaloleekan tabi odu ""igbapada."""

en: Each code works exactly once to log in to your account, and is no longer usable thereafter.
yo: Erinkan o le lo okookan odu yii fi wo isamuloo re, ko si wulo mo leyinwa.

en: If you are worried about losing access to your phone or other authentication device, print out and carry these codes with you.
yo: Bi okan-an re ko ba bale nipa ipadanu ero-ibanisoroo re tabi ero iferiladi miiran, te odu wonyi jade ki o si maa gbe e kiri.

en: "They'll still work as ""something you have,"" as long as you only make one copy, and keep it close."
yo: "Won yoo si sise bi ""ohun ti o ni,"" niwon igba ti o ba te eda kan soso."

en: Remember to keep the codes secure and ensure that no one else sees them or has access to them at any time.
yo: Ki o si tojuu odu naa ki o ri i daju wipe elomiran ko ri i tabi r'aaye si i nigbakuugba.

en: If you use or lose your backup codes, you can generate a new list next time you're able to log in to your account.
yo: Bi o ba lo odu akopamo tabi padanuu re, o le gba omiran jade ti o ba r'aaye wo inu isamulo re.

en: Another problem with 2FA systems that use SMS messages is that SMS messaging isn't that secure.
yo: Isoro miiran ti ero 2FA to n lo ise-ije SMS ni wipe ise-ije SMS ko l'aabo to.

en: It's possible for a sophisticated attacker who has access to the phone network (such as an intelligence agency or an organized crime operation) to intercept and use the codes that are sent by SMS.
yo: O se e se fun ogbologboo adojukoni lati r'aaye wo inuu isasopo ero-ibanisoroo re (gege bii ajo asewadii odaran tabi egbe arufin kan) lati ji ati lo odu ti a lo SMS fi ranse si o.

en: There have also been cases where a less sophisticated attacker (such as an individual) has managed to forward calls or text messages intended for one number to his or her own, or accessed telephone company services that show text messages sent to a phone number without needing to have the phone.
yo: Paapaa adojukoni ti ki i se ogbologboo ti darii ise-ije elomiran sori ilaa tire, tabi r'ona wo ile-ise apese afihan ise-ije ti a fi ranse sori ila han lai nilo ero-ibanisoro.

en: If you're worried about this level of attack, turn off SMS authentication, and only use authenticator apps like Google Authenticator or Authy.
yo: Bi okan-an re o ba bale nipa idojuko, pa iferiladi SMS, ki o si lo aapu aferiladi bii Google Authenticator tabi Authy.

en: Unfortunately this option is not available with every 2FA-enabled service.
yo: Laibosirere, asayan yii ko si laroowoto fun gbogbo ise afaayegba 2FA.

en: In addition, using 2FA means you may be handing over more information to a service than you are comfortable with.
yo: Niropo, lilo 2FA tumo si wipe o le maa gbe iwifun to po sowo ise ti o ro o lorun.

en: Suppose you use Twitter, and you signed up using a pseudonym.
yo: Bi o ba n lo Twitter, ti o si lo oruko inagije nigba ti o forukosile.

en: Even if you carefully avoid giving Twitter your identifying information, and even if you access the service only over Tor or a VPN, if you enable SMS 2FA, Twitter will necessarily have a record of your mobile number.
yo: Paapaa bi o ko ba fi idanimo lekunun rere fun Twitter, ati bi o ba wo o lorii Tor tabi VPN, bi o ba f'aayegba 2FA SMS, Twitter ko ni salai ni akosile ila ero-ibanisoroo alagbeekaa re.

en: That means that, if compelled by a court, Twitter can link your account to you via your phone number.
yo: Eyi ni pe, bi ile ejo ba pa a lase, Twitter le fi ila ero-ibanisoroo re da o mo.

en: This may not be a problem for you, especially if you already use your legal name on a given service, but if maintaining your anonymity is important, think twice about using SMS 2FA.
yo: Eyi le maa je isoro fun o, iyen bi o ba lo oruko abisoo re lori isekise, amo bi pipa idanimoo re mo ba pon dandan, se atunro nipa lilo 2FA SMS.

en: Finally, research has shown that some users will choose weaker passwords after enabling 2FA, feeling that the second factor is keeping them secure.
yo: Nipari, iwadii ti fi han wipe awon onlo kan maa n yan oro-ifiwole ti ko nipon to bi won ba f'aayegba 2FA tan, pelu ero wipe ona keji yoo daabo bo won.

en: Make sure to still choose a strong password even after enabling 2FA.
yo: Ri i daju wipe o yan oro-ifiwole ti o lagbara leyin ti o ba ti f'aayegba 2FA.

en: See our creating strong passwords guide for tips.
yo: Wo itona bi a se n seda oro-ifiwolee wa fun olobo.

en: How do I enable 2FA?
yo: Bawo ni mo se le f'aayegba 2FA?

en: This differs from platform to platform, as does the terminology used.
yo: Eyi yato lati agbegbe s'agbegbe, bee naa ni ipeloruko won yato.

en: An extensive list of sites supporting 2FA is available at https://twofactorauth.org/.
yo: Ekunrere akasile awon ibudo to l'atileyin fun 2FA wa ni https://twofactorauth.org/.

en: For the most common services, you can refer to our 12 Days of 2FA post, which shows how to enable 2FA on Amazon, Bank of America, Dropbox, Facebook, Gmail and Google, LinkedIn, Outlook.com and Microsoft, PayPal, Slack, Twitter, and Yahoo Mail.
yo: Fun awon ise to wopo, o le wo Itejade 2FA Olojo Mejilaa wa, to sapejuwe bi o se le f'aayegba 2FA lorii Amazon, Ile-Ifowopamo America, Dropbox, Facebook, Gmail ati Google, LinkedIn, Outlook.com ati Microsoft, PayPal, Slack, Twitter, ati Yahoo Mail.

en: If you want better protection against stolen passwords, read through this list and turn on 2FA for all of the important web accounts you rely on.
yo: Bi o ba fe aabo to koju osuwon ti ko ni i je ki ole le ji oro-ifiwolee re, ka akasile yii ki o si tan 2FA sile fun gbogbo isamulo ibudo-itakun-agbaye ti o se koko ti o gbekele.

en: Creating Strong Passwords Using Password Managers
yo: Lilo Alakooso Oro-Ifiwole fun Iseda Oro-ifiwole to Lagbara

en: Reusing passwords is an exceptionally bad security practice. If a bad actor gets ahold of a password that you've reused across multiple services, they can gain access to many of your accounts.
yo: Atununtunlo oro-ifiwole je ona aabo ti ko dara. Bi osere ibi ba gba oro-ifiwole ti o ti tun lo lori opolopo ise mu, won le r'ona wo inu isamulo re.

en: This is why having multiple, strong, unique passwords is so important.
yo: Tori idi eyi ni o fi dara ti o si pon dandan ki a ni opolopo oro-ifiwole to lagbara, to si yara oto.

en: Fortunately, a password manager can help.
yo: Ni rere, alakooso oro-ifiwole le seranwo.

en: A password manager is a tool that creates and stores passwords for you, so you can use many different passwords on different sites and services without having to memorize them.
yo: Alakooso oro-ifiwole ni irinse ti i maa n seda ati fi oro-ifiwole pamo fun o, ki o ba le lo oniruuru oro-ifiwole lorii oniruuru ibudo-itakun-agbaye lai si wipe o ha a s'agbari.

en: Password managers:
yo: Alakooso oro-ifiwole:

en: generate strong passwords that a human being would be unlikely to guess.
yo: Maa n sagbajade oro-ifiwole to soro fun omo-eniyan lati mo.

en: store several passwords (and responses to security questions) safely.
yo: Maa n fi ogoro oro-ifiwole si ipamo (ati esi fun ibeere aabo) pelu aabo to peye.

en: protect all of your passwords with a single master password (or passphrase).
yo: daabo bo oro-ifiwolee re pelu oro-ifiwole oluwa (tabi gbolohun ifiwole oloro kan).

en: KeePassXC is an example of a password manager that is open-source and free.
yo: KeePassXC ni irufe alakooso oro-ifiwole to je irinse isisile ofe.

en: You can keep this tool on your desktop or integrate it into your web browser.
yo: O le tojuu irinse yii sori ero-ayarabiasa agbeletabili re tabi ki o fi s'inuu asawakiri ibudo-itakun re.

en: KeePassXC does not automatically save changes you make when using it, so if it crashes after you've added some passwords, you can lose them forever.
yo: KeePassXC ki i fi ayipada ti o ba se nigba ti o ba lo o pamo funra re, bi o ba d'ase sile leyin ti o ti fi oro-ifiwole kun tile, o le padanuu re titi laelae.

en: You can change this in the settings.
yo: O le yi eyi pada ninu aato.

en: Wondering whether a password manager is the right tool for you?
yo: O n gbero boya alakooso oro-ifiwole ni irinse to to si o?

en: If a powerful adversary like a government is targeting you, it might not be.
yo: Bi ota nla bii ijoba ba n lepaa re, o le maa je bee.

en: using a password manager creates a single point of failure.
yo: Lilo alakooso oro-ifiwole maa n sedaa ikunna kan soso.

en: password managers are an obvious target for adversaries.
yo: Alakooso oro-ifiwole je ilepa gbangba fun ota.

en: research suggests that many password managers have vulnerabilities.
yo: Iwadii sini niye wipe opolopo alakooso oro-ifiwole ni ipalara le ba.

en: If you're worried about expensive digital attacks, consider something more low-tech.
yo: Bi okan-an re ko ba bale lori idojuko ori ero ayarabiasa olowo iyebiye, o le lo eyi ti ko gba wahala pupo.

en: "You can create strong passwords manually (see ""Creating strong passwords using dice"" below), write them down, and keep them somewhere safe on your person."
yo: "O le seda oro-ifiwole afowose (wo ""bi a se n lo dice fun iseda oro-ifiwole alagbara"" nisale) ko o sile, ki o tojuu re sibi to l'aabo."

en: Wait, aren't we supposed to keep passwords in our heads and never write them down?
yo: Duro, se agbari ko ni o ye ki a ha oro-ifiwole si ati ki a maa ko o sile rara?

en: Actually, writing them down, and keeping them somewhere like your wallet, is useful so you'll at least know if your written passwords go missing or get stolen.
yo: Loooto, ko buru bi a ba ko o sile, ki a si fi pamo sibikan bi asunwon ikowosi afisapo re, eyi yoo ta o ji b'oro-ifiwole ti o ko sile ba di awati tabi bi won ba ji i.

en: Creating Strong Passwords Using Dice
yo: Bi a se n lo dice fi seda oro-ifiwole alagbara

en: There are a few passwords that you should memorize and that need to be particularly strong.
yo: O ni awon oro-ifiwole alagbara ti o ye ki o ha s'agbari.

en: These include:
yo: Awon ni:

en: passwords for your device
yo: Oro-ifiwole fun eroo re

en: passwords for encryption (like full-disk encryption)
yo: Oro-ifiwole fun iyi-data-pada-si-odu-aabo (bii iyi-data-pada-si-odu-aabo diiski kikun)

en: "the master password, or ""passphrase,"" for your password manager"
yo: Oro-ifiwole oluwa, tabi gbolohun ifiwole oloro kan, fun alakooso oro-ifiwolee re

en: your email password
yo: Oro-ifiwole imeeli re.

en: One of many difficulties when people choose passwords themselves is that people aren't very good at making random, unpredictable choices.
yo: Isoro kan ti awon eeyan ba n yan oro-ifiwole funra won ni pe awon eeyan ko mo bi a se n se asayan lairotele ati alaisotele.

en: An effective way of creating a strong and memorable password is to use dice and a word list to randomly choose words.
yo: Ona iseda oro-ifiwole to lagbara ti o si se e ranti ju ni bi a ba lo dice ati akasile oro lati yan oro lairotele.

en: "Together, these words form your ""passphrase."""
yo: "Lapapo, awon oro wonyi ni ""gbolohun ifiwole oloro kan."""

en: "A ""passphrase"" is a type of password that is longer for added security."
yo: Gbolohun ifiwole oloro kan ni irufe oro-ifiwole alaabo to maa n gun.

en: For disk encryption and your password manager, we recommend selecting a minimum of six words.
yo: Fun iyi-data-pada-si-odu-aabo diiski ati alakooso oro-ifiwolee re, o kere ju, yan oro mefa.

en: Why use a minimum of six words?
yo: Ki ni se ti o fi ye ki o lo oro mefa?

en: Why use dice to pick words in a phrase randomly?
yo: Ki ni de ti o fi ye ki o fi dice se isajo oro onigbolohun kan lairotele?

en: The longer and more random the password, the harder it is for both computers and humans to guess.
yo: Bi oro-ifiwole ba se gun ati bi o se je asayan lairotele, beeni yoo se le fun ero ayarabiasaa ati eniyan lati ro.

en: here's a video explainer.
yo: fidio alalaye kan re e.

en: Try making a passphrase using one of EFF's word lists.
yo: Gbiyanju ki o lo asakale oro EFF lati se gbolohun ifiwole oloro kan.

en: If your computer or device gets compromised and spyware is installed, the spyware can watch you type your master password and could steal the contents of the password manager.
yo: Bi adojuko ba dojuko ero ayarabiasaa re tabi eroo re, ti ise-airidimu alami wa lorii re, ise-airidimu alami le maa wo o bi o ba n te oro-ifiwole oluwaa re.

en: So it's still very important to keep your computer and other devices clean of malware when using a password manager.
yo: Tori naa o pon dandan ki ero ayarabiasaa re ati eroo re o wa ni mimo, ki o maa si ise-airidimu aidara bi o ba n lo alakooso oro-ifiwole.

en: "A Word About ""Security Questions"""
yo: "Oro nipa ""ibeere aabo"""

en: "Beware of the ""security questions"" that websites use to confirm your identity."
yo: "Kiyesara fun ""ibeere aabo"" ti ibudo-itakun-agbaye n lo fi se ifesemule idanimoo re."

en: Honest answers to these questions are often publicly discoverable facts that a determined adversary can easily find and use to bypass your password entirely.
yo: Idahun ododo si ibeere wonyi maa n wa ni arowotoo gbogboogbo ti yoo si gbe eri ti ota le lo fi fo oro-ifiwolee re koja yanyan.

en: Instead, give fictional answers that no one knows but you.
yo: Kaka bee, fi idahun ti ki i se ododo ponbele ti enikan yato si iwo ko mo sile.

en: For example, if the security question asks:
yo: Fun apeere, bi ibeere aabo ba ni:

en: """What was the name of your first pet?"""
yo: Ki ni oruko eranko ile ti o feran akokoo re?

en: Your answer could be a random password generated from your password manager.
yo: Idahun re le je oro-ifiwole alairotele ti alakooso oro-ifiwolee re gbajade.

en: You can store these fictional answers in your password manager.
yo: O le fi idahun aisododo ponbele wonyi s'inuu alakooso oro-ifiwolee re.

en: Think of sites where you've used security questions and consider changing your responses.
yo: Ronu nipa ibudo-itakun ti o ti lo ibeere aabo ri ki o si gbero nipa iyipada esi re.

en: Do not use the same passwords or security question answers for multiple accounts on different websites or services.
yo: Maa lo oro-ifiwole tabi ibeere aabo kan naa fun gbogbo isamulo fun gbogbo ibudo-itakun-agbayee tabi ise.

en: Syncing Your Passwords Across Multiple Devices
yo: Imusisepo oro-ifiwolee re lorii ero gbogbo

en: Many password managers allow you to access your passwords across devices through a password-synchronizing feature.
yo: Opo alakooso oro-ifiwole n fi aaye gba oro-ifiwolee re lori gbogbo ero - nipa amusisepo.

en: This means when you sync your password file on one device, it will update it on all of your devices.
yo: Eyi ni pe bi o ba mu oro-ifiwolee re sise po lori ero kan, yoo safikun lori ero iyoku

en: "Password managers can store your passwords ""in the cloud,"" meaning encrypted on a remote server."
yo: "Alakooso oro-ifiwole le fi oro-ifiwolee re pamo ""s'inuu kukukuru,"" ti o tumo si wipe a ti yi data re pada si odu aabo sinu apese arowoto."

en: When you need your passwords, these managers will retrieve and decryptthe passwords for you automatically
yo: Bi o ba niloo oro-ifiwolee re, alakooso oro-ifiwole wonyi yoo se agbajade oro-ifiwole, yoo si tu oro-ifiwole ti a ti yi pada si odu aabo funra re.

en: Password managers that use their own servers to store or help synchronize your passwords are more convenient, but are slightly more vulnerable to attacks.
yo: Alakooso oro-ifiwole ti n fi apesee tire se ipamo tabi iranwo amusisepo oro-ifiwolee re rorun bii kaasinnkan, sugbon ipalara idojuko le ba won.

en: If your passwords are stored both on your computer and in the cloud, an attacker does not need to take over your computer to find out your passwords.
yo: Bi o ba fi oro-ifiwolee re pamo si ori ero ayarabiasa ati s'inuu kukukuru, adojukoni ko ni i lo ero ayarabiasaa re lati mo oro-ifiwolee re.

en: (They will need to break your password manager's passphrase though.)
yo: (Won ni lati fo gbolohun ifiwole oloro kan ti alakooso oro-ifiwolee re.)

en: If this is concerning, don't sync your passwords to the cloud and instead opt to store them on just your devices.
yo: Bi eyi ba kan o gbongbon, maa mu oro-ifiwolee re sise po s'inuu kukukuru, kaka bee fi won pamo sori eroo re.

en: Keep a backup of your password database just in case.
yo: Tojuu ikopamo ilee data oro-ifiwolee re tori aiiseemo.

en: Having a backup is useful if you lose your password database in a crash, or if your device is taken away from you.
yo: Akopamo wulo bi o ba padanu ile data oro-ifiwolee re latari idasesile, tabi ti eroo re ba di jiji.

en: Password managers usually have a way to make a backup file, or you can use your regular backup program.
yo: Alakooso oro-ifiwole saba maa n ni ona lati se akopamo faili, tabi ki o lo ise akopamo to wopo.

en: Multi-Factor Authentication and One-Time Passwords
yo: Iferiladi Olona pupo ati oro-ifiwole erinkan.

en: Strong, unique passwords make it much harder for bad actors to access your accounts to further protect your accounts, enable two-factor authentication
yo: Oro-ifiwole alagbara, alaraoto ki i mu u rorun fun osere ibi lati r'aaye wo isamulo re fun iferiladi olona meji.

en: Some services offer two-factor authentication (also called 2FA, multi-factor authentication, or two-step verification), which requires users to possess two components (a password and a second factor) to gain access to their account.
yo: Awon ise kan a maa fun ni iferiladi olona meji (ti a tun n pe ni 2FA, iferiladi olona pupo tabi iferiladi igbese meji), ti onlo gbodo lo ohun meji (oro-ifiwole ati ona miiran) lati r'aaye wo isamulo won.

en: The second factor could be a one-off secret code or a number generated by a program running on a mobile device.
yo: Ona keji le je odu alaloleekan tabi onka ti ero alagbeeka gbajade.

en: Two-factor authentication using a mobile phone can be done in one of two ways:
yo: Ona meji ni a le fi se iferiladi olona meji lori ero-ibanisoro alagbeeka:

en: your phone can run an authenticator application that generates security codes (such as Google Authenticator or Authy) or you can use a stand-alone hardware device (such as a YubiKey); or
yo: Ero-ibanisoroo re le sise iferiladi lati se agbajade odu aabo (gege bii Aferiladi Google tabi Authy) tabi ki o lo ero ise airidimu aladaaduro (gege bii YubiKey); tabi

en: the service can send you an SMS text message with an extra security code that you need to type in whenever you log in.
yo: Ise naa le fi atejise SMS pelu afile odu aabo ti o ni lati te nigbakuugba ti o ba fe wole.

en: If you have a choice, pick the authenticator application or stand-alone hardware device instead of receiving codes by text message.
yo: Kaka ki o gba afile odu aabo, o le yan ise iferiladi tabi ero ise-airidimu aladaaduro.

en: It's easier for an attacker to redirect these codes to their own phone than it is to bypass the authenticator.
yo: O rorun fun adojukoni lati s'atundari odu wonyi sori ero-ibanisoroo ti won ju idakoja aferiladi lo.

en: Some services, such as Google, also allow you to generate a list of one-time passwords, also called single-use passwords.
yo: Awon ise kan, gege bii Google, naa maa n f'aaye gba o lati s'agbajade akasile oro-ifiwole erinkan soso, ti a tun n pe ni oro-ifiwole alaloleekan.

en: These are meant to be printed or written down on paper and carried with you.
yo: O ye ki a te e sori iwe tabi ko o sile ki a maa gbe e kiri.

en: Each of these passwords works only once, so if one is stolen by spyware when you enter it, the thief won't be able to use it for anything in the future.
yo: Eekan soso ni okookan oro-ifiwole wonyi n sise, tori naa bi ise-airidimu alami ba ji okan, ole naa ko ni le e lo o fun ohunkohun lojo iwaju.

en: If you or your organization run your own communications infrastructure, there's free software available that can be used to enable two-factor authentication for accessing your systems.
yo: Bi iwo tabi ile-isee re ba ni irinse itakuroso tire, ise-airidimu ofe wa laroowoto ti o se e lo lati f'aayegba iferiladi olona meji lati r'aaye wo eroo re.

en: "Look for software offering implementations of the open standard ""Time-Based One-Time Passwords"" or RFC 6238."
yo: "Wa ise-airidimu ti o je ti isisile ""Oro-ifiwole Erinkan soso Adalori Akoko"" tabi RFC 6238."

en: Sometimes, You Will Need to Disclose Your Password
yo: Nigba miiran, O ni lati so Oro-ifiwolee re

en: Laws about revealing passwords differ from place to place.
yo: Ofin nipa siso oro-ifiwole yato lati ibikan de omiran.

en: In some jurisdictions you may be able to legally challenge a demand for your password while in others, local laws allow the government to demand disclosure - and even imprison you on the suspicion that you may know a password or key
yo: Nigba miiran o le ko jale ki o maa fun enikeni ni oro-ifiwolee re, nibo miiran ewewe ofin ibile f'aaye gba ijoba lati beere fun oro-ifiwole enikeni - ati paapaa fi o si atimole bi o ba je afurasi ti o mo oro-ifiwole tabi kokoro kan.

en: Threats of physical harm can be used to force someone to give up their password.
yo: A le lo ideruba ipalara ojukoroju lati fi gba oro-ifiwole lowo eeyan.

en: Or you may find yourself in a situation, such as travelling across a border, where the authorities can delay you or seize your devices if you refuse to give up a password or unlock your device.
yo: Tabi ki o ba araa re ninu isele kan, bii ririn irin ajo s'odikeji ilu, nibi ti awon alase le ti da o duro tabi gba eroo re bi o ba ko lati fun won ni oro-ifiwole tabi si eroo re.

en: How to: Circumvent Online Censorship
yo: Bi a se n: fo iteribole Ayelujara da

en: This is a short overview to circumventing online censorship, but is by no means comprehensive.
yo: Eyi ni akotan kukuru nipa ifoda iteribole ori ayelujara, sugbon ki i se ekunrere.

en: Governments, companies, schools, and Internet providers sometimes use software to prevent their users from accessing certain websites and services.
yo: Ijoba, ile-ise, ile-iwe, ati apesee ero-airidimu ti yoo di onlo lowo ki won ba maa ri aaye wo awon ibudo-itakun kan.

en: This is called Internet filtering or blocking, and it is a form of censorship.
yo: Eyi ni a pe ni ise ero-ayelujara tabi idigaga, ti i se irufe iteribole kan.

en: Filtering comes in different forms. Censors can block individual web pages, or even entire websites.
yo: Ateribolee le digaga oju iwe itakun-agbaye kan soso tabi gbogbo ibudo-itakun-agbaye po.

en: Sometimes, content is blocked based on the keywords it contains.
yo: Nigba miii, ohuninu oju iwe ori ayelujara ni i maa n fa idigaga

en: There are different ways of beating Internet censorship.
yo: Oniruuru ona ni a fi le fo iteribole ori ayelujara da.

en: Some protect you from surveillance, but many do not.
yo: Awon kan n fi aabo isoni bo o, sugbon opo o se bee.

en: When someone who controls your net connection filters or blocks a site, you can almost always use a circumvention tool to get to the information you need.
yo: Bi alakooso isasopo ayelujaraa re ba se tabi digaga ibudo kan, o le lo irinse ifoda ti yoo mu o ri iwifun ti o nilo.

en: Note: Circumvention tools that promise privacy or security are not always private or secure.
yo: Fiyesii: irinse ifoda aseleri aabo tabi ibi-ikoko ki i saba i se ti ikoko tabi ni aabo.

en: "And tools that use terms like ""anonymizer"" do not always keeps your identity completely secret."
yo: "Irinse to n lo gbolohun bii ""anonymizer"" ki i saba pa idanimoo re mo finnifinni."

en: The circumvention tool that is best for you depends on your threat model.
yo: Irinse ifoda to dara ju fun o da lorii awose ideruba re.

en: If you're not sure what your threat model is, start here.
yo: Bi awose ideruba re o ba da o loju saka to, bere nihin-in.

en: In this article, we'll talk about four ways to circumvent censorship:
yo: Ninu apileko yii, a maa soro nipa ona merin ti a le gba fo iteribole ori ayelujara da.

en: Visiting a web proxy to access a blocked website.
yo: Bibe asoju itakun wo lati wo ibudo-itakun ti a ti digagaa re.

en: Visiting an encrypted web proxy to access a blocked website.
yo: Bibe asoju itakun ti a ti yi data re pada si odu aabo lati wo ibudo-itakun ti a ti digagaa re.

en: Using a Virtual Private Network (VPN) to access blocked websites or services.
yo: Lilo Isasopo Airi Ikoko (VPN) lati wo ibudo-itakun tabi ise.

en: Using the Tor Browser to access a blocked website or protect your identity.
yo: Lilo asawakiri Tor lati wo ibudo-itakun ti a ti digagaa re tabi daabo bo idanimoo re.

en: Basic techniques
yo: Awon ipile imo

en: Circumvention tools usually work by diverting your web traffic so it avoids the machines that do the blocking or filtering.
yo: Ise ti irinse ifoda saba maa n se ni didarii data to n gba ori itakun re ki o ba ye ero to n se idigaga tabi ise kuro.

en: A service that redirects your Internet connection past these blocks is sometimes called a proxy.
yo: Ise ti i se atundarii isasopo ayelujara fo idigaga koja la n pe ni asoju n'gba miii.

en: HTTPS is the secure version of the HTTP protocol you use to access websites.
yo: HTTPS ni eda aabo fun ifenuko HTTP ti o n lo fi wo ibudo-itakun-agbaye.

en: Sometimes a censor will only block the insecure (HTTP) version of a site.
yo: Nigba miiran Ateribolee le digaga eda ibudo ailaabo (HTTP)

en: That means you can access the blocked site simply by entering the version of the web address that starts with HTTPS.
yo: Iyen ni pe o le wo ibudo ti a digaga naa bi o ba te eda adireesi ibudoo re to bere pelu HTTPS.

en: HTTPS stops censors from reading your web traffic, so they cannot tell what keywords are being sent, or which individual web page you are visiting.
yo: HTTPS maa n da ateribole duro lati maa le e ka data to n gba orii itakun re, tori naa won ko le e so oro-asina ti a fi ranse, tabi ori oju iwe itakun-agbaye ti o n bewo.

en: Censors can still see the domain names of all websites you visit.
yo: Ateribole si le ri oruko agbegbe ikapaa gbogbo ibudo-itakun-agbaye ti o ba lo.

en: "So, for example, if you visit ""eff.org/https-everywhere"" censors can see that you are on ""eff.org"" but not that you are on the ""https-everywhere"" page."
yo: "un apeere, bi o be ""eff.org/https-everywhere"" wo ateribole le ri i wipe o wa lorii ""eff.org,"" sugbon ki i se pe o wa lorii oju iwee ""https-everywhere."""

en: If you suspect this type of simple blocking, try entering https:// before the domain in place of http:
yo: Ti o ba ni ifura irufe idigaga aile bayii, gbiyanju ki o te https:// siwaju agbegbe ikapa dipo http:

en: Try installing EFF's HTTPS Everywhere extension to automatically turn on HTTPS where possible.
yo: Gbiyanju ki o gbe alatankaa EFF ibi-gbogbo ti yoo funra re tan HTTPS nibi to ba ye sori eroo re.

en: Another way that you may be able to circumvent basic censorship techniques is by trying an alternate domain name or URL.
yo: Ona miiran ti o le gba fi fo iteribole da ni bi o ba lo oruko agbegbe-ikapa miiran tabi URL.

en: For example, instead of visiting http://twitter.com, you might try the mobile version of the site at http://m.twitter.com.
yo: Fun apeere, kaka ki o be http://twitter.com wo, o le gbidanwo lati si ibudo naa lorii eda ti ero-ibanisoroo alagbeeka ni http://m.twitter.com.

en: Censors that block websites or web pages work from a blacklist of banned websites, so anything that is not on that blacklist will get through.
yo: Ateribole to digaga ibudo-itakun-agbaye tabi oju iwe itakun-agbaye n fi akasile ibudo-itakun-agbaye aidara ti a ti gbese ofin le sise, tori naa ohunkohun ti ko ba si lori akasile aidara yen yoo la iteribole koja.

en: They might not know of all different versions of a particular website's name - especially if the administrators of the site know it is blocked and register more than one domain.
yo: Won le maa mo gbogbo oniruuru eda oruko ibudo-itakun-agbaye ni pato - ju gbogbo re lo bi alakooso ibudo ba mo wipe a ti digagaa re ati pe a oruko agbegbe ikapa ti a fi sile ju okan lo.

en: Web-based proxies
yo: Asoju ori itakun-agbaye

en: A web-based proxy (such as http://proxy.org/) is a website that lets its users access other blocked or censored websites.
yo: Asoju ori itakun-agbaye (gege bii http://proxy.org/) je ibudo-itakun-agbaye ti n f'aaye gba onlo lati wo ibudo ti a digagaa re tabi terii re bole.

en: It is therefore a good way to circumvent censorship.
yo: Ona to dara lati fo iteribole da leyi.

en: In order to use a web-based proxy, visit the proxy and enter the web address that you want to see; the proxy will then display the web page you asked for.
yo: Lati lo asoju ori itakun-agbaye, be asoju naa wo ki o te adireesi ibudo-itakun ti o fe ri si i; asoju yii yoo fi ojuuwe ibudo-itakun ti o beere fun han o.

en: However, web-based proxies don't provide any security and will be a poor choice if your threat model includes someone monitoring your internet connection.
yo: Botiwukiori, asoju ori ibudo-itakun-agbaye ki i pesee aabo kankan ati pe ko ni s'enuure bi asayan awose ideruba re ba ni asoni ti n so isasopo re.

en: They will not help you to use blocked services such as your instant messaging apps.
yo: Won ko ni ran o lowo lati lo ise ti a ti digaga gege bii aapu ise-ije oniwaransesa re.

en: The web-based proxy will have a complete record of everything you do online, which can be a privacy risk for some users depending on their threat model
yo: Asoju ori ibudo-itakun-agbaye maa ni akosile ohun gbogbo ti o n se lori ayelujara, ti o le je ewu idaaabobo fun onlo miiran lori awose ideruba won.

en: Encrypted proxies
yo: Asoju ti data re ti yi pada si odu aabo

en: Numerous proxy tools utilize encryption to provide an additional layer of security on top of the ability to bypass filtering.
yo: Oke aimoye irinse asoju to n lo iyi-data-pada-sodu-aabo lati pese ipele iropo aabo lori agbara idakoja ise.

en: The connection is encrypted so others cannot see what you are visiting.
yo: Isasopo naa ti yii data pada si odu aabo ki elomiran o maa ba a le ri ibi ti o n bewo.

en: While encrypted proxies are generally more secure than plain web-based proxies, the tool provider may have information about you.
yo: Nigba ti asoju ti data re ti yi pada si odu aabo l'aabo to peye ju asoju ori itakun-agbaye lo, apese irinse naa le ri iwifun nipaa re.

en: They might have your name and email address in their records, for instance.
yo: Fun apeere, won le ni oruko ati adireesi imeeli re lakosile.

en: That means that these tools do not provide full anonymity.
yo: Iyen tumo si wipe irinse wonwonyi ki i pesee ailoruko doju ala.

en: "The simplest form of an encrypted web proxy is one that starts with ""https"" - this will use the encryption usually provided by secure websites."
yo: "Asoju itakun-agbaye ti data re ti yi pada si odu aabo to rorun ju ni ""https"" - eyi yoo lo iyi-data-pada-sodu-aabo ti ibudo-itakun-agbaye to l'aabo pese."

en: However, be cautious - the owners of these proxies can see the data you send to and from other secure websites.
yo: Sibe, sora - awon to ni asoju wonyi le ri data ti o fi ranse si ati bo wa lati ibudo-itakun-agbaye aabo miiran.

en: Ultrasurf and Psiphon are examples of these tools.
yo: UltraSurf ati Psiphon je apeere irinse bawonyi.

en: Virtual Private Networks
yo: Isasopo Airi Ikoko

en: A Virtual Private Network (VPN) encrypts and sends all Internet data from your computer through another computer.
yo: Isasopo Airi Ikoko (VPN) maa n yi data pada si odu aabo, yoo si fi gbogbo data ranse lati ori ero-ayelujaraa re sorii ero ayarabiasa miiran.

en: This computer could belong to a commercial or nonprofit VPN service, your company, or a trusted contact.
yo: Ero ayarabiasa yii le je ti ileese isowo kan tabi ile-ise aijeere apesee VPN, ile isee re, tabi eni mimo.

en: Once a VPN service is correctly configured, you can use it to access webpages, e-mail, instant messaging, VoIP, and any other Internet service.
yo: Ni kete ti isee VPN ba ti wa, o le lo o fi wo oju iwe itakun-agbaye, imeeli, ise-ije oniwaransesa VoIP, ati ise ori ero ayelujara to ku.

en: A VPN protects your traffic from being spied on locally, but your VPN provider can still keep logs of the websites you access, or even let a third party snoop directly on your web browsing.
yo: VPN maa n daabo bo iwifun to n koja lori ayelujara ki awon alami ma ba a ri i lagbegbe kan, sugbon apesee VPN re si le se akosile ibudo-itakun-agbaye ti o wo, tabi je ki eniketa yo kele wo inuu asawarikiri ayelujaraa re.

en: Depending on your threat model, the possibility of a government listening in on your VPN connection or getting hold of VPN logs may be a significant risk.
yo: O da lorii awose ideruba re, o se e se ki ijoba o maa fetiko isasopo VPN re tabi gbigba akosile VPN re mu le di ewu nla.

en: For some users, this could outweigh the short-term benefits of using a VPN.
yo: Fun onlo miiran, eyi le lagbara ju f'anfaani to wa ninu lilo VPN fun igba die.

en: For information about specific VPN services, click here.
yo: Fun alaye nipa awon ise VPN ni pato, sira te ibi.

en: We at EFF cannot vouch for this rating of VPNs.
yo: Ni EFF a ko le e jerii si VPN wonyi.

en: Some VPNs with exemplary privacy policies could be run by devious people.
yo: VPN miiran ti o ni ilana aabo to yara oto le je ti odaran.

en: Do not use a VPN that you do not trust.
yo: O ko gbodo lo VPN ti o ko fi okan tan.

en: Tor is open-source software designed to give you anonymity on the web.
yo: Tor je ise-airidimu orisun-isisile ti a se ki idanimoo re o ba wa nipamo lori itakun agbaye.

en: Tor Browser is a web browser built on top of the Tor anonymity network.
yo: Asawarikiri itakun-agbaye ni asawarikiri Tor ti a ko sorii isasopo ailoruko onlo Tor.

en: Because of how Tor routes your web browsing traffic, it also allows you to circumvent censorship.
yo: Nitori bi Tor se n gbe data ka lori asawarikiri ibudo-itakun re, o gba o laaye lati fo iteribole da.

en: (See our How to: Use Tor guides for Linux, macOS and Windows).
yo: (Wo bi a se n: lo itona Tor fun Linux, macOS ati Windows)

en: When you first start the Tor Browser, you can choose an option specifying that you are on a network that is censored:
yo: Bi o ba si Asawarikiri Tor, o le se asayan afihan wipe orii isasopo ti a terii re bole lo wa:

en: Tor will not only bypass almost all national censorship, but, if properly configured, can also protect your identity from an adversary listening in on your country's networks. It can, however, be slow and difficult to use.
yo: Tor ko ni fo iteribole opo ilu koja nikan, sugbon, bi o ba fase fun un bi o se ye, o le daabo bo idanimoo re ki o maa bo s'owo ota to n teti si isasopo iluu re. Sibe, o le maa fa tiko, ko si rorun ni lilo.

en: "To learn how to use Tor on a desktop machine, click here for Linux, here for macOS, or herefor Windows, but please be sure to tap ""Configure"" instead of ""Connect"" in the window displayed above."
yo: "Lati ka bi o se le lo Tor lori ero ayarabiasa agbeletabili, sira te ibi fun Linux, ibi fun MacOS, tabi ibi fun Windows, amo jowo ri i daju wipe o f'owoto ""configure"" dipo ""connect"" ninu aworan ferese oke."

en: "Workers"" Day Celebration: House Speaker tasks Nigerian workers on productivity"
yo: ---Ajodun osise: Abenugan ile-igbimo asoju ro osise lati teramo ise fun abajade rere.

en: "The Speaker of the Nigerian House of Representatives Mr Femi Gbajabiamila has congratulated the Nigerian workers for marking this year's International Workers"" Day."
yo: Abenugan ile-igbimo asoju ti Naijiria, Femi Gbajabiamila, ti ki awon osise orile-ede yii ku oriire fun ti ajodun ayajo awon osise lagbaaye.

en: Mr Gbajabiamila said although the day is being marked quietly across the globe as a result of the lockdown necessitated by the COVID-19 pandemic, there is much to remember about the sacrifices made by Nigerian workers.
yo: Ogbeni Gbajabiamila ni bo tile je pe ayeye yii waye laisi ariwo ni gbogbo agbaye nitori ase konile-gbele latari itankale aarun COVID-19, ohun ti a le ranti po nipa awon irubo ti awon osise Naijiria se.

en: "In a statement marking the Workers"" Day signed by his Special Adviser on Media and Publicity, Lanre Lasisi, the Speaker commended the Nigerian workers for their commitment and dedication to work over the years, which he said has shaped the country tremendously."
yo: Ninu atejade to n sami ojo awon osise eyi ti Oludamoran re Pataki lori iroyin ati ikede fowosi, Lanre Lasisi, Abenugan gbosuba fun awon osise Naijiria nitori ifarajin ati ipa ribiribi ti won ko fun opo odun seyin, eyi to mu iyipada rere ba Naijiria.

en: He, however, called on Nigerian workers to be more productive now and always, saying no matter what was achieved before now must be sustained and improved upon for the country to achieve more.
yo: Sibe, o ro awon osise Naijiria ki won tunbo maa so eso rere nisisinyi ati gbogbo igba, nitori aseyori ana nilo itesiwaju ki a sise sii ki orile-ede yii lee ni aseyori sii.

en: """I want to salute the courage of Nigerian workers, who have over the years given their best to their work."
yo: """Mo fe ki awon osise Naijiria fun okan-akin, awon ti won ti fi gbogbo ipa won sise."

en: Indeed Nigeria and Nigerians are proud of you.
yo: Nitooto, Naijiria ati awon omo Naijiria fi yin yangan.

en: I urge the Nigerian workers to redouble their efforts at this time of our national development.
yo: Mo ro awon osise Naijiria lati fikun okun won ni iru akoko idagbasoke orile ede wa yii.

en: "They must continue to put in their best in the work that they do for the betterment of the country."""
yo: "Won gbodo tesiwaju lati fi gbogbo agbara won se ise ti won n se fun anfaani orile ede"""

en: --- May Day: Senate President felicitates with Nigerian workers
yo: --- Ayajo awon Osise: Olori ile-igbimo asofin agba ki awon osise Naijiria

en: "President of the Nigerian Senate, Ahmad Lawan, has felicitated with Nigerian workers as they join their counterparts the world over to mark the Workers"" Day."
yo: Aare ile-igbimo asofin agba ti Naijiria, Ahmad Lawan, ki awon osise orile-ede yii bi won se sowopo pelu awon akegbe won lagbaaye lati se ajodun ojo awon osise.

en: Senator Lawan also congratulated Nigerian workers for sustaining their heroic struggle for the liberation of the country from poverty and underdevelopment even in the face of the daunting challenges at various workplaces.
yo: Asofin Lawan tun gbosuba fun awon osise fun gudugudu meje, yaya mefa ti won n se lati mu orile-ede kuro ninu osi ati aini idagbasoke ati kikoju awon ipenija amuniberu lenu ise oniruuru.

en: He acknowledged the role of workers as the creator of wealth in society and stressed that it is for this reason that they should be appreciated at all times.
yo: O mo riri ipa awon osise gege bii eni to n mu oro wa si awujo, o tenumo wipe eyi ni a se gbodo mo riri won ni gbogbo igba.

en: The best way to appreciate the enormous contributions of the Nigerian workers is to always consider their welfare as of utmost importance.
yo: "O tesiwaju pe ""ona to dara julo lati mo riri ipa ribiribi ti awon osise ko ni lati mojuto eto igbaye-gbadun won."

en: """As a legislature, we are ever ready to work in collaboration with the organised labour Unions to rid our statute books of any anti-labour laws,"" Lawan said."
yo: "Lawan so wipe, ""Gege bi ile-igbimo asofin, a ti setan lati fowosowopo pelu egbe awon osise lati sofin to lodi si iwa ibaje si osise lenu ise."""

en: The Senate President said as part of the effort of the 9th National Assembly to strengthen the economy and improve the standard of living of the people, it is determined to make the country's financial year predictable through the timely passage of the 2020 budget.
yo: Aare ile-igbimo asofin agba so wipe, gege bii ara akitiyan ile-igbimo asofin kesan-an lati fi okun fun eto oro aje ati lati mu igbe-aye awon eniyan dara sii, ti pinu lati mu ki eto isuuna odun yii see daadaa nipa titete bu owo lu iwe eto isuna odun 2020.

en: According to Senator Lawan, the National Assembly has in the same respect made critical amendments to some laws to ensure smooth implementation of the budget.
yo: Ninu oro Asofin Lawan, ile-igbimo asofin agba bakan naa ti se atunse si awon ofin kookan lati ri wipe imulo eto isuna naa loo bi o ti ye.

en: He said the Legislature would continue to move relentlessly in that direction, despite the unforeseen challenges posed by the COVID-19 pandemic.
yo: O so wipe awon Asofin yoo maa lo ni ilana yii laiwo awon ipenija ajakale aarun COVID-19.

en: "The Senate President noted that this year's celebration of Workers"" Day comes at a time the entire world is facing the health emergency brought about by the Coronavirus pandemic."
yo: Aare ile-igbimo asofin se akiyesi wipe ayeye ojo awon osise ti odun yii waye lasiko ti gbogbo orile ede agbaye n koju ajakale aarun ojiiji COVID-19.

en: """It is the resilience and never-die spirit of the Nigerian people that will boost the efforts of the government to overcome the pandemic,"" he stated."
yo: "O wipe ""Okan akinkanju ati emi ti kii ku ti awon eniyan Naijiria nii ni yoo ran ise ijoba lowo lati lee bori ajakale aarun naa"""

en: The Senate President urged the Nigerian workers, as they mark their day, to adhere strictly to all the prescribed public health protocols of social distancing, wearing of face mask, use of hand sanitizer, observance of personal hygiene, and to endeavour to stay at home and stay safe.
yo: """Aare ile igbimo asofin wa ro awon osise lorile ede Naijiria bi won se n sami ojo won, lati maa tele ilana eto ilera lawujo, fifi aaye saarin ara wa, ki a maa wo iboju, ki a maa lo oun elo ifowo apakokoro, ki a maa se imototo ara wa ati lati maa duro sile ki a si daabo bo ara wa."

en: --- COVID 19: another twenty four (24) people were tested positive in Nigeria.
yo: --- COVID-19: Awon eniyan merinlelogun (24) miiran tun jeyo lorile ede Naijiria

en: Another twenty-four (24) people were tested positive for corona virus (COVID 19) in Nigeria this made the total of infected people to be one thousand, nine hundred and thirty-two (1932) when three hundred and nineteen (319) have been discharged, and fifty-eight (58) are dead. The Nigeria centre for disease control (NCDC) announced this on their twitter handle @NCDC.gov.
yo: Awon eniyan merilelogun (24) miiran tun ti jeyo ti won ni aarun Corona (COVID 19) lorileede Naijiria, eyi to je ki iye awon to ni aarun Corona je ogbonleleedegbaa le meji (1932), nigba ti awon eniyan bi mokandinlogunleloodunrun (319) ti gba iwosan, ti awon eniyan mejidinlogota (58) si ti je Olorun nipe. Ajo to n gbogun ti ajakale aarun ti Naijiria (NCDC) lo kede yii lori ero Twitter won, @NCDC. gov.

en: --- COVID 19: We have received some news about the happening in Kano - Dr. Osagie
yo: --- COVID-19: A ti gba iroyin die lori isele ni Kano- Dokita Osagie

en: The Minister for health in Nigeria Dr. Osagie Ehanire has said they have received some news on the happening in Kano state.
yo: Minisita fun eto ilera ti Naijiria, Dokita Osagie Ehanire ti ni awon ri iroyin die gba nipa isele oniruuru ni ipinle Kano.

en: The minister said this in a daily interview of the federal Government in charge of fighting against COVID 19 with journalist in Abuja.
yo: Minisita soro yii lasiko eto iforowanilenuwo ojoojumo ti igbimo ijoba apapo to n mojuto gbigbogun ti aarun COVID-19 n se pelu awon akoroyin niluu Abuja.

en: He continued that they are expecting the news about the sudden death in Kano state, and this help them to take step of providing the instrument, the professionals and the training to help stop COVID- 19 in Kano state.
yo: O tun tesiwaju pe awon si n reti gbogbo iroyin nipa isele iku ojiji to waye ni ipinle Kano, eleyii yoo ran igbese pipese eto iranwo irinse , awon onimo ati eto eko ti won yoo fun ipinle Kano lati dekun aarun COVID-19.

en: Dr Ehanire, now appealed health workers to follow the line of programmes to protect themselves always so that they will not be infected by COVID -19 or endanger themselves.
yo: Dokita Ehanire , wa ro awon osise eto ilera lati maa tele eto ilana lati daabo bo ara won nigba gbogbo ki won maa baa lugbadi aarun COVID-19 tabi fi ara won sinu ewu.

en: --- Nigeria confirms 204 cases of COVID-19
yo: --- Naijiria sawari awon alarun COVID-19 merinlelugba

en: Nigeria has recorded 204 cases of the novel Coronavirus known as COVID-19, bringing the total number of the confirmed cases to 1932.
yo: Naijiria ti ni akosile eniyan merinlelugba ti won ni aarun korona ti a mo si COVID - 19, eyi to mu gbogbo akarun naa je ogbonleleedegbaa le meji (1932).

en: There are 319 Discharged and 58 Deaths.
yo: Okooleloodunrun din okan (319) gba iwosan, mejidinlogota si ku.

en: On its official Twitter handle @NCDCgov, the Nigeria Centre for Disease Control, NCDC, showed the breakdown of the new cases;
yo: Ajo a-gbogun-ti-ajakale-aarun ti Naijiria (NCDC) lo so eyi lori ero abeyefo @NCCDCgov;

en: 204 new cases of #COVID19 reported;
yo: Alarun COVID-19 merinlelugba ti farahan;

en: 80-Kano 45-Lagos 12-Gombe 9-Bauchi 9-Sokoto 7-Borno 7-Edo 6-Rivers 6-Ogun 4-FCT 4-Akwa Ibom 4-Bayelsa 3-Kaduna 2-Oyo 2-Delta 2-Nasarawa 1-Ondo 1-Kebbi 11:50pm 30th April- 1932 confirmed cases of #COVID19 in Nigeria Discharged.
yo: Ogorin-Kano, marundinlaadota-Eko, mejila-Gombe, mesan-an-Bauchi, mesan-an-Sokoto, meje-Borno, meje-Edo, mefa-Rivers, mefa-Ogun, merin-Abuja, merin-Akwa Ibom, merin-Bayelsa, meta-Kaduna, meji-Oyo, meji-Delta, meji-Nasarawa, Okan-Ondo, Okan-Kebbi. Ni agogo mejila ku iseju mewaa, ogbon ojo osu igbe - 1932 alarun Covid-19 farahan ni Naijiria.

en: --- COVID-19: Ministerial Task Team on Kano submits interim report
yo: --- COVID-19: Iko osise minisita ti Kano sagbekale iroyin gba-a-gbe

en: The Ministerial Task Team on fact-finding mission to Kano has submitted an interim report to the Federal Ministry of Health, on the needs, strengths and weaknesses of the Kano response system.
yo: Iko osise minisita lori ise iwadii si Kano, ti se agbekale iroyin gba-a-gbe fun ile-ise ijoba apapo ti ilera, lori idi, okun ati ailera ona ti ipinle Kano se n dahun.

en: The Minister of Health, Dr Osagie Ehanire said this at the daily joint press briefing by the Presidential Task Force on Covid-19, in Abuja, Nigeria.
yo: Minisita fun ilera, Dokita Osagie Ehanire soyi ninu ipade apapo pelu awon oniroyin eyi ti igbimo ijoba apapo to n mojuto COVID-19 ni Abuja se.

en: He said while the Ministry awaits a full report, the interim report will be a guide in supporting Kano State COVID-19 Task force with necessary material, training and human resources.
yo: O ni bi ile-ise ijoba apapo se n reti iroyin kikun, iroyin gba-a-be yii yoo je atona ninu iranwo fun iko agbogunti Covid-19 ti Kano pelu eroja to ye, idanilekoo ati awon eniyan aranilowo.

en: """They will include assembling and dispatching a technical team from FMOH and virus Infectious disease specialists from Irrua Specialist hospital to join a technical team from Lagos Ministry of Health that is already on ground in Kano at the request of the Governor of Kano State"" he said."
yo: """ Lara awon ohun iranwo ni kiko ati riran awon egbe onimo lati FMOH ati awon onimo nipa kokoro aarun lati ile-iwosan Irrua Specialist Hospital lati darapo mo egbe onimo ile-ise eto ilera ni ipinle Eko ti o ti n sise ni ipinle Kano nitori Gomina ipinle Kano"""

en: He said there will also be a good pool of experienced hands-on experts to support the leading role of Kano State in the response.
yo: Gege bi idahun, o tun so pe awon onimo oniriiri yoo po jaburata ni ikale lati kin awon osise isaaju leyin ni ipinle Kano.

en: """An emergency medical team from FHOH has left Abuja with ambulances, five of which were kindly donated by FRSC, on their way to Kano to provide emergency response in view of movement restrictions arising from the lockdown."""
yo: """Egbe onisegun to n dahun ipe pajawiri lati FMOH ti kuro ni Abuja pelu awon ambulansi, marun-un ni ajo eso oju popo (FRSC) fi tore, lona lati lo si ipinle Kano fun idahun pajawiri latarii ase konilegbele."

en: Dr Ehanire restated the need for health workers to stringently follow laid down standard infection prevention and control measures at all times and not to take risks.
yo: Dokita Ehanire tun sodi ti awon osise ilera se gbodo tele awon ilana ipara-eni-mo fun aarun ni gbogbo igba, ki won maa si fi emi won wewu.

en: """We cannot afford to lose the service of essential manpower at this time; every client should be treated with a high index of suspicion for COVID-19, but treat every client with fairness so that persons suffering from other ailments do not suffer neglect or treatment refusal."""
yo: """A ko lee gba lati padanu awon osise pataki niru akoko bayii; gbogbo eniyan ni won gbodo toju pelu ifura to ga fun COVID-19 sugbon ki won toju gbogbo eniyan lai sojusaaju ki awon elomiran pelu aisan ma baa jiya aidasi tabi ki won ma toju won."""

en: """It is not ethical to turn clients away without, at least a medical advice, neither should a person in distress be refused care in emergency situation"" he said."
yo: "O wipe, ""O je ohun aidara lati le awon eniyan lo laisi imoran nipa eto ilera tabi ki a fi itoju du eni ti o nilo itoju ni pajawiri."""

en: --- Re-opening of schools not yet in view - Minister
yo: --- Sisi awon ile-eko ko tii farahan - Minisita

en: The Minister of State for Education, Emeka Nwajiuba says he cannot for-see or immediately tell when schools will be reopened.
yo: Minisita ipinle fun eto eko, Emeka Nwajiuba ni oun ko lee sojo tabi igba ti won yoo pada si ile-eko.

en: The Minister also said re-opening of schools will be in tandem with President Muhammadu Buhari's gradual ease of the lockdown put in place to curb the spread of COVID-19.
yo: Minisita tesiwaju pe sisi awon ile-eko yoo je ni sise-n-tele pelu bi Aare Muhammadu Buhari se n gbese kuro lori ase konile-gbele ti o wa lati kapa aarun korona.

en: Nwajiuba who had earlier during the daily briefing said that the government is not ready to put the lives of children at risk, warned that no school should engage students except when a formal date of resumption is announced by the government.
yo: Nwajiuba, ninu oro re lojojumo ti so saaju wipe ijoba ko setan lati fi emi awon omo wewu, o wa kilo wipe ile-eko kokan ko gbodo bere eto eko nile-eko won ayafi ojo ti ijoba ba kede re pe ki ile-eko wole.

en: """ In anyway none of these schools can function outside the society."""
yo: """Ni kukuru, ko si eyikeyi ninu awon ile-eko yii to le si leyin odi."

en: The Minister also said that all entrance examinations that had been postponed will hold when the government is satisfied that the students have understood the syllabus as planned.
yo: Minisita tun so pe gbogbo awon idanwo igbaniwole ti won ti sun siwaju ni yoo di sise nigba ti ijoba ba ri daju pe gbogbo eto-eko ti won gbekale lo ye awon akekoo.

en: The Minister clarified that both the West African Examination Council for Senior School Students and other National Examinations including NABTEB are not cancelled but only postponed.
yo: Minisita se alaye pe idanwo awon akekoo oniweemewaa (WAEC) ati awon idanwo apapo (NECO) pelu NABTEB ni ko i di fifagile sugbon ti won sun siwaju.

en: He acknowledged challenges in the deployment of the e-learning policy hence the engagement of the State Universal Basic Education Boards.
yo: O soro nipa ipenija ti eko ori ayelujara ti a sese mu wole ati bi a se mu eto eko gbogboogbo ni ipinle lo.

en: "According to him,"" we know some are limited by access and the access is limited by device, some can only get on the continuation of their academic program via radio, some at the television level, some are using computer online system, so we are doing this in partnership with states meaning that every gap we intend to bridge as regards the education of these children nationwide, we had to pass through every state Governor through their SUBEBS"""
yo: "Gege bi o se so, ""A mo wipe awon kan ko ni anfaani ati aiko ni anfaani yii nitori aiko ni ero to kun oju osuwon, awon kan le tesiwaju ninu eko won lori redio, awon kan lori telifisan, awon kan si n lo ero ayara-bi-asa pelu ayelujara, nitori naa a n se eyi pelu ajosisepo ijoba ipinle, eyi tumo si pe gbogbo alafo ti a fe di to niise pelu eko awon omo jakejado orile-ede yii, a nilo lati gba odo Gomina ipinle kookan nipase ajo eko alakoobere kariaye SUBEBS"""

en: """Presently we have time table for 31 states out of 36 states, which means via Radio or T.v, teaching and learning are ongoing, these are time tables that suit each state but the federal government has only provided guideline via online content"""
yo: """Ni bayii a ti ni eto ilana eko fun awon ipinle mokanlelogbon ninu ipinle merindinlogoji, eyi tumo si wipe lati ori redio tabi telifisan, ikoni ati ikekoo n lo, eyi je awon ilana ikekoo to dara fun ipinle kookan sugbon ijoba apapo ti se ilana lati ori ayelujara."""

en: """Using these SUBEBs ,the same way we share their interventions with them is the same way this teaching and learning online content is been shared and the FG informed that they could use state media that is appropriate in their areas."" Nwajiuba said."
yo: "Nwajiuba so wipe ""Lilo awon SUBEB, ona ti a n gba momi ogbon won ni a se fi pin kiko ati mimo yii lori ero ayelujara. Ijoba apapo si so wipe won lee lo awon ile-ise igbohun safefe ti ipinle won to dara fun un."""

en: The Minister added that the COVID 19 pandemic has helped all stakeholders to retool and has also helped everybody to get on board.
yo: Minisita safikun pe ajakale aarun COVID-19 ti ran awon olokoowo gbogbo lowo lati tunramu, o si ti ran enikookan lati bo soju ise.
