en: """To strengthen private-sector-led support for the COVID-19 pandemic, the NGF Secretariat will serve as the coordination mechanism by tracking the COVID-19 essential needs of all states including equipment for contact tracing/sample collection, diagnosis and treatment."
yo: Egbe to se atenumo idi fun fowosowopo laarin eto ilera ijoba apapo, ajo amojuto aarun ni Naijiria (NCDC) ati awon ile-ise ni ipinle lati kin igbese idena itankale aarun naa.

en: The governors also agreed to hold weekly teleconference meetings to receive regular updates from all states and maintain a coordinated response to the pandemic.
yo: Awon gomina tun fenuko lati maa sepade po loore-koore ati lose-ose lori ero ayelujara lori aarun corona ati igbese ti won n gbe lori re.

en: Fayemi briefed the governors on various state-level coordination with the Presidential Task Force on COVID-19 and the private sector through the Food, Beverages and Pharmaceuticals Association led by the Manufacturers Association of Nigeria (MAN).
yo: Fayemi so fun awon gomina nipa igbese tIko ijoba apapo amojuto aarun Korona n gbe ati awon ile-ise aladaani, nipase ipese ounje, ohun mimu ati egbe oloogun eyi tegbe a-sohun-tita ti Naijiria (MAN) dari.

en: The other private sector bodies included the MTN Foundation and the donor group led by Aliko Dangote and Herbert Wigwe.
yo: Awon Ile-ise aladaani yooku ni MTN Foundation ati awon egbe a-fi-nnkan le eyi ti Aliko Dangote ati Herbert Wigwe dari.

en: The communique stated that the governors also received an update from the Minister of Health, Dr Osagie Ehanire, and the Director-General of the NCDC, Dr Chikwe Ihekweazu, on the Federal Government's efforts to stop the spread of COVID-19.
yo: Atejade naa ni awon gomina tun gba iroyin laipe lati odo minisita fun eto ilera, Dr Osagie Ehanire, ati oludari ajo NCDC, Dr Chikwe Ihekweazu, lori igbese ti ijoba apapo n gbe lati dekun itankale aarun COVID-19 lorileede.

en: It added that the duo also updated the governors on plans to increase the capacity of states to improve testing and care for COVID-19 cases.
yo: O fikun-un pe awon mejeeji fun awon gomina niroyin loorekoore lori eto lati mu ibi ayewo ati itoju alarun korona ni awon ipinle gbooro si.

en: --- COVID-19: Chief of Staff to President Buhari speaks on his status
yo: --- COVID-19: Oludari osise fun Aare Buhari soro lori ipo re

en: The Chief of Staff to President Buhari, Abba Kyari, says he feels well but will be transferred to Lagos for additional tests and observation following his testing positive to COVID-19.
yo: Oludari osise fun aare orile ede Naijiria, Abba Kyari, ti ni ko si ohun to se ilera oun sugbon oun yoo lo fun ayewo aarun Corona miiran ni ipinle Eko.

en: The chief of Staff who disclosed this Sunday via twitter @NGRPresident said he made his own care arrangements to avoid further burdening the health system that is already under much pressure.
yo: Adari oun soro lojo Aiku lori ero twitter re @NGRPresident so pe oun ti seto itoju fun ara oun lati lee din wahala awon osise eleto ilera ti won bo ku.

en: """I have made my own care arrangements to avoid further burdening the public health system, which faces so many pressures,"" Kyari said."
yo: """Mo ni awon alaboojuto temi nitori atile din wahala eto ilera ilu ku, ti won n koju ipenija,"" Kyari lo so eyi."

en: Kyari said he has feels well and has neither experienced high fever nor other symptoms associated with the virus.
yo: Kyari ni ara oun bale ati pe oun ko ni iriri gbigbona ati awon ohun ailera miiran to ro mo arun ohun.

en: """Like many others that will also test positive, I have not experienced high fever or other symptoms associated this new virus and have been working from home."
yo: """Gege bi opolopo eniyan to je alarun korona, emi ko tii ni iriri igbonara tabi awon ohun ailera miiran to nii se pelu aarun Corona."

en: I hope to be back at my desk very soon.
yo: Mo n se ise mi lati ile, mo si ni ireti pe maa tete pada senuuse.

en: I have a team of young, professional, knowledgeable and patriotic colleagues, whose dedication has been beyond the call of duty, who continue to work seven days a week, with no time of the day spared.
yo: Mo lawon odo , onimo, ologbon ati afifesise alabaasisepo , ti won si n sise lojo meje laarin ose , ti ko sojo kan fun isinmi.

en: "We will continue to serve the president and people of Nigeria, as we have for the past five years,"" Kyari added."
yo: "A o tun tesiwaju bi a ti n se lati bi odun marunun seyin lati maa sin aare ati awon eniyan orile ede Naijiria."" Kyari safikun."

en: Statement by Chief of Staff to the President, on his health status:
yo: Oro lati enu Oludari awon osise ti Aare, nipa ipo ilera re:

en: "He's stable & feels well - Transferring to Lagos for additional tests & observation - ""I have made my own care arrangements to avoid further burdening the public health system, which faces so many pressures."""
yo: "Ara re bale o si wapa- Lilo si Eko fun ayewo ati itoju si - ""Mo ni awon alaboojuto temi nitori atile din wahala eto ilera ilu ku, ti won n koju ipenija."""

en: He thanked health workers who are working across the country who put their lives on the line for the citizens of Nigeria. He also praised Nigerians for looking out for the vulnerable in their midst.
yo: O tun dupe lowo awon osise eleto ilera to n sise jake-jado Naijiria, ti won n femi ara won wewu fun omo Naijiria gbogbo. O tun gbosuba fun omo Naijiria nitori itoju ti won fun alaini.

en: Kyari appealed for calm while advising Nigerians to observe proper hygiene, listen to advice from good authorities, ignore fake news and obey instructions on social distancing.
yo: Kyari ro omo Naijiria fun suuru nigba igbaninimoran lori imototo ara, gbigba imoran rere latodo awon adari, kotiikun si awon iroyin oniro ati titele itosona ijinna-sira-eni.

en: --- COVID-19: those that tested positive for corona virus in Nigeria are now one hundred and eleven (111)
yo: --- COVID-19: Awon ti won sayewo fun to si ni aarun corona ni Naijiria ti di mokanlelaadofa (111)

en: Center for disease control in Nigeria (NCDC) has announced that another fourteen people have tested positive for corona virus (COVID-19) in Nigeria. Nine (9) from Lagos state and five (5) from the federal capital territory, Abuja.
yo: Ile- ise to n gbogun ti ajakale aarun (NCDC) lorileede Naijiria ti kede pe awon merinla miiran ti ni aarun Corona (COVID-19) lorileede yii. Awon mesan an ni ipinle Eko ati marun un ni FCT, Abuja.

en: From half past nine (9:30) on 29th those that have corona virus are one hundred and eleven, with one death, but Lagos state is still leading with sixty (68) people infected.
yo: Lati aago mesan-an aabo, lojo kokandinlogbon, awon to ni aarun Corona ti di mokanlelaadofa, okan ku, sugbon ipinle Eko lo si n gbegba oroke bayii pelu alarun eniyan to je mejidinlaadorin.

en: --- COVID-19: President Buhari orders lockdown of Lagos, Ogun and FCT
yo: --- COVID-19:Aare Buhari pase pe ki won ti Eko, Ogun ati Abuja (FCT) pa

en: In a bid to contain the spread of the novel coronavirus also known as COVID-19, the Nigerian President, Muhammadu Buhari has ordered the total lockdown of Lagos State, Ogun State and the Federal Capital Territory.
yo: Lona ati dekun aarun Corona , ti a mo si COVID-19 , aare orile ede Naijiria, Muhammadu Buhari ti pase pe ki o maa si wiwole tabi jijade yala awon eniyan tabi oko niluu Eko , Ogun ati Abuja.

en: The President, who gave the order in a nationwide broadcast on Sunday evening, stated that the lockdown would take effect from 11pm on the 30th of March 2020.
yo: Aare soro yii lasiko to n se igbohunsafefe, laasaale ojo Aiku, pe ofin wiwole tabi jijade yoo bere ni aago mokanla, ogboojo, osu keta, odun 2020.

en: """Based on the advice of the Federal Ministry of Health and the NCDC, I am directing the cessation of all movements in Lagos and the FCT for an initial period of 14 days with effect from 11pm on Monday, 30th March 2020."
yo: Nipa imoran lati odo awon ajo to n mojuto eto ilera ati ajo to n mojuto gbigbogun ti aarun lorile ede Naijiria, nitori naa mo pase, pe ko ni si wiwole tabi jijade niluu Eko, Ogun ati FCT Abuja fun odidi ojo merinla gbako bere lati aago mokanla, ogboojo, osu keta,odun 2020.

en: "This restriction will also apply to Ogun State due to its close proximity to Lagos and the high traffic between the two States."""
yo: Ohun to faa ti ipinle Ogun ni pe ipinle naa sunmo ipinle Eko ati bi awon oko se po ni awon ipinle mejeeji naa.

en: """All citizens in these areas are to stay in their homes. Travel to or from other states should be postponed."
yo: Gbogbo awon to wa ni awon ipinle wonyi gbodo wa ninu igbele. Ko ni si eto irinna lati ipinle kan si ekeji.

en: "All businesses and offices within these locations should be fully closed during this period,"" he stated."
yo: Gbogbo ile-ise ati ofiisi to wa ni awon agbegbe yii gbodo wa ni titi pa lasiko yii.

en: President Buhari noted that Governors of Lagos and Ogun States as well as the Minister of the FCT have been notified.
yo: Aare Buhari ni awon gomina ipinle Eko, Ogun ati minisita ilu Abuja ti mo nipa igbele yii.

en: """Furthermore, heads of security and intelligence agencies have also been briefed."""
yo: Bakan naa, gbogbo awon adari ile-ise eleto aabo ati itopinipin ti mo nipa eto ohun.

en: He said his administration would use the containment period to identify, trace and isolate all individuals that have come into contact with confirmed cases.
yo: Aare ni ijoba oun yoo lo asiko igbele ohun lati se itopinpin awon ti won ti salabaapade awon to ni aarun Korona naa.

en: The Nigerian leader added that the order does not apply to hospitals and all related medical establishments as well as organisations in health care related manufacturing and distribution.
yo: Aare ni ofin naa ko mu awon ile-iwosan ati awon eleto ilera ati ile-ise epo ati pin egboogi oyinbo.

en: """Furthermore, commercial establishments such as; food processing, distribution and retail companies; petroleum distribution and retail entities, power generation, transmission and distribution companies; and private security companies are also exempted"" he clarified."
yo: Bakan naa, gbogbo awon ile-ise to n pese ati awon to n ta ounje, ile-epo robi ati ile-ise to n ta epo oko ayokele, ile-ise mona-mona ati ile-ise aladaani alamoojuto eto aabo.

en: He added that although the above mentioned establishments are exempted, access will be restricted and monitored.
yo: Aare ni bo tile je pe ofin eto igbele ko mu awon ile-ise wonyi sibe eto yoo wa nipa ibi ti won lee lo.

en: """Workers in telecommunication companies, broadcasters, print and electronic media staff who can prove they are unable to work from home are also exempted."""
yo: Awon osise ile-ise to n mojuto ero ibaraeni-soro ati ipe, ile-ise iroyin yala redio, mohun-maworan tabi lori ero ayelujara ti ko ba lee se ise lati ile re, ni won yoo gba laaye lati rin, sugbon irufe awon eniyan bayii gbodo lee fi kaadi idanimo won han.

en: --- We have 60-days fuel sufficiency - NNPC
yo: --- Ogota ojo lepo le de -NNPC

en: Nigerian National petroleum Corporation (NNPC) has urged Nigerians not to engage in panic buying of Premium Motor Spirit (PMS), as the country has adequate stock of the products to last for over 60-days.
yo: Ile-ise a-tepo-robi lorileede Naijiria (NNPC) ti ro awon omo Naijiria lati maa se beru nipa rira epo ayokele, nitori pe ile-ise naa ni epo ti Naijiria lee lo fun osu meji gbako.

en: Mr Mele Kyari, Group Managing Director of the corporation, gave the assurance while briefing newsmen on Sunday in Abuja.
yo: Ogbeni Mele Kyari, to je alaakoso ile -ise ohun, lo so oro idaniloju lasiko to ba awon akoroyin soro lojo Aiku, niluu Abuja.

en: Kyari assured that the NNPC had the support of all stakeholders to ensure adequate supply of petroleum products in the country.
yo: Kyari wa ro gbogbo omo orile ede Naijiria lati yago fun tito lesese nile- itaja epo, bi omiyale.

en: "He said: ""There is absolutely no scarcity anywhere; our supply is robust, we have fuel that will last this country even for 60-days if assuming we do not import any."
yo: "O ni: ""ko si aini nibi Kankan; oja wa kun, a ni epo ti yoo to orileede fun osu meji lai repo."

en: """Of course people because of the pandemic, stay at home, may try to conserve fuel, there is no need to do this."
yo: """Loooto, eyin eniyan, nitori itankale aarun, a duro sile, e le gbiyanju lati se epo ku, e ko nilo lati se eyi."

en: He appealed to Nigerians not to flood fuel stations as there was no need for that.
yo: O ro awon omo Naijiria lati ma bo ile-epo gbogbo nitori ko si idi fun eyi.

en: Commenting on National Association of Road Transport Owners (NARTO) order to petrol tankers drivers to vacate the depots, Kyari said that the corporation would continue to engage them.
yo: Sisoro lori ase NARTO fun awon oloko agbepo ki won kuro niso won, Kyari ni ile-ise ohun a tunbo maa ran won kaakiri.

en: """No restrictions; as we speak now loading is going on, trucks are moving around, no action like that will come to fruition,"""" he added."
yo: "O tesiwaju pe, ""Bi a se n soro bayii, ko si idiwo fun awon awako epo oko ayokele, nitori pe won ri epo won gba deede, ko si ninu erongba ile -ise, lati da ise duro."""

en: --- President Buhari to address Nigerians on Sunday
yo: --- Aare Buhari yoo ba Naijiria soro ni Sunnde

en: President Muhammadu Buhari will broadcast to the nation today Sunday, March 29 at 7pm local time.
yo: Aare Muhammadu Buhari yoo ba omo Naijiria soro lonii Sunnde, March 29 ni aago meje ale.

en: Special Adviser to the President on Media and Publicity, Femi Adesina disclosed this in a statement.
yo: Olugbanimoran si Aare orileede Naijiria ti Iroyin ati ipolongo, Femi Adesina so eyi ninu oro re.

en: He advised television, radio and other electronic media outlets to hook up to the network services of the Nigerian Television Authority (NTA) and Federal Radio Corporation of Nigeria (FRCN) for the broadcast.
yo: O gba awon ile-ise telifisan, ati ile-ise redio pelu ona isoroyin miiran niyanju lati darapo mo Ile-ise Telifisan akoko (NTA) ati Ile-ise Redio Apapo ti Naijiria (FRCN) fun oro Aare ohun.

en: Voice of Nigeria would also be live tweeting on our Twitter handle @voiceofnigeria.
yo: Ohun Naijiria yoo maa ja geere ni aaye lori ero Twitter wa @voiceofnigeria.

en: -- COVID-19: Ekiti Governor orders lockdown, shuts borders
yo: --- COVID-19: Gomina Ekiti pase igbele, ti gbogbo enuubode

en: Governor Kayode Fayemi of Ekiti on Sunday announced a lockdown in the state, directing residents to stay at home from Monday.
yo: Gomina Kayode Fayemi ti kede lojo Aiku pe won yoo ti ipinle Ekiti pa, ki o le dekun itankale aarun Korona.

en: The governor in a broadcast imposed a ban on all commercial activities as well as intra state travels, except for those bordering on essential services.
yo: Gomina ninu oro re, pase ki gbogbo okowo gbogbo duro gboin bakan naa ni ti irinajo yoowu, afi awon to n lokiri nitori oja pataki.

en: He said that anyone that violated the latest measures aimed at checking further spread of the coronavirus pandemic in the state, risked a six-month jail term.
yo: O ni eni ti o ba tapa si ofin tuntun ohun ti o wa lati dekun itankale korona ni ipinle naa yoo fewon osu mefa jura.

en: The governor expressed regrets that past measures adopted by him to curtail the virus were being brazenly ignored.
yo: Gomina faidunnu re han sawon igbese isaaju lati kapa aarun yii sugbon awon eniyan mo-on-on keti ikun si.

en: "He said: ""It is very disappointing that some of us have either been lukewarm, nonchalant or downright defiant in observing the simple but extremely effective preventive measures as well as maintaining social distancing to protect themselves from infection and curtail the spread of the virus in their communities."
yo: "O ni: ""o seni laaanu gidgidi pe isesi awon kan tutu, ai-kobi-ara-si tabi fifoju tembelu pipa awon ilana ti o rorun amo to koju osunwon kikapa korona ati ijinna si ara eni lawujo lati le daabobo ara won ati se adinku itankale arun naa ni awon igberiko won."""

en: """ While I acknowledge our resilient nature, incurable optimism and spiritual activism as a people, it is critical that we balance these with pragmatic and urgent actions that can ensure the safety of lives for our families and communities"
yo: """Bi mo se mo riri ifayaran wa, ireti ti o le ye ati idurosinsin ninu emi gege bi eniyan, o se pataki ka dogba eyi pelu ironu ati igbese kiakia to le daabobo emi ebi ati igberiko wa."

en: """ If we do not take steps necessary to contain this virus, it has the potential to overwhelm our health infrastructure, cripple our economy and devastate Ekiti in unimaginable proportions."
yo: """Ta o ba gbegbeese to ye lati dekun aarun yii, o seese ko bori ile-ise eto ilera wa, seto oro aje wa nijamba, ki o si ijamba pupo ba Ekiti."

en: """ As you are aware, the state is under significant financial constraints especially as a direct consequence of the impact of the coronavirus on the global economy and the price of crude oil that has gone down considerably."
yo: """Gege bi a se mo, ipo ti ipinle yii wa ko dara nitori owo po lapo ilu, eyi ti ipa aarun korona ko nibe ati si oro aje lagbaaye pelu owo epo robi to ti lole gan-an."

en: """ So, we cannot afford a public health crisis."
yo: """Nitori naa, a ko le faaye ailera lawujo."

en: """ It is therefore in urgent public interest that, I hereby, in pursuant to Section 8 of the Quarantine Act, Laws of the Federation of Nigeria 2004 and the Constitution of the Federal Republic of Nigeria 1999 (as amended) impose a curfew of movement in Ekiti ."
yo: """Idi niyi ti o je akiyesi pataki lawujo pe, nipase oju ewe 8 ti ise isenimole, ofin ijoba apapo Naijiria, odun 2004 ati iwe ofin ijoba apapo ti Naijiria, odun 1999 (pelu atunse) so igbele lairi eniyan kan ti o n rinkiri di kannpa ni ipinle Ekiti."

en: """The purpose of this curfew is to impose restrictions on the movement of persons and goods within Ekiti for an initial period of 14 days."
yo: """Idi fun igbele naa ni lati dekun bi won yoo se maa ko awon eniyan ati eru laarin ipinle ohun fun odidi ojo merinla gbako."

en: """Therefore, effective from 1:59pm on Monday, March 30, 2020 until 11:59pm on Monday, April 13, 2020, there shall be restriction of movement across the length and breadth of Ekiti, with all our borders closed."
yo: """Nitori naa, lati 1:59pm losan-an lojo Aje, March 30, 2020 de 11:59pm lale lojo Aje, April 13, 2020, eniyan kankan ko gbodo rinkiri ni Ekiti, ki gbogbo enuubode naa si wa ni titi pa."

en: """That is a full and total shutdown of Ekiti, and a 12-hour dusk to dawn curfew in Ekiti from 7:00pm - 7:00 am."
yo: """Eyi ni isemole patapata ni ipinle Ekiti, ati igbele fun wakati mejila lati aago meje ale titi di aago meje owuro."

en: All Ekiti residents are hereby directed to stay at home
yo: Gbogbo omo ipinle Ekiti ni a ro lati duro sile won.

en: """We are implementing the Quarantine Act to keep all Ekiti residents safe. So let me be clear."
yo: """A n samulo ise isenimole lati daabobo gbogbo omo ilu Ekiti. Nitori naa, e je so ko ye yekeyeke."

en: If you do not go home or stay home for at least 14 days as from Monday, 30 March, 2020, you can face serious fines or prison term.
yo: Ti o ko ba lo tabi duro sile fun ojo merinla bere lojo aje, 30 March, 2020, o le sanwo itanran repete tabi fewon jura.

en: """During this period, movement between local governments areas is prohibited; movement between towns, villages and communities is also prohibited; every person shall be confined to the place where he or she ordinarily resides in Ekiti,"" he said."
yo: "O ni, ""Lasiko igbele ohun, lilo si ijoba ibilesibiile, ilusiilu, ileto si leto ti di eewo ni ipinle Ekiti; Bakan naa, gbogbo awon to ba wa ni ipinle Ekiti lasiko igba naa, ni eto igbele naa mu."""

en: He emphasised that all businesses and other entities should cease operations during this period except those involved in the provision of essential goods or services.
yo: O tun so pe gbogbo ile-ise ni ko wa ni titi pa, ayafi awon to ba n se ise to niise pelu emi awon eniyan.

en: """Markets, retail shops and shopping malls must be closed, except where essential goods are sold and with strict hygienic conditions to prevent the exposure of persons to COVID-19."
yo: Awon oja, ile -itaja nla ati kekere lo gbodo wa ni titipa ayafi ibi i-ta-oja-pataki, won si gbodo wa ni imototo kaarun COVID-19 ma tan mo awon eniyan.

en: """Religious gatherings like worship and prayer services, night vigils, house fellowships and NASFAT meetings; social gatherings like funerals, weddings, family meetings and parties of any kind in night clubs, bars, beer joints; and political gatherings like. rallies, congresses, ward meetings, all of these are prohibited activities under these regulations."
yo: Gbogbo ile ijosin, bi i ibi adura oun iyin, iso-oru, idapo ojule, ati ipade NASFAT; apejopo eniyan bii ayeye oku, igbeyawo, ipade ebi ati ile-ijo, ile-oti, ipade oselu, iwode, ipade egbe woodu ati awon ipade ati eto ayeye lorisiriisi ni o ti di eewo bayii pelu eto ilana yii.

en: """Only gathering in respect of funeral will be allowed but the attendance shall be limited to 20 persons with no night vigil or party."
yo: Ipejopo bii isinku nikan ni a o gba laaye, sugbon ipejopo naa ko gbodo ju eniyan ogun lo, ko gbodo si iso-oru tabi ayeye.

en: """All boundaries of Ekiti are closed during this period, except for transportation of fuel, food and drugs and other essential goods."
yo: Gbogbo enubode Ekiti ni yoo wa ni titipa lasiko yii ayafi awako epo robi, awon olounje, egboogi oyinbo atawon oja asepataki.

en: """All non-residents who arrive the state prior to, or after, the imposition of this restriction, and who remain in the state, must remain in their place of temporary residence in the state for the duration of the 14 days, as the case may be, and may be subjected to screening for COVID-19 and be quarantined or isolated if necessary."
yo: Gbogbo awon ti kii se omo ipinle Ekiti sugbon ti won de si ipinle naa lasiko tabi leyin ofin igbele naa gbodo wa nibi ti won n gbe ni ipinle ohun fun ojo merinla ikede naa, won yoo si tun sayewo aarun COVID-19, bakan naa ni won yoo tun wa ni igbele, ti o ba je dandan fun won.

en: """All commuter transport services including bus services, taxi services, motor bikes (Okada) and tricycle services, are prohibited; except those for purposes of rendering essential services, obtaining essential goods, seeking medical attention, funeral services and to receive payment of social grants or food"
yo: """Gbogbo awon awako bii boosi, ayokele, okada ati keke maruwa, ni ko gbodo sise; afi awon ti o n jade nitori isee kosemase, yi won n gba eru pataki, wiwa itoju, ayeye oku ati gbigba owo iranwo fun ounje abi ohun miiran."

en: """Only those who are performing essential services will be allowed to move around, particularly health workers, but must be duly designated with an identity card by the head of their institutions."
yo: Awon to ba n se ise pataki ni won yoo fun laye lati maa lokiri, paapaa julo awon osise eto ilera, sugbon olori ile-ise won gbodo fun won ni kaadi idanimo.

en: Fayemi clarified that only few category of individuals and institutions providing certain critical services were exempted from the restrictions:
yo: Fayemi salaye pe awon tofin igbele o mu ko ju awon eniyan kookan atile-ise to n pese ohun pataki:

en: They include members of the state Executive, Legislature and the Judiciary;
yo: Awon ni omo ile - igbimo asoju, ijoba ipinle ati ile-ejo.

en: The list also included persons in production, distribution and marketing of food and beverages, pharmaceuticals, medicine, paper and plastic packages, environmental and sanitation activities, staff of electricity, water, telecommunications, e-commerce and digital service providers.
yo: Awon miiran ni oluse, olupin ati oluta ounje ati ohun mimu, ile-itaja egboogi oyinbo, ile -itawe ati abo, alamojuto ayika ati imototo, osise mona-mona, omi, ile-ibara-eni-soro, ile-ise ontaja lori ero ayelujara atawon olupese ero ayelujara.

en: The rest were members of security agencies assigned on lawful duties; staff of banks and similar financial institutions and staff of fuel stations.
yo: Awon miiran ni osise eleto aabo ti won gbese fun, osise awon ile-ifowopamo, eyi ti o jo o ati osise awon ile-epo robi.

en: """Any person who contravenes these regulations shall be guilty of an offence and, on conviction, liable to a fine or to imprisonment for a period not exceeding six months or to both fine and imprisonment,"" the governor said."
yo: "Gomina ni, ""eni to ba rufin yii yoo jebi esun naa, nigba ti won ba si dalebi, o le sanwo itanran tabi lo ewon ti o to osu mefa tabi sanwo itanran ko si lo ewon bakan naa."""

en: Fayemi, who said he was aware of the negative consequences of the new development on businesses and families, said palliatives were being worked out for residents, especially high risk and vulnerable citizens.
yo: Fayemi, ni oun mo pe igbese yii yoo mu inira dani fun okowo ati molebi, o si ni ohun iranwo n lo lowo fun awon omo ipinle Ekiti, paapaa julo awon abarapa.

en: --- COVID-19: Nigeria's confirmed cases rise to 97
yo: --- COVID-19: Metadinlogorun lalarun korona di ni Naijiria

en: Nigeria's confirmed cases of the novel coronavirus COVID-19 has risen to 97.
yo: O ti di eniyan metadinlogorun to ti ni aarun Corona bayii ni Naijiria.

en: "Confirming the latest eight cases, the Nigeria Centre for Disease Control explained that ""As at 10:40 pm 28th March there are 97 confirmed cases of #COVID19 reported in Nigeria with 1 death."""
yo: "Ajo agbogunti aarun lo kede awon mejo to tun sese jeyo pe ""ni deede 10:40am loooro, 28th, March lawon alarun Korona lorile ede yii ti di metadinlogorun, okan si ti ku."

en: """Currently; Lagos- 59 FCT- 16 Ogun- 3 Enugu- 2 Ekiti- 1 Oyo- 7 Edo- 2 Bauchi- 2 Osun-2 Rivers-1 Benue- 1 Kaduna- 1"""
yo: """Bayii; Eko- 59, FCT - 16 Ogun- 3 Enugu- 2 Ekiti- 1 Oyo- 7 Edo- 2 Bauchi- 2 Osun-2 Rivers-1 Benue- 1 Kaduna- 1"""

en: Eight new cases of #COVID19 have been reported in Nigeria; 2 in FCT, 4 in Oyo, 1 in Kaduna and 1 in Osun State
yo: Awon alarun korona mejo tun ti jeyo lorile ede Naijiria; 2 ni FCT, 4 ni Oyo, 1 ni Kaduna ati 1 ni ipinle Osun

en: As at 10:40 pm 28th March there are 97 confirmed cases of #COVID19 reported in Nigeria with 1 death.
yo: Ni deede 10:40am loooro, 28th, March lawon alarun Korona lorile ede yii ti di metadinlogorun, okan si ti ku.

en: --- COVID-19: Nigerian President orders closure of air, land borders
yo: --- COVID-19: Aare Naijiria pase titi papa oko ofurufu ati enuubode

en: In a bid to curtail the spread of the deadly Coronavirus, the Nigerian President, Muhammadu Buhari has directed the immediate closure of Nigeria's International Airports and Land Borders for four weeks.
yo: Lati dekun itankale aarun asekupani korona, aare orile ede Naijiria, Muhammadu Buhari ti pase titi papa oko ofurufu ile okeere ni Naijiria ati enuubode ni kiakia fun ose merin gbako.

en: "The President who made this known via his official Twitter handle @MBuhari on Thursday night, noted that the move was to enable the Government ""put up the appropriate policies, processes and infrastructure to cope with suspected and confirmed cases at home, without risking a compounding of the situation with more imported cases."""
yo: Aare so eyi lori Twitter re @MBuhari lale ojobo, o ni igbese naa wa lati ran ijoba lowo nipa fifi gbogbo ilana to ye, igbese lolokan-o-jokan, ohun amayederun lati le kapa alarun afunrasi ati eyi ti a ti sawari ni ile, lai mu buru si i pelu eyi to n tokeere wa.

en: "The President however regretted the inconvenience caused by flight and travel restrictions to Nigerians abroad who want to return home adding that ""it is necessary for the greater good, and I thank you all for your understanding and cooperation."""
yo: "Aare faidunnu han si inira ti titi papa oko ofurufu ati enuubode ti fun awon omo Naijiria to fe wale, o si fi kun un pe ""o pondandan fun anfaani wa, mo dupe fun ifowosowopo ati igboniye gbogbo yin."

en: """I have also directed that only cargo vessels that have been at sea for more than 14 days be allowed to dock in our ports, after the crew have been tested and confirmed disease-free by the Port Health Authorities."""
yo: Mo ti pase pe oko oju -omi eleru, olojo merinla o le, lori okun nikan, ni yoo de si ibudoko won, leyin ti ajo eleto ilera tolomi ba ti sayewo fun iko ohun ti won si rariidaju pe won o larun.

en: """This 14-day restriction however does not apply to vessels carrying oil and gas products as by their nature, there is minimal human contact,"" he explained."
yo: "O salaye pe, ""igbele ojo - merinla yii ko nii se pelu awon to n gbe epo robi ati afefe gaasi niwon ti ifarakinra pelu eniyan kere."

en: President Buhari also suspended the movement of commuter trains to limit the spread of the virus to other parts of the country.
yo: Aare Buhari tun da ilokiri oko oju-irin duro lati le se adinku itankale aarun naa si eya ti o ku ni orile-ede.

en: Intervention Fund President Buhari also ordered the immediate release of a 10 billion Naira grant to Lagos State, which he said remains the epicentre of the Covid-19 outbreak in Nigeria.
yo: Owo iranwo - Aare Buhari tun pase ki won yonnda owo iranwo bilionu mewaa naira fun ipinle Eko, nitori ibe ni ibudo itankale Korona ni Naijiria, gege bi o se so.

en: """This grant will enable Lagos increase its capacity to control and contain the outbreak, while also supporting other States with capacity-building,"" he explained."
yo: Owo iranro yii maa mu Eko laaye si lati kapa ati dena itankale, yoo si tun ranpinle yooku lowo nipa kikole gbigbooro, o salaye.

en: "The President also ordered the immediate release of a 5 billion Naira special intervention fund to the Nigeria Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) to ""equip, expand and provide personnel to its facilities and laboratories across the country."""
yo: Aare tun wa pa ase yiyonda bilionu marun-un owo iranwo ti won ya soto fun ajo amojuto itankale aarun (NCDC) fun rira irinse, imugbooro ati wiwa kun awon osise si ile-ise ati awon ibi-ayewo wo jakejado orile-ede.

en: """I have directed the NCDC to draft all its recent retirees back into service to beef up our manpower as we respond to the pandemic."""
yo: """Mo ti pase ki NCDC pe gbogbo osise feyinti laipe pada si enuuse lati le kin awon osise wa lowo ni ifesi si itankale naa."""

en: """Furthermore, all NCDC staff and experts who are away on training or international assignments are to return immediately,"" he directed."
yo: Siwaju si i, gbogbo awon osise NCDC to wa lenu ikose ati lenu ise loke okun pada wa sile ni kiakia.

en: Effective Response Nigerian President noted that the Nigerian Air Force is already making its fleet available to the Presidential Task Force on Covid-19, to enable a better coordinated and more effective response across the country.
yo: Fun ijafafa ninu ise yii, aare Naijiria ni iko ofurufu ologun ti Naijiria (NAF) ti n seto awon oko won fun iko aare amojuto korona, lati le samulo kaakiri orile-ede fun amojuto to ye kooro.

en: """Already the Nigerian Air Force (NAF) is conducting an evacuation mission to bring back some of our specialists in Central Africa, to enable them support the national response,"" he added."
yo: """Lowolowo, iko ofurufu ologun Naijiria (NAF) n gbegbeese lati ko awon onimo ijinle wa to wa ni Central Africa wale, lati fowo kun eto to n lo lowolowo,"" o fikun-un."

en: "Fiscal Measures He commended the monetary policy authorities for their financial intervention to support entrepreneurs and companies as the country goes through ""this difficult time."""
yo: "Eto inawo - ""O gboriyin fun awon eka to n mojuto owo fun iranlowo ti won se fun awon ile-ise aladaani ""ni iru akoko lile yii."""

en: The President noted that the government is also looking at fiscal measures to minimise the negative impact of this pandemic on the livelihood of millions of Nigerians.
yo: Aare ni ijoba yoo wa ona lati pese owo itura fun araalu lati le din ipa buburu ti ajakale yii se ni igbe-aye ogunlogo omo orile-ede Naijiria.

en: """As you are aware we have begun the process of reviewing the federal budget. We shall communicate our fiscal interventions once the budget review process is concluded."""
yo: Gege bi e se mo pe igbese lori atunyewo eto isunna lorileede ti bere. E maa gbabo ona abayo gbara ti atunyewo eto isunna ba ti pari.

en: """In the meantime, I have directed the Minister of Industry, Trade and Investment, to work with the Manufacturers Association of Nigeria (MAN), to ensure that all production of essential items such as food, medical and pharmaceutical products continues unhindered."""
yo: Ni akoko yii, mo ti pase fun Minisita alaboojuto ile-ise isowo ati idokowo, lati sise pelu egbe oluse-ohun-tita ti Naijiria (MAN), lati ri i daju pe pipese ohun pataki bi i ounje, oniruuru oogun n tesiwaju lai si idiwo.

en: Knowledge & Support President Buhari stated that the government was already engaging international friends and partners to share knowledge and to seek their support in response to the pandemic.
yo: Imo ati atileyin - Aare Buhari so pe ijoba oun ti n takuroso pelu ore ati alabaase okeere lati pin imo ati gbigba iranwo won lori itankale aarun yii.

en: """We are grateful for the show of support thus far - we have already started receiving goods and supplies intended to help us scale up our efforts."""
yo: """A moyi yin lori atileyin ti a ti ri gba bayii - A ti n gba awon eru kookan ti o wa fun riran igbiyanju wa lowo."""

en: """Let me specially thank and commend all of the hard and heroic work being done by our medical personnel, the NCDC, Port Health Authorities, Security Agencies, State Governments, and all ad-hoc staff and volunteers."""
yo: """E je n fi towotowo dupe pelu gbigboriyin fun ise akoni oun ribiribi ti osise ilera, NCDC, osise ilera olomi, ajo eleto aabo, ijoba ipinle, ati gbogbo osise ara pelu osise ofe ti se."""

en: Panic & Misinformation President Buhari urged all Nigerians to be mindful of those who seek to spread panic and misinformation, and sow confusion at this time.
yo: Ijaya ati Iroyin aheso - Aare Buhari ro awon omo Naijiria lati sora fun awon to fe da ipaya ati aheso sile lati faporuuru lasiko yii.

en: """We must all pay attention only to the relevant government agencies working day and night to make accurate and useful information available to the public."""
yo: """A gbodo teti si ohun pataki ti awon asoju-ijoba ti o sise losan-an loru lati le mu iroyin ti o tewon fun araaye gbo."""

en: """I will also ask all of us to strictly obey all public health guidelines and instructions issued by the Federal and State health authorities, regarding personal hygiene and social distancing."""
yo: """Mo maa tun ro gbogbo wa lati tele gbogbo ilana ati itosona ilera ti ijoba apapo ati ijoba ipinle lakale lori imototo ara ati jijinna si eniyan nile ati loko."

en: """These guidelines will be updated from time to time as new information and treatments are obtained."""
yo: """Atunse a maa jeyo lori awon ilana wonyi loorekoore, bimoran atitoju tuntun ba se n wole."

en: """In the meantime, I want to assure all Nigerians that the Federal Government remains committed to protecting all Nigerians."
yo: """Ni bayii, mo fe fi da gbogbo omo orile-ede Naijiria loju pe, ijoba apapo ko kere lati daabo bo yin."

en: We seek your full support and cooperation as we go through this very difficult time.
yo: A nilo atileyin ati ifowosowopo yin lasiko aiderun yii.

en: "Together we will triumph over this pandemic."""
yo: "Bi a ba fowosowopo, o daju pe a o bori aarun yii."""

en: --- COVID-19: Nigeria confirms 14 new cases
yo: --- COVID-19: Naijiria tun sawari eniyan merinla

en: The Nigeria Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) has confirmed 14 new cases of the novel coronavirus also known as COVID-19.
yo: Ajo amojuto aarun korona lorileede Naijiria (NCDC) tun ti sawari eniyan alarun korona merinla ti a tun mo si COVID-19.

en: Confirming the cases via its official Twitter handle, the NCDC noted that one of the cases was confirmed in FCT, one in Bauchi and 12 in Lagos,
yo: Ajo NCDC lo gbe eyi jade lori ero Twitter won pe, won ri alarun Korona kan ni FCT, eyo kan ni Bauchi ati mejila ni ipinle Eko.

en: """Of the 14, six were detected on a vessel, three are returning travellers and two are close contacts of confirmed cases,"" the NCDC explained."
yo: """Ninu merinla, won sawari mefa lori omi, meta je arinrinajo to n padabo ati meji to sunmo ara won ni won sawari,"" NCDC salaye."

en: This brings the total number of confirmed cases in Nigeria to 65, with three discharged and one death.
yo: Eyi mu gbogbo alarun korona asawari ni Naijiria je marundinlaadorin, pelu meta ti won fiile, okan si papoda.

en: We noticed an error in our update at 8:35pm. It should be:
yo: A ri asise ninu iroyin wan i 8:35pm, o ye ko je:

en: 14 new cases of #COVID19 have been confirmed in Nigeria: 1 in FCT, 1 IN BAUCHI & 12 in Lagos
yo: Won se awari alarun korona merinla ni Naijiria; okan ni FCT, okan naa ni Bauchi ati mejila ni ilu Eko.

en: Of the 14, 6 were detected on a vessel, 3 are returning travellers & 2 are close contacts of confirmed cases pic.twitter.com/Pe6owiXBKB - NCDC (@NCDCgov) March 26, 2020
yo: Ninu merinla, won sawari mefa lori omi, meta - arinrinajo to n padabo ati meji to sunmo ara won ni won sawari - NCDC (@NCDCgov) March 26,2020.

en: --- COVID-19: VP Osinbajo tests negative
yo: --- COVID-19: Igbakeji aare, Osinbajo ko laarun Korona

en: Nigeria's Vice President, Prof. Yemi Osinbajo, has tested negative to the coronavirus.
yo: Igbakeji aare Naijiria, ojogbon Yemi Osinbajo, ti yege ayewo aarun Korona.

en: This followed tests conducted to check his status.
yo: Eyi han ninu ayewo ti won se fungbakeji aare.

en: Spokesman to the Vice President, Laolu Akande, confirmed this in response to enquiries from the media.
yo: Agbenuso igbakeji aare, Laolu Akande, lo fi oro ohun mule lakooko ifesi si oro akoroyin nipaa re.

en: "In his response, Akande said: ""Good morning Sirs and Ma: I have been inundated with calls on whether indeed the VP had undergone a COVID-19 test and the outcome."
yo: "Ninu esi ti Akande gbe jade, o ni: ""E kaaroo eyin okunrin ati obinrin: Opolopo ipe ni mo ti n gba boya igbakeji aare sayewo COVID-19 ati esi ayewo ohun."

en: "Yes, he has and the result is negative. An official tweet would follow. Thanks"""
yo: "Beeni, igbakeji aare sayewo, sugbon ko ni aarun Korona, E se."""

en: Akande tweeted on Tuesday that the Vice President had isolated himself and was working from home.
yo: Akande soro lojoosegun lori Twitter pe igbakeji aare ti n dagbe o si n tile sise.

en: --- COVID-19: VP Osinbajo goes into self-isolation
yo: --- COVID-19: Igbakeji aare Osinbajo n dagbe.

en: Nigeria's Vice President, Prof. Yemi Osinbajo, has gone into self-isolation in keeping with the advice of the National Centre for Disease Control, NCDC.
yo: Igbakeji aare orile ede Naijiria, ojogbon Yemi Osinbajo ti fi ara re sinu igbele lati tele ilana ajo to n samojuto aarun (NCDC).

en: Spokesman to the Vice President, Laolu Akande, shared this on Tuesday via his twitter handle @akandeoj.
yo: Agbenuso igbakeji aare, Laolu Akande, lo soro yii lojo Isegun lati ori ero twitter re @akandeoj.

en: "Akande said: ""VP Osinbajo yesterday (Monday) at the office conducted his meetings via video conferencing while observing social distancing."
yo: "Akande ni: ""Igbakeji aare lanaa (Monde) sepade ninu ofisii re lori fidio akoyanjo lati tele ilana yiyera fun eniyan."

en: """Today, he continues his work from the home office, as he is in self-isolation in accordance with NCDC protocols."""
yo: """Ni oni, o tesiwaju ninu ise re lati ile, nitori o wa ni igbele ni ilana pelu ofin NCDC."""

en: Akande did not give further explanation about those who might have come into contact with the vice president before he decided to isolate himself.
yo: Akande ko soro lekununrere nipa awon ti igbakeji aare ti se alabaapade pelu ki o to di pe o lo se igbele araa re.

en: Vice President Osinbajo yesterday at the office conducted his meetings via video conferencing, while observing social distancing.
yo: Igbakeji aare Osinbajo lanaa se ipade ninu ofisii re lori fidio akoyanjo lati tele ilana yiyera fun eniyan.

en: Today, he continues his work from the home office, as he is in self-isolation in accordance with NCDC protocols.
yo: "Lonii, o tesiwaju ninu ise re lati ile, nitori o wa ni igbele ni ilana pelu ofin NCDC."""

en: On Monday, Prof Osinbajo was to inaugurate the National Traffic Radio at the headquarters of the Federal Road Saftey Corps, FRSC, Wuse, Abuja.
yo: Lojo aje, ojogbon Osinbajo ye ko se ifilole National Traffic Road ni Olu ile-ise ajo amojuto ona ti ijoba apapo, FRSC, Wuse, Abuja.

en: It was cancelled, but no official reason was given for the development.
yo: Won fagi lee, won o si so idi kan pato funtesiwaju re.

en: ---Garkida attack is a sign of frustration - President Buhari
yo: "---Aami ipinlemii ni ikolu t""o waye ni Garkida - Aare Buhari."

en: President Muhammadu Buhari has condemned the boko haram attack on Garkida in Adamawa State, Northeast Nigeria, saying the terrorists were frustrated.
yo: "Aare Muhammadu Buhari ti da iko olote Boko Haram lebi latari ikolu t""o waye ni waye ni ilu Garkida ni ipinle Adamawa, Ariwa-ila-oorun orile-ede Naijiria."

en: "President Buhari said in a statement: ""These attacks on soft targets by the terrorists are obvious signs of frustration because my administration has significantly weakened boko haram's military capability to invade and hold Nigerian territory unchallenged."""
yo: "Aare Buhari so ninu atejade kan: ""Awon ikolu t""o n waye ni awon agbegbe kan lati owo iko Boko Haram je apeere pe okan iko Boko Haram ko bale mo, nitori pe ijoba mi ti se iye apa iko omo-ogun olote Boko Haram lati ya wo agbegbe lai ni ikoju."

en: He extended his sympathy to families of the victims and assured citizens that no part of Nigeria would be abandoned to their fate.
yo: Aare wa ba awon ebi to farapa ninu isele naa kedun, o si seleri fun awon omo orile-ede wi pe ko si agbegbe ti awon yoo da da kadara won.

en: """Our gallant forces deserve our appreciation for repelling the attackers but they must go beyond this point."
yo: """O ye ki a gbosuba fun awon akinkanju iko ologun wa fun kikoju iko awon akoluni sugbon won gbodo se ju eyi lo."

en: They have our full support to go after the terrorists and have them pay a huge price.
yo: Won ni atileyin wa lati tubo kolu iko olote naa, ki won si fimu won fon fere.

en: I want to assure the country that terrorists will continue to face the combined power of our military until they give up their mistaken ways.
yo: Mo fe fokan omo orile ede naa bale pe awon olote yoo tubo maa koju apapo agbara iko omo ogun titi ti won yoo fi ronupiwada nibi asise won.

en: President Buhari said since the coming of his administration, boko haram's ability to invade and occupy Nigerian territories, let alone be able to hoist their flags, had been frustrated.
yo: """Aare Buhari wa ni lati igba ti ijoba yii ti de ori aleefa, akitiyan iko Boko Haram lati doti tabi gba orile ede Naijiria, k""a ma so ti riri asia won mole, ni o ti ja si pabo."

en: ---Army thwarts Boko Haram attack in Adamawa
yo: ---Omo ogun babuja ikolu Boko Haram ni Adamawa.

en: Army troops of 232 Battalion of 23 Armoured Brigade under Operation LAFIYA DOLE deployed in Garkida, Gombi LGA of Adamawa State thwarted a planned attack by Boko haram terrorists.
yo: Iko omo ogun Egbe-omo-ogun 232 ti Egbe-ologun Ihamora 23 labe LAFIYA DOLE ti won ko lo si Garkida, ni ijoba ibile Gombi ni ipinle Adamawa ti ba ete ikolu Boko Haram je.

en: According to a statement by the Assistant Director Army Public Relations 23 Brigade Yola, Major Haruna Mohammed Sani, the terrorists besieged the town in about 7 Gun Trucks and a number of motorcycles setting some buildings ablaze and causing unrest within the community.
yo: "Gege bi atejade kan ti Igbakeji Oludari Alukoro Iko Omo-ogun Egbe-ologun 23 ti Yola, Major Haruna Mohammed Sani, se so, awon iko olote naa wa si agbegbe ohun pelu awon Oko Ibon ijagun t""o to meje, pelu awon orisiirisii oko alupupu, ti won si bere si n tina bo awon ile kookan, ti o fa iberu-bojo ni aarin ilu naa."

en: """The gallant troops mobilised and intercepted the criminals"" advance and engaged the marauding criminals unleashing high volume of fire leading to the elimination of several of the criminals while others withdrew in disarray, many of them with gunshot wounds as evident in the trails of blood along their withdrawal route"" Major Sani explained."
yo: "Gege bi Major Sani se s""alaye ""awon iko omo ogun anigboya yii woya ija pelu awon odaran awa-ikogunkiri ti won si dana bole gan-an ti pupo ninu awon odaranmoran naa si gbemii mi ti awon kan si tun tuka, ti opolopo won f'arapa yanna-yanna pelu eri ipa eje lona ibi ti won sa gba."""

en: """Regrettably, one gallant soldier paid the supreme price while another soldier was wounded in action. The wounded in action soldier has since been evacuated to a military medical facility."
yo: """O s""eni laaanu, pe okan ninu awon iko omo ogun anigboya kan so emi re nu, ti omiran f'arapa yanna-yanna loju. Omo ogun ti o f'arapa naa si ti n gba iwosan lowo-lowo bayii nile iwosan ologun."

en: Consequently, following the successful repelling of the criminals, on the 22nd February 2020, the Commander 23 Armoured Brigade, Brigadier General Sani Gambo Mohammed visited the troops in Garkida.
yo: Ni kete ti isele naa waye ni ojo Kejilelogun osu keji odun, 2020, ni Apase ogun Egbe-ologun Ihamora 23, Ogagun Sani Gambo Mohammed ti se abewo si iko naa ni Garkida

en: At the end of his tour, he congratulated the troops for their doggedness, vigilance and uncommon fighting spirit that led to the victory against the enemy.
yo: "Nigba ti o se abewo re tan, t""o si gbosuba fun iko naa fun iforiti, isora ati ija fitafita ti o mu won segun ota."

en: He however admonished them to be more vigilant as the criminal elements may plan a reprisal attack due to the casualties they suffered.
yo: O tun wa ro iko ohun naa lati ma se kaaree nitori pe o se e se, ki iko olote naa tun fe pada wa si agbegbe ohun.

en: "Additionally, the Brigade Commander also solicited the citizens"" continuous cooperation in reporting to security agencies any suspicious persons or movement within and adjourning communities."
yo: Lafikun, Ogagun naa tun wa ro, awon to n gbe agbegbe naa lati maa fi to iko ologun leti ni kete ti won ba gburoo awon afurasi tabi awon eniyan ti owo won ko mo on.

en: He further reassured the good people of Garkida and indeed Adamawa State of the Brigade's total commitment to protecting lives and properties within its Area of Responsibility.
yo: O wa fi da awon eniyan agbegbe Garkida naa loju pe iko omo ogun orile ede Naijiria ko ni kaaree lati maa daabo bo dukia ati emi awon ara ilu.

en: "---President Buhari thanks ""Doctors Without Borders"" for supporting Nigeria"
yo: "---Aare Buhari dupe lowo awon ""Dokita Laini Aala"" fun atileyin won ni Naijiria."

en: President Muhammadu Buhari says the sacrifices of Medecins Sans Frontieres (Doctors Without Borders) in conflict areas in Nigeria are well appreciated.
yo: "Aare Muhammadu Buhari ti ni ijoba mo riri ifarada ati igbiyanju egbe Medecins Sans Frontieres (Dokita Laini Aala) ni awon agbegbe ti rogbodiyan ti n waye l""orile ede Naijiria."

en: Receiving Dr. Christos Christou, International President of the organization at State House, Abuja, on Friday, the President said the sacrifices as individuals and as a group was quite enormous, particularly on a non-profit basis.
yo: "Lasiko ti aare Buhari n tewogba Dokita Christos Christou, t""o je aare egbe ohun nile aare, niluu Abuja, lojo Ojobo, Aare ni igbiyanju ati ifarada ti egbe naa n se paapaa julo laigba owo, je eyi ti o yanilenu."

en: Commenting specifically on the situation in the North-East, President Buhari said despite criticisms, the government has made substantial progress.
yo: Aare Buhari ni ijoba apapo naa ko kaaree ninu igbiyanju re bo tile je pe won n so opolopo oro abuku si ijoba oun.

en: """We know the pathetic situation of children not knowing where their parents are, or the communities they come from, and that was why we established the new Ministry of Humanitarian Affairs, Disaster Management, and Social Development."
yo: "Aare ni ""a mo ipo ti awon omode ti ko mo ibi ti awon obi won wa, tabi awon agbegbe ti won ti wa, ati pe idi niyi ti a fi da Ile-ise to n mojuto omoniyan, Isakoso ajalu, ati Idagbasoke awujo sile."

en: This is to harness and channel resources to such deprived people.
yo: "Eyi ni lati s""eto iranwo fun iru awon eniyan bayii."

en: The President promised that respite and succor would come to all the troubled areas, adding that many prominent and well-to-do organizations were also involved, along with international agencies.
yo: Aare wa seleri pe ijoba yoo fowosowopo pelu awon ogbontarigi omo bibi orile ede yii, awon ile-ise nla ati awon egbe ile okeere lati pese eto iranwo fun awon agbegbe ti rogbodiyan ti se lose.

en: ---Nigeria's Information Minister clears air on $500m China Loan
yo: "---Minisita fun eto iroyin s""alaye nipa Eyawo Eedegbeta milionu dola lati China"

en: Nigeria's Minister of Information and Culture, Alhaji Lai Mohammed has revealed that the 500 million dollar loan being sought from China is not for the Nigeria Television Authority (NTA) alone.
yo: Minisita fun eto iroyin ati asa, Alhaji Lai Mohammed ti so pe eedegbeta milionu dola ti won fe ya lati orile-ede China ki i se fun ile-ise mohun-maworan ti orile ede Naijiria (NTA) nikan.

en: The Country's Information and Culture Minister made the clarification in Abuja, Nigeria's capital, while briefing journalists on the controversies surrounding the proposed loan for the projects.
yo: "Minisita fun eto iroyin ati asa s""oro naa nigbati o n ba akoroyin s""oro niluu Abuja, ti se olu-ilu orile-ede Naijiria lori aheso oro lori owo ti won fe ya ohun fun awon ise akanse."

en: Mohammed said the loan was for three major projects contrary to the hysteria created over it in a section of the media.
yo: "Mohammed ni eyawo naa wa fun ise akanse pataki meta ti won se l""orile ede Naijiria ti o yato si awuyewuye ile-ise akoroyin."

en: He said it was reported in some sections of the media while defending the loan before the National Assembly that the loan was for the upgrades of facilities to enable NTA compete with the likes of America's Cable Network News, CNN.
yo: O ni awon ile-ise akoroyin kan gbe aheso oro naa jade lasiko ti oun wa nile igbimo asofin lati so nipa eto eyawo ohun, pe awon owo ohun lati lee je ki ile-ise NTA maa figa-gbaga pelu ile-ise mohun-maworan, America's Cable Network News, CNN.

en: The minister said the loan would be used to construct a headquarters complex and transmission network for Integrated Television Services (ITS), the Federal Government-owned signal distributor and a major component of the country's Digital Switchover (DSO)
yo: "Minisita wa s""alaye pe eto eyawo naa yoo je lilo fun kiko awon olu ile-ise agbohun safefe (ITS), ti o je irinse apin-afefe ka ti Ijoba Apapo ati awon ohun-elo ibosori-ero Igbohunsafefe Igbalode (DSO)."

en: He said the fund would also be used to build an ultra-modern Media City in Ikorodu, Lagos State, to include Indoor/Outdoor shooting area, Animation Production Facility and Digital Media Training Centre.
yo: Bakan naa, o ni won yoo tun lo owo naa lati fi ko ile-ise igbalode fun ile-eko iroyin fun awon akoroyin ati oniroyin niluu Ikorodu, ni ipinle Eko, ti o ibi ere itage ile/ode, Isaworandaaye ati Eko Imo Eko Ikoroyin.

en: Mohammed also hinted that other facilities in the city would include World Class Cinema, Four-Star Hotel, an Amusement Park and Amphi-theatre.
yo: Mohammed tun pe won yoo tun lo owo naa fun pipese ile-ise sinima Igbalode, Ile-itura Onirawo Merin, Gbongan ere- itage nla ati Ibi isere.

en: The minister further said the loan would also be used for acquisition of digital movie production equipment for rental as well as power system
yo: Minisita tun tesiwaju pe awon yoo tun lo owo naa lati fi ra irinse igbalode fun iyaworan fun yiya ati ipese ina mona-mona.

en: He disclosed that the Media City Training Academy was only the second of its type in Africa and the first is in Egypt.
yo: O ni Ilu Ile-eko Ikoroyin ni ikeji iru re to wa ni Ile-Adulawo ti akoko wa ni orile ede Egypt.

en: The minister also disclosed that the loan would be used for digitization of all NTA Stations at the Headquarters, 12 zonal stations, the 36 States and FCT as well as 78 community stations.
yo: "Minisita tun so pe awon yoo tun lo owo ohun lati fi pese irinse igbalode fun ile-ise mohun-maworan NTA to wa niluu Abuja ati ekun mejila ati ni gbogbo ibi ti ile-ise naa wa ni gbogbo ipinle to wa l""orile ede Naijiria."

en: ---President Buhari reassures Plateau State on peace, prosperity
yo: ---Aare Buhari fokan ipinle Plateau bale lori eto alaafia ati aseyori.

en: President Muhammadu Buhari has reassured Plateau State government that the Federal Government will continue to support its efforts towards promoting a peaceful, prosperous and tolerant society.
yo: Aare orile ede Naijiria, Muhammadu Buhari ti fokan awon eniyan ipinle Plateau bale pe ijoba ko ni kaaare lati tubo maa seto iranwo fun won nipa pipese eto alaafia, aseyori ati ifokanbale fun won.

en: Receiving Governor Simon Lalong and other stakeholders from Plateau State on Thursday, President Buhari appealed to residents and indigenes of the State to support the Governor's development agenda.
yo: Lasiko ti aare Buhari n tewogba gomina ipinle Plateau ohun, Simon Lalong ati awon ti oro kan ni ipinle Plateau lojo Ojobo, Aare Buhari wa ro awon olugbe ati omo ipinle naa lati maa satileyin fun eto idagbasoke ti gominaa naa dawole lori.

en: """""It is, therefore, our collective duty to ensure these potentials are fully harnessed by providing the right policy support,"""" the President said."
yo: Gomina naa wa ro aare Buhari lati seto popo ona oko ti yoo maa gba awon oko pupo, iranwo fun awon ti ogun ati ija le kuro ni agbegbe won, atunse lori ile -ise iwadii lori anamo.

en: President Buhari told the delegation he was very pleased with the progress made on security, provision of social services and infrastructure development under the leadership of the present Governor.
yo: Aare Buhari wa so fun awon asoju ohun pe, inu ohun dun lori idagbasoke to wa nipa eto aabo ati idagbasoke awujo ti gomina naa n se ni ipinle naa

en: The delegation comprised of the State Deputy Governor, Prof. Sonni Tyoden as well as political appointees and some illustrious sons and daughters of Plateau State.
yo: "Lara awon eniyan t""o wa pelu gomina Lalong ni igbakeji gomina, ojogbon Sonni Tyoden ati awon ogbontarigii oloselu to wa lati ipinle naa"

en: ---Senate probes GSM operators over drop calls
yo: ---Igbimo asofin yoo se iwadii bi ile-ise ero ibanisoro alagbeeka se n ja Naijiria lole lori ipe.

en: A Senate panel on Wednesday held a public hearing to investigate telecommunications network operators in the country over increasing rate of drop calls.
yo: Lojoru yii n ile igbimo asofin ti bere iwadii lori owo ti awon ile-ise to n pese ero ibanisoro alagbeeka ati ipe bi won se n ja awon omo orile ede lole lori ipe ti awon eniyan ko jegbadun re sugbon ti won n gba owo lowo onibara won.

en: "According to the chairman of the Senate Committee on Communications, Senator Oluremi Tinubu, the session was specifically ""on the increasing rate of drop calls and other unwholesome practices by telecommunications network operators in Nigeria that have robbed Nigerians of their hard earned billions of naira."""
yo: "Gege bi alaga igbimo asofin to n mojuto eto ibanisoro, asofin Oluremi Tinubu, se so pe ""Bi awon ile-ise ero ibanisoro se n ja owo lori ipe ti awon onibaraa won ko lo ati awon iwa miiran ti won n lo lati ja awon onibaraa won lole je iwa ibaje."

en: What MTN does in Nigeria, MTN doesn't do that in South Africa.
yo: Iru iwa ti ile-ise ibanisoro MTN n hu lorile ede Naijiria ko lee sele lorile ede South Africa.

en: I think the committee should insist on what happens to all the money people in this country paid for no service.
yo: O ye ki igbimo se iwadii si gbogbo owo ti awon ile-ise ero ibanisoro n gba lowo onibaraa won laije pe won je anfaani ohun ti won san owo naa fun.

en: Other countries give money back.
yo: Awon orile ede miiran maa n da owo pada.

en: But here you denied us and you don't give one Kobo.
yo: Sugbon nibi e fi dun wa ti e si ni fun wa ni Kobo.

en: """And the kind of market that we have in Nigeria, is such that you don't have this market anywhere in the world."
yo: """Iru oja to wa ni orile ede Naijiria, ko si iru re ni agbaye."

en: When a Nigerian will have three lines, yet we don't get the service that we paid for.
yo: Nigbati awon omo orile ede Naijiria miiran yoo ni kaadi ipe meta, sibe a ko tun ni je anfaani si ohun ti a sanwo fun.

en: The Senate President also accused the regulatory authority, Nigerian Communications Commission (NCC) of not doing enough to check the sharp practices by the Service Providers.
yo: Abenugan wa ro ile-ise to n mojuto gbogbo ero ibanisoro lorile ede Naijiria (NCC) lati mojuto ojuse won, paapaa julo bi awon ile-ise to n pese ipe ati ayelujara se n ja awon onibaraa won lole lorile ede yii.

en: ---Coronavirus: Nigerian Government reiterates preparedness
yo: ---Coronavirus: Ijoba Naijiria ti mura sile.

en: The Nigerian Government has said that it has further enhanced its preparedness level to contain the coronavirus also known as COVID-19 epidemic in case of any suspicious case in the country.
yo: Ijoba orile ede Naijiria ti ni ohun ti mura sile lati gbogun ti aarun corona ti a mo si COVID-19, logan ti won ba gburoo re lorile ede yii.

en: Briefing Journalists in Abuja on Tuesday, after an inspection tour of the screening facility, the country's Information and Culture Minister Mr. Lai Mohammed alongside his counterparts from other ministries stated that government was ready to prevent Corona spread.
yo: Minisita fun iroyin ati asa lorile ede Naijiria, Lai Mohammed lo soro yii pelu awon akoroyin lojo Isegun lasiko ti won n se ayewo ohun elo ti won pese sile lati fi gbogun ti arun corona.

en: The Minister said that relevant ministries and agencies are working in synergy to achieve to tackle the virus should it come into the country.
yo: Minisita tun so pe awon ajo ati ile-ise ijoba ti n ba ara won sise papo lati gbogun ti arun corona ni kete to ba wo orile ede Naijiria.

en: He said that the team work and professionalism exhibited by the Task Force set up by the government has given the country a clean bill of health so far but this effort must be sustained.
yo: O ni igbimo ti ijoba apapo yan ti fokan orile ede Naijiria bale pe ko sewu loko longe nipa eto ilera, amosa won ko ni dawo igbiyanju naa duro.

en: Four Ministers the Minister of Aviation, Minister of State for Health, Minister of Humanitarian Affairs, Disaster Management and Social Development, all part of the Inter-Ministerial committee were present at the Inspection tour at the Abuja International Airport.
yo: Awon minisita merin orile ede yii lo wa nibi eto ayewo naa, Minisita fun eto oko oju ofuurufu, Minisita ipinle fun eto ilera, Minisita fun eto omoniyan, ajalu ati idagbasoke awujo, ni won jo wa ni papa ofurufu fun eto ayewo ohun.

en: According to Lai Mohammed, all Media agencies of the Federal Ministry of Information, like the Nigerian Television Authority, Federal Radio Corporation of Nigeria, News Agency of Nigeria, Voice of Nigeria and the National Orientation Agency, are using their platforms to sensitise and enlighten the public on Coronavirus.
yo: Lai mohammed tun ni awon ile-ise iroyin ijoba orile ede yii, ile-ise iroyin ati mohun-maworan orile ede Naijiria, ile-ise agbohun safefe orile ede Naijiria, ile-ise akoroyin ti ijoba orile ede Naijiria, Ohun Naijiria ati ile-ise eleto ilaniloye naa ko gbeyin lati maa se ipolongo ati ilaniloye fun awon ara ilu lori arun corona ohun.

en: Adding that all sensitisation programmes are also being translated to the major indigenous languages.
yo: O tun te siwaju pe eto ilaniloye ohun ni won tun n so ni ede abinibi.

en: Nigeria, Iran to strengthen parliamentary ties
yo: Ile igbimo asofin Naijiria ati Iran yoo fowosowopo

en: The Nigerian House of Representatives has reiterated its commitment to strengthening relationship with the parliament of the Islamic Republic of Iran.
yo: Ile igbimo asofin orile ede Naijiria ti ni orile ede Naijiria yoo fowosowopo pelu ile igbimo asofin orile ede Iran.

en: The Speaker of the House Mr. Femi Gbajabiamila while receiving the Iranian Ambassador to Nigeria, Mr. Morteza Rahimi Zarchi, in Abuja, said a robust parliamentary relationship between the two countries would go a long way in boosting the relationship between the two countries.
yo: Abenugan Femi Gbajabiamila soro yii lasiko to n gba asoju orile ede Iran si Naijiria, ogbeni Morteza Rahimi Zarchi, lalejo niluu Abuja, o so pe ibasepo laarin ile igbimo asofin orile ede Naijiria ati Iran yoo tunbo gbile sii laarin orile ede mejeeji ohun.

en: """We're always delighted when we receive eminent visitors from other countries. We're always excited because it boosts the relationships between the two countries. I believe that diplomacy can be achieved through parliament."
yo: "Abenugan Gbajabiamila ni ""Inu wa maa n dun lati tewogba awon alejo lati ile okeere, nitori pe o maa n je ki ibasepo to wa laarin orile ede Naijiria ati orile naa tun tunbo muna-doko."

en: "We look forward to having a good relationship between your parliament and our parliament,"" Speaker Gbajabiamila said."
yo: """Mo mo pe orile ede Iran n la ipenija koja bii orile ede Naijiria."

en: Earlier, Mr. Zarchi said besides the parliamentary friendship, it was also imperative for the two countries to have stronger economic and cultural ties.
yo: """Saaju eyi ni, ogbeni Zarchi so pe leyin ibasepo pelu ile igbimo asofin orile ede mejeeji ohun, o tun je dandan pe ki orile ede mejeeji naa ni ibasepo lori eto oro aje ati asa."

en: He said Iran has a big role to play in the fight against terrorism, especially in its region, noting that the country attaches importance to the issue.
yo: O ni orile ede Iran ti se gudugudu meje, yaya mefa lati gbogun ti iko oloote paapaa julo ni ekun won.

en: ---Senate confirms new Aviation Authority Head
yo: ---Ile igbimo asofin fonte lu adari ile-ise oko ofuurufu tuntun.

en: Nigerian Senate on Tuesday confirmed the nomination of Captain Musa Shuaibu Nuhu as Director-General of the Nigerian Civil Aviation Authority, NCAA.
yo: Ile igbimo asofin ti fonte lu adari ile-ise oko ofurufu tuntun, Nigerian Civil Aviation Authority, NCAA,Captain Musa Shuaibu Nuhu gege bi adari tuntun fun ajo naa.

en: Nuhu's confirmation was sequel to the consideration of the report on the screening of the nominee by the Senate Committee on Aviation.
yo: Eyi waye leyin ayewo ti igbimo asofin to n mojuto ile-ise oko ofurufu se fun, Musa Shuaibu Nuhu, ti o si yege nibe.

en: "Chairman of the Committee, Senator Smart Adeyemi said that the ""nominee has requisite experience and possesses relevant academic and professional qualifications."""
yo: "Alaga igbimo ohun, Smart Adeyemi, so pe ""Awon yan, Musa Shuaibu Nuhu nitori imo ati eko ti o ni nipa oko ofuurufu."

en: The Senate President, Ahmad Lawan, on January 28, 2020, read a request on the floor from President Muhammadu Buhari for the confirmation of Captain Musa Shuaibu Nuhu as Director-General for the Nigerian Civil Aviation Authority (NCAA).
yo: Lojo kejidinlogbon osu kinni, odun 2020, ni abenugan ile igbimo asofin, Ahmad Lawan, ka iwe ti aare Muhammadu Buhari fi ranse si ile igbimo asofin nipa yiyan Captain Musa Shuaibu Nuhu gege bii adari tuntun fun ajo naa.

en: Captain Musa Shuaibu Nuhu was a reputable airline Pilot and Aviation Safety Expert with well over 30 years.
yo: Captain Musa Shuaibu Nuhu je ogbontarigi awako ofuurufu, ti o si tun se ise naa fun ogbon odun.

en: ---President of the Senate, Dr. Ahmad Lawan has declared open a public hearing on sexual harrassment.
yo: ---Abenugan ile igbimo asofin, Ahmad Lawan ti se ifilole ita gbangba lati je ki awon ara ilu wa soro nipa iwa ifipa banilopo.

en: Senator Lawan said that sexual harassment and intimidation was not just a sexual offence but a criminal offence.
yo: Asofin Lawan ni iwa ifipa-banilopo ati idunkooko moni lati fipa ba eniyan lopo je iwa odaran.

en: He said that there was need for stakeholders to think upon new resolutions and sanctions to check the menace if the extant laws were not tight enough.
yo: Nitori naa, awon ti oro kan gbodo lee forikori lati sofin ti yoo fiya to to je eni to ba hu iwa ibaje ohun.

en: ---Presidency urges Nigerians to beware of fake news peddlers
yo: ---Ile-ise Aare ro omo orile ede Naijiria lati yago fun awon akoroyin ayederu

en: The Presidency has debunked reports making the round that President Muhammadu Buhari would be embarking on a lengthy trip abroad from Wednesday February 19 to 4th April.
yo: Ile-ise Aare ti ro omo orile ede Naijiria lati yago fun awon iroyin eleje ati aheso ti awon akoroyin kan gbe jade pe aare Muhammadu Buhari yoo te oko leti lo si ile okeere lati ojoru, osu keji ojo kokandinlogun titi di ojo kerin, osu kerin.

en: Addressing State House Correspondents, on Monday, Special Adviser to the President on Media and Publicity, Femi Adesina said the report, which emanated on the social media on Sunday was full of falsehood orchestrated by mischief makers.
yo: Oluranwo aare lori iroyin ati ikede, Femi Adesina lo soro yii lojo Aje pelu awon akoroyin pe iro patapata ni awon iroyin to jade lori ero ayelujara lojo Aiku.

en: "He said: ""Purveyors of fake and concocted Information are currently on overdrive, and Nigerians are urged to be careful what they consume as news, and also share with others, particularly from the social media."
yo: "O ni: ""Iroyin t""o jade pe aare orile ede Naijiria, Muhammadu Buhari fe lo si United Kingdom fun ogun ojo, yoo si gba ibe lo si orile ede Saudi Arabia, tun lo si orile ede Austria, iro to jinna si otito ni eyi, lati odo awon eni ibi."

en: The Presidential spokesperson further said the mischief makers are not targeting only the President for ridicule, but members of his family and cabinet.
yo: Agbenuso aare tun ni awon eniyan ibi yii ko tun fi mo lori aare nikan, won tun n so awon aheso oro wonyi nipa ebi ati awon ti wn jo n se ijoba.

en: """Transportation Minister, Rotimi Amaechi was said to have been attacked at Rigasa in Kaduna State, he has denied it, the Air Force was alleged to have killed 250 insurgents, they have denied it, just last week, an online platform published the falsehood that Zahra, the daughter of President Muhammadu Buhari, got employment through the back door as a Deputy Manager at the Petroleum Products Pricing and Regulatory Agency PPPRA, there is no truth to it."
yo: """Won tun gbe iroyin eleje jade pe, awon janduku kolu oko oju irin ti minisita fun eto irinna, Rotimi Amaechi wa nibe ni Rigasa ni ipinle Kaduna, won tun so pe omo aare Buhari, Zahra, gba ise nile itaja epo robi orile ede yii gege bi igbakeji adari ile-ise naa, iro to jinna si otito ni eyi."

en: ---Borno Governor visits Niger Republic to discuss repatriation modalities
yo: ---Gomina Borno sabewo si Niger lati gba awon atipo to wa nibe pada

en: The Borno State Governor, Professor Babagana Umara-Zulum has visited Diffa, Niger Republic, with the aim of putting modalities in place towards the safe and dignified repatriation of the refugees to resettlement communities in Borno State.
yo: Gomina ipinle Borno, ojogbon Babagana Umara-Zulum ti se abewo si Diffa, ni orile ede Niger, lati wa ona si bi awon ti ogun Boko Haram le kuro ni agbegbe, ti won si n se atipo ni orile ede Niger, pada si ipinle Borno.

en: During the visit, the Governor met about 120 thousand refugees, who mostly hailed from local government areas in the northern part of Borno state.
yo: Lasiko ti gomina se abewo si awon atipo ohun, ti won le ni ogofa, to si je pe pupo ninu won lo wa lati apa iwo oorun ipinle Borno.

en: The refugees, made up of men, women and children, fled their homes, in hundreds of communities attacked by Boko Haram insurgents since 2014.
yo: Awon atipo ohun lo je okunrin, obinrin ati awon omode, ti won sa kuro ni agbegbe won nitori ikolu lati owo Boko Haram lati odun 2014, ni eyi ti o ti so opolopo won di eni ti ko nile lori.

en: It was reported that majority of the refugees trekked distances to enter the neighbouring country in search of safety.
yo: Iroyin so pe pupo ninu awon atipo naa lo rin ona jinjin si awon orile-ede agbegbe.

en: The host Governor of Diffa, Isa Lameen, led Governor Zulum during the visit, accompanied by the Speaker, Borno State Assembly, Abdulkarim Lawan, who is from the northern part of Borno State.
yo: Gomina Diffa, Isa Lameen, to je olugbalejo ni o dari gomina Zulum, ati abenugan ile igbimo asofin ipinle Borno, Abdulkarim Lawan.

en: While addressing top officials, Professor Zulum expressed his gratitude to the government of Diffa province, the Federal Government of Niger and the host communities in the country for being hospitable to the Borno citizens.
yo: Ojogbon Zulum wa fi idunnu re han si ijoba ekun Diffa, ijoba orile ede Niger ati awon agbegbe to wa ni orile ede naa fun iwa ifi-omoniyan se ti won hu si awon omo ipinle Borno.

en: Katsina State Governor, Aminu Masari has cautioned communities in the state against taking the law into their hands, following insecurity challenges in the state.
yo: Gomina ipinle Katsina, Aminu Masari ti kilo fun awon eniyan agbegbe ipinle naa lati ma se dajo lati owo ara won nitori wahala to be sile ni ipinle naa.

en: Masari gave the advice in Malumfashi on Sunday during the distribution of empowerment materials donated by Sen. Bello Mandiya to some constituents in Funtua Senatorial District.
yo: Masari soro yii lojo Aiku ni Malumfashi lasiko to n pin awon ohun elo ironilagbara ti asofin Bello Mandiya pese fun awon eniyan to n gbe ni ekun Funtua ni ipinle ohun.

en: He said that the killing of 30 people in Tsanwa and Dankar villages of Batsari Local Governmental of the state was a reprisal by armed bandits from Zamfara forest.
yo: Masari tesiwaju pe pipa awon eniyan ogbon to n gbe ni agbegbe Tsanwa ati Dankar ni ijoba ibile Batsari wa lati owo awon olote ti won wa ninu igbo Zamfara lati gbesan.

en: The governor appealed to all communities not to resort to self-help, but report suspicious persons to relevant authorities for prompt action.
yo: Gomina naa wa ro awon to n gbe ninu agbegbe naa lati maa hu iwa ti won yoo fi gbesan sugbon ti won ba fura si awon eniyan ti owo won ko mo, ki won fi to awon agbofinro leti.

en: Masari urged people of the state to be calm, and assured them that the government and security operatives were on top of the situation.
yo: Masari tun wa ro won lati mu suuru pe ijoba ati awon ajo eso eleto aabo si n se ise lori isele naa.

en: He commiserated with the people in the two villages and the entire state over the incident.
yo: O wa ba awon agbegbe meji to kabaamo ninu isele naa kedun.

en: It would be recalled that bandits believed to be from Zamfara invaded Tsanwa and Dankar villages on Friday and killed 30 people mostly women and children before setting their homes ablaze.
yo: O ni awon odaran ti won wa lati ipinle Zamfara ni won wa si agbegbe Tsanwa ati Dankar lojo Eti, nibi ti won ti pa eniyan ogbon, paapaa julo awon obinrin ati omode, ko to di pe won dana sun awon agbegbe ohun.

en: The state police command said it has arrested one of the bandits.
yo: Ile-ise olopaa ipinle naa ti ni awon ti mu okan lara odaran ohun.

en: ---Minister calls for calm in Bayelsa
yo: ---Minisita pe fun ibaleokan ni ipinle Bayelsa-.

en: The Minister of State for Petroleum Resources, Chief Timipre Sylva, has urged the people of Bayelsa to shun all act of violence and lawlessness.
yo: Minisita ipinle fun oro epo robi, Timipre Sylva ti ro awon omo ipinle Bayelsa lati yago fun iwa jagidi-jagan, ipa ati aibowo fun ofin.

en: Sylva made this known in a statement he signed and released in Abuja on Sunday.
yo: Sylva soro yii lojo Aiku ninu atejade kan ti o gbe sita niluu Abuja.

en: """I want to use this moment to call on all the people of our dear state Bayelsa to kindly shun all acts of violence and lawlessness."
yo: """Mo fe lo asiko yii lati ro gbogbo omo ipinle Bayelsa lati yago fun iwa jagidi-jagan, ipa ati aibowo fun ofin."

en: """Also of great importance to me is to extend my profound apology to our President, Muhammadu Buhari, over the avoidable disruption to his busy schedule which was caused by the events of the moment."
yo: """Mo tun fe lo asiko yii lati fi toro aforijin lowo aare orile ede Naijiria, Muhammadu Buhari, lori isele buruku to waye, ni eyi ti o mu ki aare yi ipinnu re pada lati wa si ipinle Bayelsa."

en: """I am aware that Mr President and his wife Aisha Buhari had concluded arrangements to travel to Bayelsa to witness the inauguration of the APC Governorship candidate as Governor of Bayelsa State."
yo: Silva tun wa ro awon omo ipinle Bayelsa ohun pe, awon adari egbe APC ti n se ise takun-takun lati ri i pe won yanju wahala to be sile ni ipinle naa, ni eyi ti won ti dari awon agbejoro won lati gbe igbese lori re.

en: President Buhari salutes Kaduna Governor at 60
yo: Aare Buhari ki Nasir el-Rufai ku ori-ire ogota odun.

en: Nigeria's President Muhammadu Buhari has joined Kaduna State Executive Council and indigenes to celebrate the State Governor, Nasir el-Rufai, who will turn 60 on Sunday.
yo: Aare orile ede Naijiria, Muhammadun Buhari ti darapo mo igbimo ijoba ati gbogbo omo ipinle Kaduna lati ba gomina ipinle Kaduna Nasir el-Rufai sajoyo ogota (60) odun ti yoo pe lojo Aiku.

en: In a message, President Buhari congratulated the governor for his distinguished service to the nation.
yo: Ninu atejade kan ti, aare Buhari gbe jade lati fi ki gomina naa ku ori-ire fun ise takun-takun ti o ti gbe se fun idagbasoke orile ede Naijiria.

en: He also noted that the Governor's entry into public service was truly accidental, but the contributions he has made are deliberate, well thought out and long lasting.
yo: Aare tun salaye pe bo tile je pe gomina naa ba ara re lenu ise ijoba lairotele sugbon ipa ribi-ribi ti o ti ko lorile ede ko lafiwe rara.

en: Vice President, Professor Yemi Osinbajo has expressed confidence in the ability and competence of Nigerian professionals to solve the nation's problems without recourse to foreign aid.
yo: Igbakeji Aare orile ede Naijiria, Ojogbon Yemi Osinbajo ti ni oun ni igbekele ninu ogbon, imo ati oye awon omo orile ede yii lati yanju isoro to n dojuko orile ede Naijiria lai nilo iranwo lati ile okeere.

en: Professor Osinbajo insisted that, given the impressive performance and achievements recorded by Nigerians across diverse fields, at home and abroad, it is evident that many of the country's problems can be solved by Nigerians themselves.
yo: Ojogbon Yemi osinbajo ni pelu aseyori ti awon omo orile ede Naijiria yii ti se nile yii ati ni ile okeere fihan pe awon omo orile ede yii lee yanju isoro ati ipenija to n dojuko orile ede yii funra won.

en: Professor Osinbajo said this when he received a delegation from the West African College of Surgeons (WACS), in his office on Friday.
yo: Ojogbon Osinbajo soro yii lasiko to n gba iko awon onise abe lati ile -eko West African College of Surgeons (WACS), nile-ise re lalejo lojo Eti.

en: The College formed by a group of young Nigerian surgeons, 60 years ago predated the Economic Community of West African States.
yo: Awon omo orile ede Naijiria to n se ise abe ni won da ile eko naa sile ni ogota (60) odun seyin, saaju igba ti won da ajo ile afirika sile.

en: The delegation led by Professor Ibrahim Yakasai, was at the Aso Rock Presidential Villa to brief the Vice President on the activities of the College including its planned 60th Annual General Meeting and Scientific Conference scheduled for Abuja.
yo: Ojogbon Ibrahim Yakasai, lo dari iko naa wa sile aare lati so nipa awon ojuse ati akitiyan ile -eko naa ati lati so nipa ipade ogota odun ajo naa, ni eyi ti yoo waye niluu Abuja.

en: Professor Yakasai is the Local Organising Committee chairman.
yo: Ojogbon Yakasai ni oludari ayeye ohun.

en: Achievements The immediate past President of the College, Professor King-David Yawe highlighted some of the achievements of WACS especially with regards to free medical outreaches to several Nigerian communities.
yo: Ojogbon King-David Yawe, to je aare ile-eko naa teleri salaye nipa awon aseyori ti WACS ti se paapaa julo nipa awon iwosan ofe ti won ti se ni pupo ninu awon agbegbe to wa lorile ede Naijiria.

en: ---Nigeria adopts multi-prong strategy for road maintenance
yo: ---Orile ede Naijiria gba orisirisi ilana lati tun oju popo se.

en: Nigeria's Minister of Works and Housing, Babatunde Fashola, has affirmed the adoption of a multi-prong strategy for road maintenance across the country to ensure accessibility all year round.
yo: Minisita fun eto ise ati ile lorile ede Naijiria, Babatunde Fashola ti fidi re mule pe lati wa orisirisi ilana fun itoju oju popo ni jake -jado orile ede Naijiria nikan lo le je ki gbogbo ona oju popo wa lee gbounje-fegbe gbawo bo lodoodun.

en: The Minister made this known at Ugep, the largest village in Africa, Yakurr local government area, during the inspection of critical economic roads within Cross River State.
yo: Minisita soro yii ni Ugep to wa ni ijoba ibile Yakurr, to je agbegbe ti o tobi julo nile Afirika lasiko eto ayewo ise oju popo ni ipinle Cross River.

en: Fashola, who was accompanied by key officials of his ministry, noted that road maintenance especially during the rainy season, required the collective responsibility of everyone.
yo: Fasola, ti awon osise re jo kowoorin tun so pe itoju oju popo paapaa julo lasiko ojo je ojuse gbogbo awon eniyan.

en: """We stopped at the Calabar-Itu road, which was a major problem during the raining season, just like the Calabar-Ikom-Ogoja road."
yo: """A duro ni oju ona Calabar-Itu, ti o maa n je wahala fun awon oloko ati eniyan lati gba lasiko ojo gege bi oju ona Calabar-Ikom-Ogoja."

en: It requires us to change our strategy and this year, for roads like Numanchan leading to Taraba, Calabar-Itu, Abeokuta to Otta-Lagos - all of those roads where trucks get stuck during the rains - we need a strategy to ensure that our contractors are mindful of the commuters, while the construction is ongoing.
yo: Nitori naa gbogbo oju ona to maa n fa wahala fun awon oloko lati gba lasiko ojo, awon bii Numanchan to lo si Taraba, Calabar-Itu, Abeokuta si Otta-Lagos - a oo wa eto ilana ti yoo je ki awon agbasese lee maa ro ti awon to n wa oko lasiko ti won ba n se ise won.

en: Project Funding The Managing Director of SEMATECH, Isioma Eziashi attributed the delay in completing the project on time to lack of available funds despite the firms readiness to deliver the project as stipulated on the timeline.
yo: Oludari ile-ise SEMATECH, Isioma Eziashi so pe awon ipenija ti o maa n dojuko won ni owo ti awon ko tete maa ri gba bo tile je ile-ise naa ti setan lati tete pari ise naa lasiko ti won fun won.

en: "---The Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) has presented Certificate of Return to the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) ""s candidate, Douye Diri, as winner of the Bayelsa 2019 governorship election, in compliance with the Supreme Court judgment."
