yo: "---Ajo eleto idibo orile ede Naijiria, (Independent National Electoral Commission ,INEC) ti fun Duoye Diri to je oludije fun ipo gomina labe egbe oselu Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) ni iwe eri gege bi gomina to jawe olubori ninu idibo to waye ni ipinle Bayelsa lodun 2019, ni ibamu pelu idajo ti ile-ejo giga to wa l""orile ede Naijiria da."

en: Diri was presented the certificate of return by National Commissioner in charge of South/South, Mrs May Agbamuche-Mbu, on Friday at INEC headquarters in Abuja.
yo: Komisana fun ajo INEC ni ekun ila iwo oorun arabinrin May Agbamuche-Mbu lo fun Diri ni iwe eri ohun lojo Eti niluu Abuja to je olu-ilu ajo naa to wa ni orile ede Naijiria.

en: Earlier, INEC Chairman, Prof. Mahmood Yakubu, had declared Diri winner of the state governorship election.
yo: Saaju eyi ni alaga ajo INEC, ojogbon Mahmood Yakubu, ti kede pe Diri gege bi olubori ninu idibo gomina ipinle naa.

en: "Receiving the certificate, Diri commended INEC and the judiciary for being the ""last hope of the common man."""
yo: "Diri wa gbosuba fun ajo INEC ati ile-ejo fun bi won se je ""Eyi ti awon eniyan lee ni igbekele ninu won."

en: """We pray and hope that God will heal our land, Bayelsa, and Nigeria. God has taken us through wide road and the road has taught us reconciliation, lessons"" Diri said."
yo: """Diri tun ni ""ki Olorun wo ile Bayelsa san ati orile ede Naijiria lapapo. Olorun ti mu wa rin oju ona, ti a o maa gba lati lee ba ara wa se papo."

en: The Supreme Court on Thursday sacked David Lyon and Sen. Biobarakuma Degi-Eremienyo, as governor and deputy governor-elect in the Nov. 16, 2019 Bayelsa governorship election.
yo: Lojobo ni ile-ejo to ga julo lorile ede Naijiria yo David Lyon ati Biobarakuma Degi-Eremienyo kuro gege bi gomina ipinle Bayelsa

en: ---President Buhari arrives in New York for UN General Assembly
yo: ---Aare Buhari de si New York fun Ipade Apero Ajo UN.

en: President Muhammadu Buhari is in New York, to attend the 74th session of the United Nations General Assembly UNGA.
yo: Aare orile-ede Naijiria Muhammadu Buhari wa ni New York, fun Apero Ajo Isokan Agbaye ti o je ikerinlelaadorin (74) ipade apero iru re.

en: The President, who arrived in New York in the late hours of Sunday, was received on arrival by Nigeria's Ambassador to the US, Justice Sylvanus Adiewere, Ministers of Foreign Affairs, Geoffrey Onyama and that of Health, Dr Osagie Ehanire among others.
yo: Aare Buhari, eni ti o de si New York ni oganjo ojo Aiku, ti asoju orile-ede Naijiria fun ile Amerika, Sylvanus Adiewere, Minisita fun oro okeere, Geoffrey Onyama ati Minisita fun eto ilera, Osagie Ehanire ati awon miiran wa pade re.

en: President Buhari is scheduled to be the 5th to deliver his address at the UNGA general debate, which starts on Tuesday.
yo: Aare Buhari ni eniti yoo je ikarun-un ninu awon ti yoo maa soro nibi Ipade Apero Ajo Isokan Agbaye ohun, ni eyi ti yoo bere lojo Isegun.

en: The President is expected to underscore his administration's commitment to building on the achievements of its three-point agenda following the renewal of his electoral mandate by majority of Nigerians.
yo: Aare Buhari yoo maa soro lori isejoba ati ipinnu meta ti o fe gunle nibi isejoba re leyin ti opo omo Naijiria fibo da a pada sori alefa.

en: He will also reaffirm Nigeria's position on salient global issues.
yo: Yoo si salaye awon ipo ti orile-ede Naijiria wa lori awon oran ti o kan gbogbo agbaye gbongbon.

en: The President's participation at this year's gathering of world leaders is particularly significant as it coincides with Nigeria's Presidency of UNGA.
yo: Ikopa Aare ninu ipejo awon olori orile-ede agbaye odun yii se pataki nitori o se pekinreki pelu Orile-ede Naijiria gege bi Aare Ipade Apero Ajo UN.

en: "The theme for UNGA74 is, ""Galvanizing Multilateral Efforts for Poverty Eradication, Quality Education, Climate Action and Inclusion."""
yo: "Akori ipade Apero Ajo Isokan Agbaye eleekerinlelaadorin (UNGA74) naa ni, ""Igbiyanju Nilopo-ona lati Mu Osi Kuro, Eto Eko to ye Kooro ati Mimojuto Iyipada Oju-ojo ati Ifi-awon-eniyan-gbogbo-kun-eto-gbogbo."

en: ---First Ebola case recorded in DRC city of Goma
yo: ---Arun Ebola akoko sele ni ilu Goma ni Orile-ede Ijoba Awarawa Olominira Congo.

en: The first case of Ebola in the eastern Democratic Republic of Congo city, Goma, was discovered on Sunday, officials said, raising concerns the virus could spread quicker in a densely populated area close to the Rwandan border.
yo: Awon asoju ijoba so wi pe, arun Ebola akoko seyo ni ilu Goma ni ila-oorun Orile-ede Ijoba Awarawa Olominira Congo, ni ojo Aiku, ti o n ba won leru nitori o se e se ki arun oloje naa o tan kia ni agbegbe ti o mu ala pelu orile-ede Rwanda.

en: Goma, a lakeside city of 1 million people, is more than 350 km south of where the second-largest Ebola outbreak on record was first detected a year ago.
yo: "O to aadota-oke kan awon eniyan to n gbe ilu Goma, t""o sunmo bebe adagundo, to ibuso 350 ni guusu apa ibi ti o sikeji agbegbe ti arun Ebola ti o po j u lo ti seyo ni bi odun kan seyin."

en: But the haemorrhagic fever has gradually spread south, infecting nearly 2,500 people and killing more than 1,600.
yo: Sugbon arun iba oloje naa ti n se werewere tan ka de guusu, ti o ti ran awon eniyan 2,500 ti o si pa awon 1,600.

en: How Ebola spread to Goma
yo: Bi arun Ebola se wo ilu Goma

en: The patient was a priest who became infected during a visit to the town of Butembo, 200 km north of Goma, where he interacted with Ebola patients, Congo's health ministry said in a statement.
yo: "Gege bi awon osise ile-iwosan naa se so, alufaa ni eni ti o lugude arun naa lasiko t""o wa si ilu Butembo, ibuso 200 si ariwa Goma, nibi ti o ti sagbako awon eniyan to ni arun Ebola."

en: He developed symptoms last week before taking a bus to Goma on Friday. When he arrived in Goma on Sunday he went to a clinic where he tested positive for Ebola.
yo: "Awon ami arun naa bere si ni maa jeyo lose t""o koja lasiko ki o t o woko akeropupo lo si Goma lojo Eti. Nigba ti o de Goma lojo Aiku ni o lo sile iwosan, nibi ti ayewo ti fi han pe o ni arun Ebola."

en: """Due to the speed with which the patient has been identified and isolated, as well as the identification of all bus passengers from Butembo, the risk of spreading to the rest of the city of Goma remains low,"" the ministry said."
yo: "Gege bi ileese eto ilera se so ""latari ijafara kefin alarun naa ati bi o ti se wa ni iyasotooto, ati isedanimo gbogbo awon ero oko lati Butembo, ewu ifonka si awon agbegbe ti o ku ni Goma kere."" won ni gbogbo ibudoko"

en: Goma has been preparing for the arrival of Ebola for a year, setting up hand-washing stations and making sure motorcycle riders do not share helmets.
yo: Ilu Goma ti n gbaradi fun arun Ebola lati odun to koja, siseto ibi ti awon eniyan naa yoo ti maa fi omi fo owo, ti won si tun se aridaju pe awon awakeke-alupupu ko ya ara won ni akoto.

en: But in more rural areas, the virus has been hard to contain. Local mistrust of health officials and militia violence have hobbled containment efforts, and caused the number of new cases to spike.
yo: Amo ni awon igberiko, arun oloje naa ti soro lati kapa. Aifokantan awon osise eleto ilera ati ija igboro ti di awon akitiyan ikapa lowo, o si ti fa ki awon ti o lugbadi o po si i.

en: Ebola causes diarrhea, vomiting and haemorrhagic fever and can be spread through bodily fluids.
yo: Arun Ebola maa n fa arun igbe gbuuru, eebi, ati arun iba eleje ti o le ran nipase oje ara.

en: An epidemic between 2013 and 2016 killed more than 11,300 people in West Africa.
yo: Ajakale kan ni aarin odun 2013 ati 2016 pa ju eniyan ti o le ni egberun mokanla (11,300) ni Iwo-oorun Ile-Adulawo.

en: WHO responds
yo: WHO fesi

en: The first case of Ebola in Democratic Republic of Congo's eastern city of Goma is a potential game-changer in the scale of the outbreak, World Health Organization Chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said.
yo: Isele arun Ebola akoko iru e ni Orile-ede Ijoba Awarawa Olominira Congo ni ila-oorun ilu Goma je isipopada ti o se koko ninu ipele ajakale naa, Oloye Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus Ajo Eleto Ilera Agbaye so.

en: Tedros said he was hopeful that there would be no further spread of the disease in the city, but he was convening the WHO's emergency committee to decide if the outbreak now constituted an international health emergency.
yo: Tedros so wi pe oun nireti pe ko ni si itankale arun naa ni ilu naa, sugbon o n k o awon igbimo pajawiri ajo WHO jo lati se ipinnu boya ajakale naa je eto ilera pajawiri agbaye.

en: - World Health Organization (WHO)
yo: - Ajo Eleto Ilera Agbaye (WHO)

en: An Ebola Treatment Centre in Goma, DRC, has been operational since February, and the person is now receiving care there. As part of the preparedness, 3000 #healthworkers have been vaccinated in this city alone.
yo: Ibi Iwosan arun Ebola ni Goma, DRC, ti n sise lati osu Erele, ti onitohun si ti n gba itoju nibe. Gege bi igbaradi naa, osise eleto ilera 3000 ni a ti bupa fun ni ilu naa nikan.

en: ---NMA blame States for poor state of Primary Healthcare
yo: ---NMA da awon Ipinle lebi fun ipo aidara eto ilera abele

en: The Nigeria Medical Association (NMA), has blamed the state governments for the poor implementation of Primary Healthcare programmes in the country.
yo: Egbe awon Osise Onisegun Oyinbo orile-ede Naijiria, (Nigeria Medical Association, NMA), ti benu ate lu bi awon gomina ipinle se pa ile iwosan abele orile-ede naa ti segbee kan.

en: Dr Francis Faduyile, the President of NMA, told the press in Abuja, that the poor handling of primary healthcare was due to negligence and poor commitment on the part of state governors.
yo: Aare egbe NMA, Dr Francis Faduyile, lo so fun awon akoroyin niluu Abuja pe, bi awon gomina Ipinle lorile-ede Naijiria ko se kobiara si ile-iwosan abele lo fa a ti awon ile-iwosan naa se denu kole.

en: He stated that the state government had largely abandoned the state health system, stressing that they had allowed it to suffer serious setback.
yo: O so pe awon ijoba ipinle ti pa ile iwosan abele awon ipinle naa ti, ti o n tenu mo o wi pe won ti je ki o ni ifaseyin ti o po.

en: According to him, the state government are in charge of primary healthcare centres and they are in charge of the secondary healthcare institutions and the state government had largely not been up and doing in this regard.
yo: Gege bi o ti se so, ikawo awon ijoba ipinle ni awon ile iwosan abele wa ati pe akata won ni awon ile iwosan gbogbo wa, ti ijoba ipinle ko si se to ati sa ipa ni ti eyi.

en: He said that the NMA had increased its advocacy and would open up discussions with the state government to see what could be done to remedy the embarrassing situation.
yo: O so pe NMA ti jara mo agbawi, yoo si ijiroro pelu ijoba ipinle lati wa ojutuu si ipo adojutini naa.

en: """We are hoping to go to the Governors"" Forum when next they have a meeting to draw attention and address concerns."
yo: """A nireti lati lo si Apero Awon Gomina nigba miiran ti won ba ni ipade lati siju won si awon ohun ti o kan gbongbon."

en: "Primary health care is very important in rectifying the health situation in the country."""
yo: "Eto ilera abele je konti ninu atunse eto ilera ni orile-ede."""

en: Faduyile noted that the Federal Government should take action on the issue of brain drain that could help in salvaging the health sector.
yo: Faduyile so pe ki Ijoba Apapo o wa nnkan se si ti iwagbe opolo ti o le se igbapada eka ilera.

en: According to the NMA president, we have observed that the governments have not performed well in the health sector.
yo: "Gege bi aare egbe NMA se so, a ti s""akiyesi wi pe ijoba ko se daadaa ninu eka ilera."

en: Faduyile said that as part of measures to salvage the health sector, the NMA had taken a step to support Community Health Insurance Scheme.
yo: Faduyile so pe lara awon igbese lati se igbapada eka ilera, NMA ti gbe igbese lati gbaruku ti Eto Madaanilofo Awujo.

en: He said that the association would support states that were forming their health insurance scheme, urging them to seek for guidelines from NMA to do it the right way.
yo: O so pe ajo naa yoo se atileyin fun awon ipinle ti won n se agbekale eto madaanilofo ilera ti won, won ro won lati beere fun itona lowo NMA ni ona ti o ye.

en: ---Nigeria reiterates commitment to promote human rights
yo: ---Naijiria tun ipinnu re so lati se igbelaruge eto omoniyan

en: The Nigerian government says the use of torture to extract confession or as punishment to alleged victims of crime will not be condoned.
yo: Ijoba orile-ede Naijiria ti ni oun ko ni fi aye gba lilo iwa ijiya ipalara lati gba ijewo lowo eni tabi ifiyaja eni ti a fi esun kan mo.

en: Solicitor General of the Federation and Permanent Secretary in the Ministry of Justice, Mr. Dayo Akpata stated this in Abuja, at an event to mark the 2019 United Nations International Day in Support of Victims of Torture.
yo: "Agbejero Agba fun Orile-ede ati Akowe Agba ni ile-ise Eto Idajo, Ogbeni Dayo Akpata l""o s""oro yii niluu Abuja, nibi ayeye lati sami si ajodun Ajo Isokan Agbaye odun 2019 ni Atileyin fun Awon ti o n Jiya ipalara."

en: Psychological trauma Mr. Akpata stated that the right to freedom from torture is not negotiable.
yo: Ogbeni Akpata eni ti o je onimo-egbo inu opolo so wi pe eto ominira ijiya ipalara ki i se ohun idunadura.

en: The Permanent Secretary said that millions of people, family and groups around the world suffers severe physical and psychological trauma as a result of torture.
yo: Akowe Agba naa ni egbeegberun awon eniyan, ebi ati awon legbelegbe jakejado ile-aye n jiya ara ati egbo-inu opolo latari ijiya ipalara.

en: """Every individual living in Nigeria is entitled to respect for the dignity of human person hence, nobody should be subjected to torture or inhumane treatment,"" he said."
yo: "O ni, ""gbogbo omo orile-ede Naijiria l""o ni eto si ibowofun iyin omo-eniyan, lati ihin lo, ko si enikeni ko gbodo fiya je elomiran tabi iwa aisenia."""

en: "According to him, ""Nigeria is a signatory to the UN convention on torture that prohibits the use of torture."
yo: "Ni oro re, ""orile-ede Naijiria je okan lara orile-ede ti o t""owobo iwe ajo UN l""ori ijiya ipalara ti o ka ijiya ipalara leewo."

en: """The Nigerian laws empowered the Ministry to ensure the implementation of the act against torture."""
yo: """Ofin orile-ede Naijiria ti fun Ile-Ise eto idajo l""agbara lati mu aba d""ofin itako iwa ipalara se."""

en: Mr. Akpata was represented by Mr. Hamza Ahmed at the event.
yo: "Ogbeni Hamza l""o soju fun ogbeni Akpata nibi ayeye naa ."

en: ---VP Osinbajo to meet with Mike Pence, others in the US
yo: "---Igbakeji Aare Osinbajo yoo sepade pelu Mike Pence, ati awon t""o ku l""orile-ede Amerika"

en: Vice President Yemi Osinbajo is visiting the United States where he will be meeting with his US counterpart, Mr. Mike Pence, and other key groups and interests in the country.
yo: Igba-keji Aare Yemi Osinbajo n lo si orile Amerika, United States nibi ti yoo ti maa sepade pelu akegbe re ti o je igba-keji Aare orile-ede Amerika ogbeni Mike Pence, ati awon eniyan jankan-jankan lorile-ede naa.

en: "A statement from the Office of the Vice President said ""ahead of his meeting with the US Vice President in Washington D.C on Wednesday, Professor Osinbajo will be meeting with the Council on Foreign Relations on Monday in New York."
yo: "Atejade kan ti o wa lati ile-ise igba-keji Aare so pe ""Igba-keji Aare ojogbon Yemi Osinbajo yoo koko se ipade pelu igbimo alase lori oro to je mo ti ile okeere lojo Aje ni New York, ki o to maa sepade pelu igba-keji Aare orile-ede Amerika ni Washington DC ni ojo Ojoru."

en: """In his meeting with his American counterpart, VP Osinbajo would be discussing matters of mutual interests between Nigeria and the US, while he would be speaking on Nigeria's economic prospects and other related matters in his meeting with the Council on Foreign Relations."""
yo: """Lara nnkan ti igba-keji Aare, Yemi Osinbajo yoo maa ba akegbe re jiroro ni lori bi idagbasoke yoo se tubo maa gbile si i lori ibasepo t""o wa laaarin orile-ede mejeeji, bakan naa, ni igbakeji Aare Osinbajo yoo tun maa soro lori eto oro aje."

en: The Vice President left for the US on Saturday afternoon and is expected back in Abuja on Thursday.
yo: """Igbakeji Aare fi ilu sile ni osan ojo Abameta, ireti wa pe yoo pada si Abuja ni ojo Ojobo."

en: ---Muhammad-Bande becomes UN General Assembly President
yo: ---Muhammad-Bande di Aare Apero Ajo UN

en: Nigeria's Permanent Representative to the United Nations, Ambassador Tijjani Muhammad-Bande has emerged President of the 74th UN General Assembly.
yo: Asoju orile-ede Naijiria fun Ajo Isokan Agbaye (United Nations) Tijjani Muhammad-Bande ni o ti jawe olubori gege bi Aare kerinlelaaadorin Apero Ajo Isokan Agbaye.

en: Muhammad-Bande, the sole candidate for the position, was elected through acclamation at the 87th plenary meeting of the Assembly in New York on Tuesday, June 4.
yo: "Muhammad-Bande, nikan l""o dije fun ipo yii, a dibo yan an nipase pipa ohun po lasiko ipade apero ajo agbaye ketadinlaadorun-un t""o waye ni New York lojo Isegun, ojo kerin osu kefa."

en: He is the second Nigerian to hold the office after Joseph Garba, a retired military officer and diplomat, who led the organ between 1989 and 1990.
yo: Oun ni yoo je omo Naijiria keji ti yoo di ipo naa mu leyin ti ajagun feyin ti Joseph Garba ti o je asoju tele ri ati ogbon oselu, eni ti o dari iko naa laaarin odun 1980 si 1990.

en: He will be inaugurated in September 2019.
yo: Osu Kesan-an odun 2019 ni o bere ise.

en: ---Nigerians in diaspora to advocate for diaspora voting
yo: "---Awon omo orile-ede Naijiria ni eyin odi n s""alagbaawi fun idibo lati ilu okeere."

en: Nigerians in the diaspora have been urged to advocate for the implementation of a law to allow for diaspora voting.
yo: Won ti ro gbogbo awon omo orile-ede Naijiria to n gbe ni ilu okeere lati se agbawi fun ofin ti yoo gba won laaye lati maa dibo lasiko eto idibo nibikibi leyin odi.

en: The Chairman, Diasporas Commission in Nigeria and the Senior Special Adviser to President Muhammad Buhari, Abike Dabiri-Erewa, made the call at a cocktail with a delegation of APC Diaspora members, in Abuja, Nigeria.
yo: "Alaga, Ajo Awon Omo orile-ede Naijiria nile okeere, ti o tun je Oludamoran Pataki fun Aare Muhammadu Buhari, Abike Dabiri-Erewa, l""o pe ipe yii lasiko apeje ti won se fun awon asoju omo egbe APC t""o n gbe niluu okeere, ni ilu Abuja, orile-ede Naijiria."

en: """ thank you so much for coming all the way home because you want to be part of President Buhari's inauguration."
yo: """ e seun pupo ti e wa sile nitori wi pe e fe wa darapo mo eto ifinijoye Aare Buhari."

en: You all worked hard for him to succeed and by the grace of God and with determination, the President spoke to you yesterday, he is not going to let all of you down.
yo: Gbogbo yin ni e ti se ise takuntakun fun aseyori re, pelu oore-ofe Olorun ati ipinnu, Aare ba a yin soro lanaa, ko ni ja gbogbo yin kule.

en: """ I think one of the greatest goals we all must achieve is the Diaspora voting."
yo: "O ni "" Oun ti mo lero pe ilepa ti o se Pataki ju lo fun wa ni aseyege idibo lati ilu okeere."

en: "And we all have to work together to make it happen."" She said."
yo: Gbogbo wa ni a ni lati sise po lati se aseyori.

en: """I am going to appeal to all of you, as the 9th Assembly comes in, let's start immediately, let's move to Parliaments and lobby them to ensure that Nigerians in diaspora can vote, so make it a priority."" She noted."
yo: "O so ""Mo fe ro gbogbo yin, bi Apejo kesan-an se n ile wole, e je ki a bere lesekese, ki a gbiyanju lati lo si Igbimo-asofin, k""a si ko si won lemii lati ri i daju wi pe awon omo orile-ede Naijiria ni eyin odi lati le dibo, nitori naa o se koko."""

en: """now you have a Diaspora Commission, work with the Commission to ensure this happens, if smaller counties can do it, I see no reason why Nigerians can't vote."" She noted."
yo: "O so ""ni bayii e ti ni Ajo Omo orile-ede nile okeere, e fowosowopo pelu Ajo naa, ki eyi ba le di mimuse, bi awon orile-ede kerejekereje ba lee se e, mi ko ri idi kan ti awon Omo orile-ede Naijiria ko lee dibo."""

en: """ it's going to be a tough battle, but we need to ensure that Diaspora voting becomes a reality."" She emphasised."
yo: "O tenumo "" yoo je ogun ti o soro lati ja, sugbon a gbodo se aridaju wi pe idibo leyin odi di amuse."""

en: ---President Buhari heads to Saudi Arabia for OIC Summit
yo: ---Aare Buhari forile orile-ede Saudi Arabia fun Ipade apero OIC.

en: President Muhammadu Buhari has left Abuja to attend the Summit of the Organisation of Islamic Cooperation, OIC in Makkah, Saudi Arabia.
yo: Aare Muhammadu Buhari ti fi Abuja sile lati lo fun Ipade apero Egbe Ajumose awon Elesin Islam, OIC niluu Makkah ni orile-ede Saudi Arabia.

en: The 14th session of the Summit Conference of the OIC, scheduled to hold on Friday, May 31, will be hosted by King Salman bin Abdulaziz Al Saud and attended by Heads of State and Governments of Member States.
yo: Ipade apero gbogbogboo OIC eleekerinla iru re, ti yoo waye lojo Eti (Friday) ojokankandinlogbon, osu Karun-un, ti Oba Salman Abdulaziz Al Saud yoo gbalejo, ti awon Olori orile-ede ti won je omo egbe ajo naa yoo lo fun.

en: "According to the OIC secretariat, the summit to be convened under the theme, ""Makkah al-Mukarramah Summit: Hand in Hand toward the Future,"" seeks to develop a unified stance on events in the Islamic world."
yo: "Gege bi ile-ise Akowe egbe OIC se fi lede, akori ipade apero naa ni: ""Apero Makkah al-Mukarramah: Ifowosowopo fun ojo-ola "" lati mu idagbasoke ba isokan awon elesin Musulumi lagbaaye."

en: President Buhari is expected to address the forum and underscore the need for member countries to unite and work together to combat common challenges such as terrorism and violent extremism.
yo: Aare Buhari yoo soro nibi ipade naa ati imenuba idi ti awon orile-ede ti won je omo egbe ajo naa fi gbodo fimo-sokan, lati sise papo lati gbogun ti awon ipenija bi i iwa idunkooko-moni ati laasigbo awon alakata-kiti.

en: ---Nigeria seeks U.S. assistance to tackle unemployment
yo: ---Naijiria rawo ebe iranwo si U.S lati koju isoro airisese.

en: Nigeria is seeking help from the United States of America to address the issue of unemployment in the country.
yo: Orile-ede Naijiria n beere fun iranlowo lati odo orile-ede Ipinle Isokan Amerika lati gbogun ti isoro airise lorile-ede naa.

en: "The Permanent Secretary, Federal Ministry of Labour and Employment, William Alo, says Nigeria needs assistance from the U.S in ""tackling the unemployment challenges bedeviling the country."""
yo: "Akowe Agba fun Ajo to-n-ri-si eto ise ati Igbanisise (Federal Ministry of Labour and Employment), William Alo, so pe orile-ede Naijiria nilo iranlowo lati odo U.S lati ""doju ija ko ipenija airise to n koju orile-ede naa."""

en: Receiving a delegation from the U.S. Department of Labour, led by Kurt Petermeyer, who is the Regional Administrator, Occupational Safety and Health Administration, Mr Alo said that assistance from the U. S. to upgrade the skill acquisition centres in the country would be of immense benefit to Nigeria, as it would enhance job creation.
yo: "Lasiko t""o n gba iko Eka ile-ise eto ise lati orile-ede Amerika, ti Kurt Petermeyer, eni ti o je Alaboojuto Eka Isakoso Eto aabo ati Ilera se adari, ogbeni Alo so pe iranlowo lati odo U.S. lati mu awon ibi ikoni ni ogbon imoose yoo se anfaani ribiribi fun orile-ede Naijiria, ni ti imudara ipese ise."

en: ---President Buhari continues religious obligation in Makkah
yo: ---Aare Buhari tesiwaju ninu eto ilana esin ni Makkah

en: President Muhammadu Buhari arrived in Makkah, Saudi Arabia, from the city of Madinah where he began the initial leg of his Umrah engagements in the Kingdom.
yo: Aare Muhammadu Buhari de si Makkah, ni Saudi Arabia, lati ilu Madinah nibi ti o ti bere igbese ti o siwaju ise Umrah ni Ile-oba naa.

en: After the evening prayer in the Holy Prophet's Mosque, the President was ushered to the grave of Prophet Mohammed where he said prayers for the nation, his family and himself.
yo: Leyin adura asale ni Mosalasi Ojise nla, a mu Aare lo si iboji ojise nla Mohammed nibiti o ti gbadura fun orile ede, ebi re ati oun funra re.

en: He was seen off at the Prince Mohammed Bin Abdulaziz Madina International Airport by the Governor of the Madinah Province, Prince Faisal Bin Salman Bin Abdulaziz Al-Saud.
yo: Gomina ekun Madinah Prince Khalid Bin Faisal Al-Saud, sin aare jade ni Papako Ofuurufu ti Prince Mohammed Bin Abdulaziz Madina International Airport.

en: The President was welcomed at Makkah by the Regional Governor, Prince Khalid Bin Faisal Al-Saud.
yo: Gomina agbegbe Makkah, Prince Khalid Bin Faisal Al-Saud ni o ki Aare kaabo ni Makkah.

en: Also at hand to receive him were the Nigerian Ambassador to Saudi Arabia, Justice Isa Dodo (rtd), the Director General of the National Intelligence Agency, Ambassador Ahmed Rufa'i Abubakar and officials of the Nigerian Consulate in Jeddah.
yo: "Bakannaa lara awon t""o wa lati tewogba Aare ni Asoju orile ede Naijiria ni Saudi Arabia, Onidajo toti feyinti Isa Dodo, oga agba pata fun Ajo Otelemuye, Asoju Ahmed Rufa'i Abubakar ati awon osise Asoju ijoba orile ede Nigeria ni Jeddah."

en: After the reception, he immediately went ahead to commence the Umrah rites Friday evening.
yo: Leyin igbalejo, logan ni o bere ise Umrah ni asale ojo eti.

en: ---President Buhari will be in Saudi Arabia for Umrah rites.
yo: ---Aare Buhari yoo wa ni Saudi Arabia lati se awon ilana-esin ti Umrah.

en: President of Nigeria Muhammadu Buhari has received a letter of invitation from the King of Saudi Arabia, Salman Bin Abdulaziz, for Umrah rites (lesser pilgrimage) in that nation.
yo: Aare orile-ede Naijiria Muhammadu Buhari ti gba iwe ipe lati odo Oba ti Saudi Arabia, Salman Bin Abdulaziz, lati wa se awon ilana-esin Umrah (irinajo ile-mimo kekere) ni orile-ede naa.

en: Part of those that will go with the President to Saudi Arabia are his special assistance, the President will land in Saudi Arabia on Thursday 16th of May.
yo: Lara awon ti yoo tele Aare lo si orile-ede Saudi Arabia ni awon oluranlowo re pataki, Aare yoo gunle si orile-ede Saudi Arabia ni ojo Ojobo, ojo kerindinlogun, osu Karun-un.

en: ---Nigeria, Angola to strengthen sub-regional security
yo: ---Orile-ede Naijiria ati Angola yoo fowosowopo lati mu eto aabo agbegbe-sagbegbe gbopon si i.

en: Nigeria and Republic of Angola have agreed to work together to enhance peace, stability and security in Africa particularly in the West and Central African region.
yo: Orile-ede Naijiria ati Angola yoo fowosowopo lati jo mu ki eto alaafia o ga si i, idurosinsin ati eto aabo ni ekun ile-Adulawo papaa ju lo ni Iwo-oorun ati agbegbe Aarin-gbungbun ile-Adulawo.

en: The two countries agreed on this in a communique issued at the end of a meeting between Foreign Affairs Minister, Geoffrey Onyeama and Angolan Minister of External Relations, Manuel Augusto, on Thursday in Abuja.
yo: "Orile-ede mejeeji naa jo t""owobo iwe adehun leyin ipade kan laaarin Minisita to n ri si oro to je mo ile okeere, Geoffrey Onyeama ati Minisita fun Ibasepo Orile-ede Okeere ti Orile-ede Angola, Manuel Augusto, ni ojo Ojoru niluu Abuja."

en: The communique was jointly signed by Augusto and Onyeama,
yo: Augusto ati Onyeama ni won jo towobo iwe adehun naa.

en: The two countries stressed the need to deepen political, socio-economic and cultural collaboration in furtherance of the developmental agenda of both countries and the African continent.
yo: Orile-ede mejeeji naa jo forikori lori ona ti won yoo gba mu eto iselu, awujo ati oro-aje rinle ati ajosepo asa ni itesiwaju agbese idagbasoke orile-ede mejeeji ati Ile-Adulawo naa.

en: Both countries acknowledged the global economic crisis, the challenges of climate change and terrorism.
yo: Awon orile-ede mejeeji ti gba awon wahala, awon ipenija iyipada oju-ojo ati iwa ipaniyan.

en: They agreed on the imperative for concerted collective action to combat effectively, all threats to the sustainable development of the two countries and the African continent.
yo: Won pinnu lori koko ajosepo igbese lati gbogunti, gbogbo irokeke imuro idagbasoke awon orile-ede mejeeji ati Ile-Adulawo.

en: The two countries agreed to leverage on the bilateral relations between them and intensify collaboration towards enhancing the level of peace, stability and security of the subregions.
yo: Awon orile-ede mejeeji naa yoo tun jo maa jiroro lori pipese eto alaafia to yi dande, idurosinsin ati eto aabo ni agbegbe naa.

en: ---Senate confirms Abike Dabiri-Erewa as pioneer Diaspora Commission boss
yo: "---Ile igbimo asofin f""onte lu Abike Dabiri-Erewa gege bi adari Ajo Eyin odi"

en: The Nigerian Senate has confirmed the appointment of Abike Dabiri-Erewa as the pioneer Chairman/Chief Executive of the Nigerians in Diaspora Commission following her nomination by President Muhammadu Buhari.
yo: "Ile igbimo asofin ti f""onte lu ipinnu Aare Muhammadu Buhari lati fi Abike Dabiri-Erewa se Oga-agba/Alaga Ajo Oro-to-je-mo-ile-okeere paapaa julo oro t""o ba kan omo orile-ede Naijiria nile okeere."

en: Mrs. Dabiri-Erewa, a former member of the House of Representatives, is presently the Senior Special Assistant on Foreign Affairs and Diaspora to President Buhari.
yo: "Iyaafin Dabiri-Erewa, t""o je omo ile igbimo asoju teleri, ni Oluranlowo Pataki lori oro to je mo ile okeere fun Aare Buhari lowolowo."

en: """The committee, after a critical scrutiny of the curriculum vitae and other accompanying documents of the nominee, and having been satisfied about her integrity, exposure, suitability, competence and experience in politics and public service, found Hon. Abike Dabiri-Erewa as fit and proper person for appointment as chairman/chief executive officer of the Nigerians in Diaspora Commission,"" she said."
yo: "O ni ""leyin ti igbimo asofin ti pari iwadii finnifinni won tan lori iwe eri eko-atise ati awon iwe miiran nipa awon eni-a-yan, ti otito re, irita, ibamu, ikaju-osuwon ati iriri re ninu eto oselu ati ise ilu si te won lorun, igbimo naa ri Eni-owo Abike Dabiri Erewa bi eni ti o danto ati eni ti ipo alaga/oga-agba yanyan Ajo oro omo orile-ede Naijiria ni ile okeere."""

en: She said Dabiri-Erewa was qualified to occupy the position having been screened by the committee in accordance with the provisions of the nation's Constitution.
yo: O ni pe Dabiri-Erewa yege lati bo si ipo naa leyin ti awon igbimo ti se ayewo finnifinni ni ibamu pelu alaale ofin orile-ede Naijiria.

en: Senator Oko added that the appointee holds Bachelor of Arts (English) in 1983; post graduate degree (Mass Communication) in 1986 while she also obtained a professional certificate from John Kennedy School of Government, Harvard University, United States in June 2002.
yo: "Asofin Oko s""afikun wi pe eni-a-fa-sile naa gba imo ijinle ninu Ona (ede Geesi) lodun 1983; o tesiwaju ninu eko imo ijinle lati tun gba oye miiran ninu eko Ibaraenisoro Olopo lodun 1986, o si tun ni iwe-eri akosemose lati Ileewe imo eko Isejoba John Kennedy, ti Fafiti Harvard, lorile-ede United States, ni osu kefa Odun 2002."

en: ---Cyclone slams Indian temple town after people flee homes
yo: "---Iji-lile kolu ilu ile-isin l""orile-ede India leyin ti opo eniyan sa kuro nibugbe won"

en: "A cyclone barrelled into eastern India on Friday, bringing down trees and power lines and ""extensively"" damaging the tourist town of Puri, but there were no early reports of casualties with a million people evacuated before it made landfall."
yo: Opo eniyan ni o ti padanu ibugbe won, ti awon miiran si padanu ohun ini won ni agbegbe Puri, lorile-ede India latari isele iji lile ti o waye lojo Eti, Iroyin fi mule pe, iji lile naa ba awon ohun amayederun je pupo bii opo ina mona-mona, opo ero ibanisoro abbl.

en: Tropical Cyclone Fani, the strongest to hit India in five years, spent days building up power in the northern reaches of the Bay of Bengal before it struck the coast of the state of Odisha at around 8 a.m.
yo: Gege bi ajo to n mojuto isele pajawiri, won ni isele iji lile naa koko sose ni eka ila oorun ilu Bengal ki o to sun lo si Ipinle Odisha ni aago mejo owuro.

en: ---One dead, several injured in Venezuela crisis
yo: ---Opo farapa yanayana, enikan padanu emi re ninu ikolu Venezuela.

en: A woman was shot dead and dozens injured in the Venezuelan capital Caracas on Wednesday, in clashes between opposition supporters and pro-government forces.
yo: Ninu ikolu ti o waye lorile-ede Venezuela laaarin omo-ogun ijoba orile-ede naa ati awon ololufe egbe oselu alatako ni ojo Ojoru, iroyin fi mule pe omobinrin kan padanu emi re latari ota ibon ti o fara gba, ti opo eniyan si farapa yanayana.

en: Opposition leader Juan Guaido called for those responsible for the death of a 27-year-old woman to be found.
yo: Adari egbe oselu alatako ohun, Juan Guaido ti pe lati sawari awon ti o ba wa nidii iku omobinrin omo odun metadinlogbon naa.

en: He urged public employees to act on Thursday, saying the stoppages would lead to a general strike.
yo: "O wa ro awon osise ni ojo Ojobo lati wa fi ehonu won han, eleyii ti o si le e s""okunfa idasile."

en: Mr Guaido in January declared himself Venezuela's interim leader, and he has been recognised by more than 50 countries including the US, UK and most Latin America nations.
yo: Ogbeni Guaido kede ara re gege bi oludari ijoba orile-ede Venezuela losu Kinni odun ti a wa yii, bee si ni opo orile-ede ti o lamii-laaka lagbaaye bi ile Amerika, UK abbl satileyin fun lati tuko orile-ede naa.

en: The president dismissed suggestions he had been ready to flee the country and accused the US of directing an attempted coup. Those involved would be punished, he said.
yo: Aare benu ate lu iroyin aheso kan ti o so pe Oun fe fi orile-ede oun sile, bee si ni o tun fesun kan orile-ede Amerika fun dida oro naa lona ti o to.

en: ---Nigeria-UK Economic Development Forum holds in Abuja
yo: ---Ipade apero lori idagbasoke eto oro-aje laaarin orile-ede Naijiria-UK waye niluu Abuja.

en: Nigeria's Vice President, Professor Yemi Osinbajo, says investor-interest is on the rise in Nigeria now.
yo: "Igbakeji Aare orile-ede Naijiria, Ojogbon Yemi Osinbajo, ti ni pupo ninu awon onisowo l""o ti nifee lati da eto okoowo sile lorile-ede Naijiria bayii."

en: The Vice President disclosed this when he spoke at the first Nigeria-UK Economic Development Forum (EDF), hosted by the Federal Government at the Presidential Villa, Abuja.
yo: Igbakeji Aare soro yii lasiko ipade apero lori eto oro aje laaarin orile-ede Naijiria ati UK, ni eyi ti o je akoko iru re ti o waye ni Ile Agbara Aare, niluu Abuja.

en: The Economic Development Forum was signed in August 2018 by President Muhammadu Buhari and Prime Minister Theresa May in London as a platform to foster economic and development ties between Nigeria and the United Kingdom.
yo: Osu keje odun 2018 ni Aare Muhammadu Buhari ati oludari ijoba niluu London, Theresa May, towobo iwe adehun lasiko Ipade apero lori idagbasoke eto oro-aje laaarin orile-ede Naijiria ati orile-ede United Kingdom.

en: "According to the Vice President, ""we have seen increased investor interest in Nigeria between 2017 and 2018."
yo: "Gege bi Igbakeji Aare se so, ""awon onisowo ti won nifee lati da okoowo won sile lorile-ede Naijiria tun ti po si bayii laaarin odun 2017 si odun 2018."

en: ---President Buhari directs AGF to intervene in Zainab's case
yo: "---Aare Buhari p""ase fun Adajo Agba orile-ede Naijiria lati da si oran Zainab"

en: President Muhammadu Buhari has directed Mr Abubakar Malami, the Attorney General of the Federation and Minister of Justice to immediately intervene in the case of Zainab Aliyu, the student, incriminated in drug related matters and being detained by the Saudi Arabia authorities.
yo: "Aare Muhammadu Buhari ti p""ase fun Adajo Agba orile-ede ati Minisita fun Eto idajo ogbeni Abubakar Malami, lati wa woroko fi sada nipa gbigbe igbese lori bi won yoo se yo arabinrin Zainab Aliyu, to je akekoo, ti awon odaran kan ko sinu wahala nipa gbigbe oogun oloro sinu eru re, ti o si wa ni igbekun ijoba orile-ede Saudi Arabia."

en: In a statement issued in Abuja on Monday by Abdur-Rahman Balogun, Media aide to Hon. Abike Dabiri-Erewa, SSA to the President on Diaspora Affairs said that the President gave the directive two weeks ago when the matter was brought to his attention.
yo: Ninu atejade kan ti Abdur-Rahman Balogun, oluranlowo lori Iroyin fun Eni-owo Abike Dabiri, Oludamoran Pataki Agba fun Aare lori Oro omo Naijiria ni ile okeere, gbe jade niluu Abuja so wi pe Aare pa ase naa ni ose meji seyin nigbati oran naa to oun leti.

en: """President Muhammadu Buhari gave the directive immediately the matter was brought to his attention about two weeks ago."
yo: """Aare Muhammadu Buhari pa ase naa nikete ti o gbo isele ohun ni ose meji seyin."

en: """My office has been working with the AGF as well as the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in that regard."""
yo: """Ibi-ise mi ti n sise pelu Adajo Agba orile-ede Naijiria ati Ajo t""o n ri si oro t""o jemo ti ile okeere lori oro naa."""

en: The Presidential aide assured that progress was being made in Zainab case, along with two others in similar circumstances in Saudi Arabia.
yo: Oluranlowo Aare fi daniloju wi pe ise n tesiwaju ninu oran Zainab, pelu awon meji miiran ti o wa ninu ipo kan naa ni ile Saudi Arabia.

en: Dabiri Erewa said that Zainab, though detained, has not been put on trial by the Saudi Arabia government. And with the hard evidence that those who implicated her have been arrested, a strong legal case is being made to the Saudi authorities
yo: Dabiri-Erewa so wi pe, loooto Zainub wa ni atimole, ijoba ile Saudi Arabia ko tii fi oju re ba ile ejo. Ti o si le lati gba eri wi pe won ti mu awon ti won ko ba a gbo, ejo ti o lagbara ni a fe pe awon alase Saudi.

en: JAMB conducts foreign based exams in seven countries
yo: Ajo JAMB se idanwo ni orile-ede meje ni ilu okeere.

en: The Joint Admissions and Matriculation Board, JAMB has conducted a foreign based examination for Nigerian candidates abroad and citizens of other nationalities who wants to study in Nigeria.
yo: "Ajo to n mojuto idanwo fun awon t""o fe wo fafiti, ile-eko gbogbonise ati ile-eko awon oluko l""orile-ede Naijiria ti se idanwo fun awon omo orile-ede yii to wa niluu okeere ati awon omo orile-ede miiran ti won fe tesiwaju nipa eko won ni orile-ede Naijiria."

en: The Board said the examination was conducted to give equal opportunity to Nigerians in Diaspora and foreigners who are desirous of acquiring qualitative Tertiary education in Nigeria.
yo: "Igbimo naa ni awon seto idanwo yii lati je ki gbogbo awon omo orile-ede Naijiria t""o wa nile okeere ati awon omo orile-ede miiran to nifee lati kekoo ni Ileeko-giga t""o ye kooro l""orile ede Naijiria ni anfaani kan naa."

en: The examination was conducted in Ghana, United Kingdom, Cameroon, Benin Republic, Cote d'Ivoire South Africa and Kingdom of Saudi Arabia.
yo: Awon orile-ede ti ajo naa ti se idanwo naa ni orile-ede Ghana, United Kingdom, Cameroon, Benin Republic, Cote d'Ivoire, South Africa ati Ile-oba Saudi Arabia.

en: The board made this known in its weekly bulletin, released to the media, by its Head of Media, Dr Fabian Benjamin.
yo: Ajo naa so eyi di mimo ninu atejade kan ti Alukoro ajo naa, Omowe Fabian Benjamin gbe jade.

en: "According to the board, ""Over 200 candidates took the UTME examination that held simultaneously on Saturday, 27th April, 2019 in all the aforementioned centres"""
yo: "Ajo naa ni ""O le ni igba awon akekoo t""o se idanwo UTME ti o waye nigbakanaa ni ojo Abameta, ojo ketadinlogbon, osu kerin, odun, 2019 ni awon ibi gbogbo ti a daruko tele."

en: """The board wishes to state emphatically that the results of the 2019 UTME have not been released."""
yo: Ajo naa tun tenpele mo oro re pe, esi idanwo UTME ti odun 2019 ko tii jade.

en: It urged the public, particularly parents and candidates, to be wary of dubious elements and disregard any overtures made by anybody touting their power or influence to inflate any candidate's score.
yo: """O wa ro awon eniyan paapaa julo awon obi ati akekoo naa pe ki won sora fun awon onijibiti, ti won a so pe won fe lo ona eburu lati ran won lowo fun esi idanwo ti won se."

en: """The Board will make it public when the results are ready"" the board said."
yo: "Ajo naa tun so pe ""Ajo naa yoo polongo esi idanwo naa, nigba ti o ba jade"

en: "Security operatives have picked up some of these nefarious characters and they are on the trail of others still at large,"" it added."
yo: """Owo awon agbofinro ti te awon odaran kan, ni eyi ti won si n wa awon yooku"

en: US express satisfaction in partnership with Nigeria to end Malaria
yo: Amerika kan saara si fowosowopo pelu orile-ede Naijiria lati fopin si aisan iba.

en: The United States government says it is satisfied with its partnership with Nigeria and the support towards the fight against Malaria.
yo: Ijoba orile-ede Amerika ti fi idunnu han bi won se fowosowopo ati lati satileyin fun orile-ede Naijiria nipa gbigbogun ti aisan iba.

en: "The US Ambassador to Nigeria, W. Stuart Symington stated this in a statement to mark World Malaria day with the theme: """"Zero Malaria Starts with Me."""
yo: "Asoju orile-ede Amerika si orile-ede Naijiria, W. Stuart Symington l""o soro yii l""asiko ayeye lati fi sami ayajo Ojo Aisan iba Lagbaaye ti won pe akori re ni: ""Lati gbogun ti aisan iba bere lati odo mi."""

en: Ambassador Symington also saluted all Nigeria's health champions ranging from health workers to mothers, pharmacists to drivers, journalists to researchers, teachers to warehouse managers and all those working to end malaria.
yo: Asoju Symington wa gbosuba fun awon ajo eleto ilera orile-ede Naijiria fun akitiyan won lati ori awon osise eleto ilera, de ori awon iya, awon apoogun oyinbo, awako, akoroyin, awon oniwadii, oluko de ori awon alakooso ile-ikonnkanpamo ati gbogbo awon to ko ipa pataki lati gbogun ti aisan iba lorile-ede Naijiria.

en: Ambassador Symington noted that as a global community, they have achieved remarkable success towards the elimination of the disease.
yo: Asoju Symington so pe gege bi awujo agbaye, won ti se aseyori nipase igbogunti arun naa.

en: ---President Buhari demands more respect for farmers
yo: ---Aare Buhari fe imoriya fun awon agbe.

en: President Muhammadu Buhari says a top priority of his administration is to ensure that the efforts of hardworking Nigerian farmers are respected.
yo: Aare Muhammadu Buhari ti ni sise imoriya fun awon agbe lorile-ede Naijiria ni yoo je ohun akoko ti o wa lokan oun lati se ninu ijoba re.

en: "The President said it is in this regard that he directed the Ministry of Agriculture and the Central Bank of Nigeria to bypass the knotty issue of collateral which he described as ""a terrible colonial legacy,"" so that farmers will get easy access to capital."
yo: "Aare so pe oun ti pase fun Ajo to n mojuto Ise Ogbin ati Ile-Ifowopamo ti Ijoba Orile-ede Naijiria lati yo awon isoro ati idiwo ti ko je ki awon agbe ri owo ya lati fi se ise ogbin kuro nibe, ni eyi ti o pe ni ""Iwa amunisin buruku."""

en: End to Smuggling
yo: Fifopin si iwa fayawo

en: President Buhari also identified smuggling as a threat to domestic agricultural production and processing, and promised to continue to fight the menace with all means available to government.
yo: Aare Buhari wa benu ate lu iwa fayawo ti o n sakoba fun ohun ogbin ati ise agbe lorile-ede Naijiria, o si seleri pe oun ko ni kaaare lati tubo maa gbogun ti iwa buruku yii pelu gbogbo agbara to ba wa ni ikawo oun.

en: The President gave the assurance that in addition to the focus of his administration on security, economy and the war against corruption, the new administration in his second term will pay greater attention to education and health.
yo: Aare ni ijoba oun yoo tubo maa sa ipa re lori eto aabo, idagbasoke eto oro-aje ati gbigbogun ti iwa ibaje, saa tuntun ijoba oun yoo tenpele mo eto eko ati ilera.

en: """I understand our problems. I am acutely aware of my duty to my God and country. I will continue to do my best,"" he told the support group."
yo: "Aare so fun awon omo egbe naa pe ""Mo mo isoro wa. Mo mo ojuse mi si Olorun ati orile-ede mi. N o maa tesiwaju lati sa ipa mi."""

en: Earlier, the leader of the group, which is mostly made up of scholars and professionals, Dr Arabo Ibrahim Bayo, said they came together on the basis of a shared passion for the country's development, and in the firm belief that President Buhari represents the best in terms of leadership that Nigeria can offer.
yo: """Saaju eyi ni adari iko naa, Omowe Arabo Ibrahim Bayo, ni awon wa si orile-ede Naijiria nitori ife ti awon ni si idagbasoke orile-ede yii ati igbagbo ti won ni si isejoba Aare Muhammadu Buhari."

en: The group further pledged support to the President for a formidable and enduring legacy.
yo: Awon omo egbe naa wa seleri atileyin won fun Aare lati se ohun malegbagbe lorile-ede Naijiria.

en: ---Nigeria calls for safer digital world
yo: ---Orile-ede Naijiria pe fun eto aabo lori imo ero igbalode.

en: President Muhammadu Buhari has called on world leaders to come up with proposals to create a digital world that is accessible, inclusive and safe to all.
yo: Aare orile-ede Naijiria Muhammadu Buhari ti ro awon adari orile ede agbaye lati wa woroko fi sada lori bi imo ero igbalode yoo se wa larowoto awon eniyan ati eyi ti eto aabo to peye yoo tun wa nibe.

en: In his keynote speech at the 2019 Annual Investment Meeting (AIM) in Dubai on Monday, President Buhari said a certain level of regulation was needed to preserve the integrity of the digital economy.
yo: "Ninu oro re nibi Ipade eto Okoowo ti odun 2019 (AIM) t""o waye ni ilu Dubai lojo Aje, Aare ni eto ilana gbodo wa nipa eyi ti yoo maa daabo bo imo ero igbalode lori eto oro aje."

en: "The theme of the summit is: ""Mapping the Future of Foreign Direct Investment: Enriching World Economies through Digital Globalization."""""
yo: "Akori ipade apero naa ni: ""Wiwa ojo iwaju to dara fun eto okoowo: Mimu idagbasoke ba eto okoowo agbaye nipa lilo Imo-ero igbalode."

en: Acknowledging that digital globalisation is transforming the world almost every day with innovations and transformative ideas, the Nigerian leader cautioned that the cyber world would remain a constant threat if left unregulated.
yo: """""Aare orile-ede Naijiria ni pipese eto ilana fun lilo imo ero igbalode nikan lo le din wahala ati isoro to maa n waye nipa re."

en: The President decried the use of the cyberspace to manipulate elections, subvert the democratic rights of citizens as well as propagate violence.
yo: Aare fi aidunnu re han nipa bi won se n lo imo ero igbalode lati se ayeduru eto idibo, ni eyi ti o tako eto omoniyan, ti o si tun maa n da rogbodiyan sile laarin ilu.

en: President Buhari, therefore, called for collective efforts led by both public and private sector leaders to address the emerging threats of digital globalisation.
yo: Aare Buhari, wa ro awon adari ile-ise ijoba ati ile-ise aladaani lati fowosowopo lati wa ojutuu si wahala ati isoro to maa n waye nipa lilo imo ero igbalode.

en: ---Indonesia Landslides: at least 15 killed after year of disasters
yo: ---ile-riri lorile-ede Indonesia: o to eniyan marundinlogun ti o ti ku leyin opo odun ijamba

en: Indonesian rescue teams were searching for victims of a series of landslides that killed at least 15 people on New Year Day, officials said, after a year of natural disasters killed thousands.
yo: Iko alaabo to n mojuto isele pajawiri lorile-ede Indonesia ti n wa awon eniyan ti o fara kaasa ninu isele ijamba ile riri ti o gba emi eniyan marundinlogun lojo Odun Tuntun, leyin irufe isele naa ti o waye lodun kan seyin ti o sekupa ogoro eniyan.

en: At least 20 people were missing after landslides during heavy rain buried 30 houses in Sukabumi regency, West Java.
yo: Okere tan ogun eniyan ni o padanu emi won sinu isele ohun, bee si ni ile ogbon si ba isele naa lo niluu Sukabumi.

en: """Loose soil is a danger to rescue teams that are working in the field,"" said disaster mitigation agency spokesman Sutopo Purwo Nugroho."
yo: "Gege bi agbenusoro iko alaabo naa, Sutopo Purwo Nugroho se so,""O le pupo fun awon osise onisele pajawiri lati gba awon eniyan sile lasiko isele ile riri."""

en: Heavy rain had forced rescuers to suspend the search on Tuesday.
yo: Wayii o, aroro da ojo ti o ro lojo Isegun ohun ni o dena ise awon alaabo naa.

en: Indonesia is a disaster-prone archipelago that in 2018 suffered its deadliest year in over a decade in a series of earthquakes and tsunamis in different regions killed more than 3,000 people.
yo: Isele ijamba ile riri je ohun ti o maa n sele lopolopo lorile-ede Indonesia, eleyii ti o si sekupa egberun meta eniyan ni awon agbegbe lorisirisi lodun 2018.

en: ---Korea donates $500,000 to displaced persons in Nigeria
yo: ---Orile-ede Korea fun Naijiria ni egberun lona eedegbeta owo dola.

en: The United Nations World Food Programme, (WFP) has welcomed a contribution of 500,000 US Dollars from the Republic of Korea aimed at providing one month of food assistance for about 125,000 internally displaced persons in Borno, Adamawa and Yobe States, northeast Nigeria.
yo: Eto Ounje Ajo Isokan Agbaye Orile-ede Naijiria ti fi egberun lona eedegbeta dola owo ile okeere ran awon eniyan ti iye won din ni eedegbeje egberun fun awon ipinle Borno, Adamawa ati Yobe ti iko olote Boko Haram so di alainile lori.

en: The Korean Ambassador to Nigeria Major General (Rtd) In-tae Lee, said Korean Government has been making efforts to address the needs of vulnerable people, which was why they are supporting internally displaced persons in Nigeria.
yo: Asoju orile-ede Korea fun orile-ede Naijiria ajagun feyinti In-Tae Lee, lo so pe ijoba orile-ede Korea ti n gbiyanju lati wa ona ti yoo gbe seranwo fun awon eniyan ti iko omo gun Boko Haram so di alainile lori.

en: He said Korea stands ready to fight against malnutrition and poverty, joining hands with the people of Nigeria.
yo: O ni ijoba orile-ede Korea yoo fowosowopo pelu ijoba orile-ede Naijiria lati gbogun ti aisan ebi ati osi lorile-ede Naijiria.

en: The World Food Programme (WFP) Representative in Nigeria, Myrta Kaulard, applauded the gesture saying it would go a long way in sustaining the momentum of WFP's response in Nigeria.
yo: Asoju Ajo Agbaye ni orile-ede Naijiria, Myrta Kaulard wa gbosuba fun orile-ede Korea fun eto iranwo ti won se fun orile-ede Naijiria, pe iru eto bayii yoo tun je ki igbe aye iderun ba awon omo orile-ede Naijiria.

en: ---The Yoruba section of Voice of Nigeria (VON) started broadcasting in Abuja.
yo: ---Eka ede Yoruba, Ohun Naijiria (VON) bere igbohun safefe ni ilu Abuja.

en: Voice of Nigeria says the Yoruba section has started broadcasting in Abuja.
yo: Ohun Naijiria (Voice of Nigeria) ni eka ede Yoruba ti bere igbohun safefe lati ilu Abuja.

en: The director of the Yoruba section in Abuja Abiodun Popoola told people that a lot of programs have been specially arranged for the enjoyment of the loved once throughout the nation.
yo: Adari eka ede Yoruba ni ilu Abuja Abiodun Popoola so fun awon eniyan pe, opolopo eto ni awon ti ya soto fun igbadun awon ololufe jake-jado agbaye.

en: He continued that the interest of our listeners are paramount to us, this is the why the authority of the broadcasting of Nigeria, voice of Nigeria began broadcasting from Abuja.
yo: "O tesiwaju pe"" Ife awon olugbo wa lo je wa logun, idi niyi ti awon alase Ohun Naijiria, Voice of Nigeria se bere igbohun safefe lati ilu Abuja."

en: Likewise we have arrayed different programs for the enjoyment of our listeners most especially Africa.
yo: Bakan naa, ni a ti ya awon opolopo eto sile fun igbadun awon to n gbo wa, paapaa julo ile Afirika.

en: """Ewe, who is the director of engineering in Yoruba section said as the yoruba section have started broadcasting from Abuja will make the listeners of Voice of Nigeria from abroad will hear them clearly."
yo: """Ewe, ti o je adari imo ero labe eka Yoruba naa tun so pe bi eka ede Yoruba se bere igbohun safefe lati ilu Abuja je ohun ti yoo tun je ki awon olugbo Ohun Naijiria lati ile okeere tun maa gbo won yeke-yeke."

en: He said nothing as good as making people listening to Voice of Nigeria happy to listen the more.
yo: O ni ko si ohun to dara julo pe ki inu awon eniyan to n gbo wa lati ile akede dun lati maa teti si won.

en: Part of the workers that will partake in the programs are Mrs Aderonke Osundiya, Tobi Sangotola and Maryam Yusuf.
yo: Lara awon osise ti yoo maa kopa lori eto ohun naa ni iyaafin Aderonke Osundiya, Tobi Sangotola ati Maryam Yusuf.

en: Listen to Voice of Nigeria on 31m 969khz frequency from 11am to 11:45am and in the evening from 5:15pm to 5:30pm.
yo: E o maa gbo Ohun Naijiria lati ikanni 31m 9690khz ni deede aago mokanla aabo owuro titi di aago mokanla koja iseju marundinlaadota ati ni irole ni deede aago marun koja iseju marundinlogun titi di aago marun aabo.

en: ---Vice-President to participate in Africa-Europe forum in Austria
yo: ---Igbakeji Aare yoo kopa nibi ipade Africa-Europe ni Austria.

en: Nigeria's Vice President, Professor Yemi Osinbajo will be participating in the Africa-Europe High Level Forum with other African and European Heads of States or Government holding in Vienna, Austria on Monday, December 17, and Tuesday, December 18.
yo: Igbakeji Aare orile-ede Naijiria Yemi Osinbajo yoo maa darapo mo awon akegbe re lati orile-ede Afirika ati Europe nibi ijiroro ti yoo waye ni Vienna lorile-ede Austria lojo Aje, osu Kejila, ojo kejidinlogun ati ojo kerindinlogun.

en: "A press release from the Office of the Vice President said that Professor Osinbajo would at the forum, hosted by the Austrian government on behalf of the European Union and the African Union, be speaking on the forum's theme ""Taking cooperation to the digital age."""
yo: "Ninu atejade kan t""o wa lati Ibi-ise igbakeji Aare, o so pe Ojogbon Osinbajo yoo maa soro lori akori ""Gbigbe ajumose de ori ero igbalode"" ni ipade naa ti ijoba orile-ede Austria je olugbalejo ti o duro fun Ajo Europe ati Ajo Africa."

en: "The High-Level Forum will promote innovation and digitalisation according to the organizers in the EU and AU, ""as important enablers of our future development, so that everyone can benefit from the ongoing digital transformation."""
yo: "Apero awon eeyan jankanjankan naa yoo se igbelaruge idagbasoke imo ero igbalode ati ogbon atinuda bi awon oluseto ni EU ati AU, ""gege bi awon ohun t""o se onigbonwo idagbasoke ojo ola wa, ki gbogbo eniyan o le je anfaani ti eniyan yoo je lati ara awon ayipada imo ero igbalode."""

en: "The forum aims at assessing ""how current partnerships between Africa and Europe contribute to this goal, complementing the ongoing implementation of the joint declaration of the 2017 Abidjan Summit between the African Union and the European Union, which, among other things, highlighted the importance of unlocking the potential of the digital economy for Africa and Europe."
yo: "Ipade naa yoo tun maa wo ""bi ibasepo to wa laaarin Europe ati Afirika se lowo si alepa yii, asekun imuse ti o n lo lowo ti won fenuko le lori nibi ipade Abidjan to waye lodun 2017 ati awon nnkan miiran, won yoo tun maa jiroro lori ipa pataki ti imo ero igbalode yoo tun fi wulo fun idagbasoke eto oro aje fun Europe ati Afirika."

en: "It also aims at contributing to the Africa-Europe Alliance for Sustainable Investment and Jobs."""
yo: "O lepa idasi Ajose fun Imuro Idokoowo ati ipese Ise."""

en: During his trip to Vienna, Prof. Osinbajo would hold a town-hall meeting with the Nigerian community in Austria; and also attend several bilateral meetings with European government leaders, including the Prime Minister of Czech Republic, Andrej Babis; Prime Minister of Finland, H.E. Juha Petri Sipila; the Federal Chancellor of Austria, His Excellency, Sebastian Kurz; and the UK Minister for Africa, Harriet Baldwin.
yo: "Lasiko irinajo re lo si Vienna, Ojogbon Osinbajo yoo maa se ipade abele pelu awon omo orile Naijiria t""o n gbe ni orile-ede Austria; bakan naa ni yoo tun maa se ipade po pelu awon olori orile-ede Europe, lara won ni Adari ijoba ti orile-ede Czech Republic, Andrej Babis; Adari ijoba ti orile-ede Finland, H.E. Juha Petri Sipila; Oba orile-ede Austria, alaye julo, Sebastian Kurz; ati Minisita ile alawo funfun (UK) to n soju fun ile Africa, Harriet Baldwin."

en: Prof. Osinbajo would also meet with top officials of the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation.
yo: Ojogbon Osinbanjo yoo tun maa sepade po pelu awon osise agba ile ise Bill ati Melinda Gates Foundation.

en: The Vice President left Abuja on Sunday night and is expected back on Tuesday.
yo: "Igbakeji Aare fi ilu Abuja sile l""asale ojo Aiku, yoo si pada wa si orile-ede Naijiria lojo Isegun."

en: ---President Buhari pays tribute to Holocaust victims
yo: ---Aare Buhari sebowo fun awon to padanu emi won lasiko Isele-ipaninipakupa.

en: President Muhammadu Buhari has visited the Auschwitz-Birkenau Memorial and Museum in Oswiecim, Poland, where he paid tribute to Holocaust victims.
yo: Aare orile-ede Naijiria Muhammadu Buhari ti lo si ibi ti won n ko awon Ile-ona ohun alumooni ati ami idagbere si ni Auschwitz-Birkenau ati Oswiecim lati lo bowo fun awon to padanu emi won lasiko ogun.

en: "After an hour and 10 minutes guided tour of the Museum, devoted to the memory of the victims who died at both camps during World War II, President Buhari penned a hand-written tribute in the visitor's book, quoting Shakespeare's ""Julius Caesar:"
yo: "Leyin wakati kan ati iseju mewaa ti Aare ti rin Ile-ona, fun awon ti won padanu emi won lasiko Ogun Agbaye keji, Aare Buhari tun towobo iwe lati bowo fun awon akoni naa ninu iwe alejo, ti o si lo ori ""Julius Caesar ti Shakespeare:"

en: """The evil that men do lives after them; the good is oft interred with their bones."""
yo: "Iwa buruku ti awon eniyan ba wu, maa n tele won; sugbon iwa rere maa n wonu eegun lo."""

en: "The President also laid a wreath at Block II of the museum, known as the """"Death block."""""
yo: "Aare tun gbe ododo iboji si Ile keji ti ile-ona, ti a mo si ""Ile iku."""

en: "According to an epitaph in the Block: ""Male and female prisoners from all parts of the camp complex were held in this building...following brutal interrogations, they were in most cases sentenced to death by shooting."""
yo: "Gege bi won se ko sori Ile iku naa: """"Awon elewon l""okunrin ati l""obinrin lati gbogbo ile ipago naa ni won ko sinu ile yii...leyin iforowanilenuwo ijiya, ti won si da won lejo iyinbon pa."""

en: "Shortly before leaving the Museum, President Buhari while fielding questions from State House Correspondents traveling with him, described those fanning embers of discord in Nigeria as"" illiterates and ignorant."""
yo: """Leyin ti Aare kuro nibe tan, lo n bere si n dahun ibeere lati odo awon akoroyin ti o tele lati ile -ise Aare pe awon to n da wahala sile lorile-ede Naijiria"""" je alailekoo ati alaimokan."

en: The President is on Day Four of his visit to Poland, where he had attended the opening of the UN Climate Change Conference in Katowice, delivered his national address at the 12-day meeting of COP24, met several world leaders and visited the impressive Nigerian pavilion at the climate summit.
yo: """Aare lo fun irinajo olojo merin si orile-ede Poland, nibi ti yoo ti darapo mo ipade Apero Ayipada Oju-ojo ti UN agbaye ni Katowice, o se agbekale oro orile-ede re ni ipade olojo mejila ti COP24, sepade pelu awon olori agbaye ti won si be ibi afihan orile-ede Naijiria ni apero oju-ojo naa."

en: The President had attended a town-hall meeting with Nigerians in Poland, a day after his arrival in the country.
yo: Aare tun ba awon omo orile-ede Naijiria ti won wa ni Poland soro lojo keji ti o de si orile-ede Poland.

en: ---Nigeria condoles with US on death of George Bush
yo: ---Naijiria ba Amerika kedun lori iku George Bush.

en: President Muhammadu Buhari has joined world leaders in mourning the death of former President of United States, George H.W. Bush, who lived a life of service to country and humanity.
yo: Aare Muhammadu Buhari ti darapo mo awon adari orile-ede lagbaaye lati ba orile-ede Amerika kedun lori iku Aare ana George H. Bush, ti o gbe igbe aye re lati fi sin ilu ati awon eniyan.

en: President Buhari sent his condolences to the government and people of the United States, family of the 41st President and all political associates of the great leader, whose legacies continue to inspire and attract encomiums across the world.
yo: Aare Buhari fi iwe ikedun naa ranse si awon omo orile-ede Amerika, ore ati ebi oloogbe naa, ti o je Aare ikokanlelogoji ni orile-ede naa, eni ti gbogbo awon eniyan n kan saara si fun ipa pataki ti o ko lagbaaye.

en: The President believes the passing of George H.W. Bush is a loss to the entire world, not just America, especially the many people he inspired.
yo: Aare tun tesiwaju pe iku George H. Bush, kii se orile-ede Amerika nikan ni yoo dun,sugbon ajo gbaye ati awon eniyan ti o ti ko ipa rere ni igbesi aye won pelu.

en: President Buhari extols the late President's love for his family and country, which remains legendary as clearly seen in the way his children have taken up leadership roles and are steadily breeding new generation of great thinkers and leaders.
yo: Aare wa gbosuba fun ipa rere ti oloogbe naa ti ko ni igbesi aye awon omo re, ni eyi ti o n ran won lowo lati ko ipa pataki ninu ipo adari lagbaaye.

en: The President prays for God's comfort on the mourning nation, the family of the nonagenarian, and a peaceful rest for his soul.
yo: Aare wa gbadura pe ki Olorun dun orile-ede naa, ebi, ore oloogbe naa ninu, ati isinmi fun emi re.

en: ---Nigeria to produce festivals compendium to boost Tourism
yo: ---Naijiria ko ni pe gbe awon akosile iwe asa fun idagbasoke igbafe jade.

en: The Ministry of Culture and Tourism in Nigeria says it will soon produce a compendium of the festivals across the country as part of efforts to boost tourism and showcase the country's diverse cultures.
yo: Ajo to n mojuto asa ati igbafe lorile-ede Naijiria ti so pe awon ko ni pe gbe iwe akosile ti yoo safihan gbogbo awon asa to wa jake-jado orile-ede Naijiria sita lati le mu idagbasoke ba asa ati igbafe lorile-ede yii.

en: Minister of Information and Culture, Mr. Lai Mohammed, said this in Istanbul, Turkey, while speaking at the ongoing 3rd UNWTO/UNESCO World Conference on Tourism and Culture, jointly organised by the two UN agencies.
yo: Minisita fun ilaniloye ati asa lorile-ede Naijiria, Lai Mohammed lo soro yii ni Istanbul, lorile-ede Turkey nibi ayeye asa ati igbafe ti ajo agbaye (UNWTO/UNESCO World Conference on Tourism and Culture) se,eleyii lo je iketa iru re ti ajo agbaye yoo se.

en: He said with more than 365 festivals across Nigeria, the country can organise one festival per day all year round, thus boosting domestic and international tourism.
yo: Minisita so pe o le ni aarundinlaadorinle oodunrun ni awon asa to wa ni jake-jado orile-ede Naijiria, iyen ni pe orile-ede yii le e se asa kan lojumo kan, ni eyi ti yoo je ki idagbasoke ba eto igbafe ati oro aje orile-ede yii.

en: Different Festivals Mr. Mohammed said Nigeria's ethnic groups are rooted in their cultures, which they showcase through different festivals like Durbar, New Yam Festival, Eyo and Masquerades, just to mention a few.
yo: Asa orisirisi Alhaji Mohammed ni orile-ede Naijiria fidi mule ninu ede ati asa ni eyi ti awon asa miiran tun ti jeyo bi I Durbar, isu tuntun, Eyo ati odun egungun abbl.

en: He said governments at all levels in Nigeria are striving hard to encourage the festivals in their domains, while the Nigerian government is providing the enabling environment to showcase the various festivals.
yo: O tesiwaju pe awon ijoba ni gbogbo eka lorile-ede Naijiria n sa gbogbo ipa ni agbegbe won lati gbe asa laruge, bakan naa ni ijoba apapo naa si n seto iranwo lati fun won ni agbegbe to se e gbe, ni eyi ti yoo mu itesiwaju ba asa lorile-ede yii.

en: The Minister said the Abuja Carnival was particularly designed to enable the 36 States of the federation and the Federal Capital Territory to showcase the country's cultural diversity which he described as a source of unity among the country's ethnic groups.
yo: Minisita tun tesiwaju pe ayeye ajodun asa ti o maa n waye niluu Abuja je ohun ti o wa lati gbe asa laruge, ni eyi ti gbogbo awon ipinle merindinlogoji ati ilu Abuja to wa lorile-ede Naijiria maa n kopa nibe.

en: He said festivals are not just for entertainment but major contributors to job creation and economic development.
yo: O ni ayeye ajodun asa kii se fun ere idaraya nikan, bi kii se lati tun pese ise ati idagbasoke fun eto oro-aje lorile-ede Naijiria.

en: More than 30 Ministers of Culture and Tourism from around the world are attending the three-day conference.
yo: Awon Minisita to le logbon lo wa nibi ayeye ajodun agbaye yii, ojo meta gbako ni won yoo fi se ayeye yii.

en: ---WANEP, AU conduct training on election conflict prevention
yo: ---WANEP, AU se idanilekoo nipa aabo lasiko ijamba eto idibo.

en: Ahead of Nigeria's 2019 General Election, the West Africa Network for Peace building, the African Union and ECOWAS have trained about 80 people from civil society organisations on conflict monitoring, aimed at preventing conflicts within the election period.
yo: Gege bi eto idibo odun 2019 se n sunmo etile ajo to n mojuto eto alaafia lorile-ede Afirika West Africa Network for Peace building ati Ajo Afirika ati ajo Ecowas ti se idanileko fun awon eniyan to le ni ogorin, paapaa julo awon ile-ise aladaani ti ki i se ti ijoba lati ko won lona ti won yoo fi le maa daabo bo ara won nigba ti ijamba ba waye lasiko eto idibo.

en: The organisation says the training, which brought participants from all 36 states of Nigeria and Abuja.
yo: Egbe naa so pe awon olukopa nibi idanilekoo naa wa lati gbogbo ipinle merindinlogoji to wa lorile-ede Naijiria ati ilu Abuja.

en: It is part of a broader election monitoring, management and mitigation project, designed to mitigate election violence in the forthcoming election.
yo: Egbe naa so pe awon se idanilekoo yii fun awon eniyan ti yoo kopa lati mojuto eto idibo, ni pataki julo ni igberiko ati ni ipinle to wa lorile-ede Naijiria.

en: The West Africa Network for Peace (WANEP) building says it considers the capacity building of those likely to be engaged as community and state monitors an important assignment because Nigeria has entered a critical phase of election process in the midst of unfolding skirmishes in the political arena.
yo: Egbe WANEP tun tesiwaju pe opolopo awon eniyan ni eru ti n ba nitori eto idibo to n bo , paapaa julo nipa eto aabo ti ko fese mule , bi awon oloselu se n bu ara won ati bi won se n dun ikooko mo ara won.

en: Against this development, the Executive Director of the organisation, Dr. Chukwuemeka Eze, said the three organisations had instituted a project to monitor and analyse situations to mitigate and develop a response platform to any likely violence, during election.
yo: Alakooso egbe yii Chukwuemeka Eze tun ni awon egbe meteeta yii fowosowopo lati se idanilekoo yii lati le dena awon ijamba to maa n sele lasiko eto idibo.

en: """WANEP, ECOWAS/AU developed election specific indicators and contextualized online system for constant monitoring and reporting."
yo: "Eze tun so pe ""WANEP, ECOWAS/AU ti ni awon yoo gbe awon ise akanse kan dide lori ero ayelujara, ni eyi ti yoo maa jabo, ti yoo si tun maa topinpin bi eto idibo se n lo si."

en: "It will also provide analytical reports highlighting prioritized areas of risks of violence and make recommendations to key national and zonal influencers that respond to election threats such as the Independent Electoral Commission, Nigeria Police, Jama'atu Nasril Islam, Christian Association of Nigeria, Ministry of Internal Affairs, National Peace Committee,"" Dr. Eze said."
yo: Bakan naa, ni egbe naa yoo tun gbe ise akanse miiran dide ti yoo ran awon ti oro kan lowo lati lee gbogun ti ijamba to ba lee waye lasiko eto idibo , awon bi i ajo eleto idibo, ile-ise olopaa,ajo to n mojuto oro to je mo ilu, egbe onigbagbo (kristeni) egbe awon musulumi ati ajo to n pese alaafia.

en: President Buhari refutes claims he was cloned
yo: Aare Buhari ni oun ki i se eda.

en: President Muhammmadu Buhari has for the first time refuted the rumour of him being cloned, saying he is the real Buhari.
yo: Aare Muhammadu Buhari ti soro nigba akoko lati tako aheso oro pe oun ki i se eniyan, pe eda ni oun.

en: He refuted the claims on Sunday in Poland, during a parley with members of the Nigerian community in Poland.
yo: O tako oro yii lojo Aiku ni orile-ede Poland lasiko to n ba awon omo orile-ede Naijiria to wa ni orile-ede Poland soro.

en: A Nigerian residing in Poland wanted to know if he was the real Buhari or the much talked about Jibril from Sudan, at the town hall meeting in Krakow on Sunday evening.
yo: Omo orile-ede Naijiria to wa ni Poland fe mo boya Aare je eniyan tabi eda, lati fi otito oro ti won n so mule, eleyii waye ni gbongan to wa ni Krakow lojo Aiku.

en: President Buhari said a lot of people had hoped he was dead during the period of his ill health.
yo: Aare Buhari ni opolopo awon eniyan ni won fe ki oun ti ku lasiko ti o n saisan.

en: "He described the sponsors of the rumours about his person as ""ignorant and irreligious."""
yo: "O sapejuwe awon ti o n soro yii gege bi ""Alaimokan ati alailesin."

en: "According to him:""A lot of people had hoped that l died during my ill health."
yo: """Aare so pe: ""Opolopo awon eniyan ni won fe ki n ku lasiko ti mo n saisan."

en: I will soon celebrate my 76th birthday.
yo: Emi ko ni pe se ayeye ojo ibi kerindinlogorin mi.

en: The meeting afforded the Nigerian leader an opportunity to interact with Nigerians living in Poland, which was the President's first official engagement, ahead of the Conference of the Parties (COP24) of the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC), taking place from December 2-4.
yo: """Ipade yii tun fun awon alase orile-ede yii lati jiroro pelu awon omo orile-ede Naijiria to n gbe ni Poland, eleyii ni yoo je akoko iru re ti Aare yoo wa si ipade awon igbimo to wa lara ajo agbaye ti won n ri si bi oju ojo se n yi pada (COP24 of Climate Change (UNFCCC), ni eyi ti yoo waye ni ojo keji si ojo kerin, osu kejila odun yii."

en: At the meeting, the President expressed his happiness with the report by the Nigerian Ambassador to Poland, Eric Adagogo Bell-Gam.
yo: Aare fi idunnu re han pelu iroyin ti asoju orile-ede Poland Eric Adagogo Bell-Gam so nipa awon omo orile-ede Naijiria to n gbe inu ilu naa.

en: On the economy, the President said Nigeria has virtually stopped the importation of food, especially rice.
yo: Lori eto oro-aje, aare ni ijoba oun ti da kiko ounje lati oke okun wa si orile-ede Naijiria duro, paapaa julo iresi.

en: """I am trying to save a lot of money, l only go out when it is necessary. My priority is to secure Nigeria."""
yo: """Mo n gbiyanju lati ma se owo orile-ede yii basubasu, mo n jade nigba ti o ba pon dandan."""

en: """I am always upset when l see little children taking bowls about begging for food."
yo: Inu mi kii dun nigba ti mo n ba ri awon omode ti won toro owo ati ounje loju titi.

en: ---Taliban kill at least 22 Afghan police in ambush
yo: ---Iko omo-ogun olote Taliban seku-pa olopaa Afghan mejilelogun.

en: At least 22 police were killed in a Taliban ambush in Afghanistan's western province of Farah late on Sunday, officials said, adding to the growing casualty toll on Afghan security forces fighting an increasingly confident insurgency.
yo: "O kere tan olopaa mejilelogun l""o padanu emi won ninu ikolu iko omo ogun olote Taliban sile-ise olopaa Afghan lagbegbe Farah lojo Aiku."

en: Police spokesman Mohebullah Moheb confirmed the ambush but gave no details. A spokesman at the provincial hospital said 22 bodies had been brought in from the incident.
yo: Agbenusoro fun ile-ise olopaa Afghan, Mohebullah Moheb lo jabo oro naa sugbon ti salaye bi oro ohun se lo lekunrere.

en: Taliban spokesman Qari Yousuf Ahmadi said 25 police, including senior commanders, had been killed and four vehicles were destroyed in the attack. Large quantities of weapons were captured, he said.
yo: Agbenusoro iko olote Taliban, Qari Yousuf Ahmadi so pe, olopaa marundinlogbon ti o fi mo awon oga agba olopaa ni won seku-pa, ti won si dana sun oko olopaa merin.

en: Afghan authorities no longer release detailed figures but U.S. Defense Secretary James Mattis recently confirmed casualties have been running at some 500 a month, a figure many officials in Kabul say understates the real toll.
yo: Ewe, agbenusoro nile iwosan ti won gbe awon ti o fara kaasa ikolu ohun lo so pe, eniyan mejilelogun ni won ti gbe wo ile iwosan naa lati ibi ti isele ohun ti waye.

en: The losses have been mounting even while U.S. diplomatic efforts to begin peace talks with the Taliban.
yo: Ipadanu naa ti n waye ni lemo-lemo, ti o fi je pe osise akoroyin ile Amerika siluu Afghan ti pe fun ijiroro alaafia pelu iko olote Taliban.

en: ---Nigerian President bags Polio Champion award
yo: ---Aare Buhari gba ami eye fun akitiyan lati dena arun romolapa-romolese.

en: President Muhammadu Buhari has been conferred with the prestigious Polio Champion Award in recognition of his uncommon commitment and leadership in the polio eradication programme in Nigeria.
yo: "Aare Muhammadu Buhari ti gba ami eye ti arun romolaparomolese fun gudugudu meje, yaya mefa ti ijoba re ti se lati gbogun ti aarun yii l""orile-ede Naijiria."

en: Rotary International President, Mr Barry Rassin, who is on a four-day official visit to Nigeria, presented the award to President Buhari on Thursday, at State House, Abuja.
yo: "Aare egbe Rotary International, Barry Rassin, ti o wa fun irinajo olojo merin si orile-ede Naijiria, l""o gbe ami eye naa fi da Aare Buhari lola nile Aare t""o wa lorile-ede Naijiria, ni ojo Ojobo."

en: The Polio Champion Award was instituted by Rotary International in 1995 to recognize and appreciate Heads of Governments and organizations that have played a key role in polio eradication around the world.
yo: "Egbe Rotary international ti maa n fun awon adari orile-ede ati ile ise ti o ba fakoyo ninu igbiyanju won lati dena arun romo-lapa-romo-lese l""orile-ede won."

en: The last recipient of the Award was Justin Trudeau, the Prime Minister of Canada.
yo: "Eni t""o gba ami eye ohun keyin ni Justin Trudeau, ti o je Adari Ijoba orile-ede Canada."

en: Other past recipients include Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe, Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany and former UN Secretary General Ban Ki-Moon.
yo: Lara awon eniyan ti o tun ti gba ami eye ohun ni adari ijoba orile-ede Japan Shinzo Abe, adari orile-ede Germany Angela Merkel ati akowe agba fun ajo agbaye teleri Ban Ki-Moon.

en: Receiving the award, the Nigerian leader, while thanking Rotary International for the honour, lauded their commitment to humanitarian work across the globe.
yo: Nigba ti Aare n tewogba ami eye yii, o dupe lowo egbe Rotary International fun ami eye ti won fi da a lola.

en: """""Rotary International is well known to my generation. Your work is really humanitarian; no amount of materialism can pay you for what you have been doing and we thank you very much."
yo: """""Iran mi mo egbe Rotary International bi eni m'owo. Ni t""ooto, ise yin ni i se pelu omoniyan; ko si iye ohunkohun ti o le san awon ise ribi-ribi ti e n gbe se, a dupe lowo yin gidi gan-an."

en: """""I am pleased with the efforts of Rotary International, you are champions of the weak, and I pray that God will abundantly pay you for your humanitarian services."
yo: """""Inu mi dun si ipa pataki ti e n ko lawujo, e je alagbara fun awon ti ko lagbara, mo gbadura pe ki Olorun san awon oore ti e n se wonyin fun un yin ni ilopo fun ise omoniyan yin."

en: "I am also pleased that I have a competent Health Minister, who supervises the work,"" the President said."
yo: "Aare ni ""inu mi dun pe mo ni akosemose Minisita fun eto ilera, ti o n bojuto ise naa."

en: Earlier in his remarks, Mr Rassin, while commending the President for providing significant leadership in the efforts to eradicate polio in Nigeria.
yo: """""Ogbeni Rassin wa gbosuba fun Aare Buhari fun ise gudu gudu meje yaya mefa ti o n se lati dekun arun romolaparomolese l""orile-ede Naijiria."

en: He advocated for increased political and financial commitments at all levels for routine immunization and primary health care strengthening.
yo: O tun ro Aare lati tubo mu ki eto iselu ati owo ayasoto o gbe fuke si i ki gbogbo ipele fun eto ibupa ati ilera abele o ba kesejari.

en: ---Trump to nominate retired General as ambassador to Saudi Arabia
yo: ---Trump yoo yan ogagun teleri gege bi asoju sile Saudi Arabia.

en: U.S. President Donald Trump on Tuesday nominated a retired Army general to be the country's ambassador to Saudi Arabia, as Washington faces pressure to respond to the killing of journalist Jamal Khashoggi inside the Saudi consulate in Istanbul.
yo: Aare ile Amerika, Donald Trump ti yan ogagun iko omo ogun orile-ede naa ti o ti feyin ti gege bi asoju ile Amerika si orile-ede Saudi Arabia, gege bi ilu Washington naa se n koju idojuko latari iku akoroyin omobibi ile Saudi, Jamal Khashoggi ti o ku si Ile-ise Asoju Ijoba Saudi ni Istanbul.

en: The White House said Trump has chosen John Abizaid, who as a four-star Army general led the U.S. Central Command during the Iraq war, to be Washington's ambassador in Riyadh.
yo: Ile-ise Aare soro ohun di mimo pe Aare Trump ti yan ogagun teleri ohun, John Abizaid, leni ti o tuko omo ogun ile Amerika lasiko ogun pelu orile-ede Iraq.

en: Abizaid must be confirmed by the U.S. Senate.
yo: Ni bayii, ireti wa pe ile igbimo asofin ile Amerika yoo sepade lati bowolu iyansipo tuntun naa.

en: In addition to the scandal over Khashoggi's death, Washington is also grappling with criticism from U.S. lawmakers over its support for Saudi Arabia's military intervention in Yemen's civil war.
yo: Ni afikun si iku Khashoggi, ile Washington fesun kan awon asofin ile Amerika fun sise atileyin fun iko omo ogun ile Saudi Arabia ninu ogun ile Yemen.

en: The United States has not had an ambassador to Saudi Arabia since Trump took office in January 2017.
yo: Orile-ede Amerika ko i tii ni asoju sile Saudi Arabia lati igba ti Aare Trump ti gori aleefa lodun 2017.

en: White House national security adviser John Bolton said on Tuesday he does not think recordings related to Khashoggi's killing, which were shared by Turkey, implicate Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman.
yo: Olugbani-nimoran lori eto aabo nile ise Aare Trump John Bolton so lojo isegun pe, oun ko ro pe awon akasile aworan ti o ro mo iku Khashoggi, ti awon ara ile Turkey n pin kaakiri, lowo omooba ile Saudi, Mohammed bin Salman ninu.

en: Nigeria seeks stiffer penalties for perpetrators of illicit transactions
yo: "Naijiria fe ijiya to nipon fun awon t""o n se owo ilu mokumoku."

en: Nigerian President, Muhammadu Buhari on Sunday in Paris, called for stringent actions against perpetrators of illicit financial flows, including crackdown on safe heavens.
yo: Aare orile-ede Naijiria, Muhammadu Buhari ni Paris lojo Aiku, pe fun igbese ijiya ti o gbopon fun awon onijibiti owo, titi kan isegi owo palaba awon ibi ibapamo won.

en: "He warned that continuous impunity will encourage more pilfering of countries"" resources to the detriment of poor and vulnerable populace."
