en: "--- Weah makes ""shocking International return"" against Nigeria......at 51!"
yo: --- Weah pada wa lona to ya gbogbo agbaaye lenu ninu idije pelu Naijiiria......leni odun mokanlelaaadota!

en: Liberia President and former World Footballer of the Year George Weah made a surprise return to international competition in Monrovia on Tuesday, playing in a 2-1 loss to Nigeria.
yo: Aare orile-ede Liberia ati agbaboolu to ta sansan julo lagbaaye nigba kan ri George Weah pada sinu ifigagbaga agbaaye lona ti o yani lenu pupo ni ilu Monrovia lojo isegun (Tuesday), o gba boolu ninu ipadanu alami ayo meji si okan sowo iko Naijiiria.

en: The match came up a few weeks short of his 52nd birthday and Liberia had arranged the friendly to retire the number 14 jersey made famous by Weah.
yo: Idije yii wa leyin ose die ti o se ayeye ojo ibi odun mejilelaaadota ti orile-ede Liberia si seto idije naa lati fi eyin Weah, gbajugbaja alaso igbaboolu nomba erinla ti.

en: However, fans were in for a shock when, 16 years after his last international appearance, the striker led the national team onto the pitch wearing it instead.
yo: Bakan naa, awon alatileyin wa ni ipo iyalenu nigba ti won ri atamatase yii ti o tun gbe aso ganrun siwaju iko orile-ede naa wo ori papa leyin odun merindinlogun ti o ti fara han gbeyin.

en: Media reports said Weah, who led the attack and showed glimpses of the class that made him a household name around the world, he received a standing ovation from fans when he was substituted on 79 minutes.
yo: Iroyin fi lede pe Weah, ti o gba owo iwaju patapata ti o si pitu repete iru eyi ti o so oruko re di tooro fon kale kaakiri agbaaye gba iduro kini lati odo awon alatileyin nigba ti won ropo re ni iseju kokandinlogodorin.

en: Goals from Henry Onyekuru and Simeon Nwankwo helped Nigeria to a 2-0 lead before the hosts pulled one back through a Kpah Sherman penalty late in the game.
yo: Ami ayo lati owo Henry Onyekuru ati Simeon Nwankwo ni o ran orile-ede Naijiiria lowo lati lewaju pelu ami ayo meji si odo ki o to di pe iko ti o wa nile yii da okan pada pelu goli-wo-mi-n-gba-a-si-o lati Kpah Sherman ni owo ipari ayo naa.

en: Weah enjoyed a career in Europe spanning nearly a decade and a half that saw him play for Monaco, Paris Saint-Germain and Marseille in France, AC Milan in Italy.
yo: Weah gbadun igbesi aye re ni ile Europe ti o feree lo to odun mewaa abo eyi ti o mu u kopa fun awon iko bii Monaco, Paris Saint-Germain ati Marseille ni orile-ede France, AC Milan ni orile-ede Italy.

en: He also played for English sides Manchester City and Chelsea.
yo: O tun kopa fun iko ile Geesi Manchester City ati Chelsea.

en: Weah was named the 1995 World Footballer of the Year; he also won the Ballon d'Or in the same year and remains the only African to win either award.
yo: Weah ni o di kikede gege bi agbaboolu ti o ta sansan julo lagbaaye lodun 1995 bakan naa ni o gba ami eye Ballon d'Or ni odun yii kan naa oun si ni omo ile Adulawo kan soso ti o si gba awon ami eye mejeeji yii.

en: --- Hiddink appointed coach of Chinese Olympic team
yo: --- Hiddink je yiyan gege bi akonimoogba iko Olympic orile-ede China

en: Guus Hiddink has been tasked with ensuring China qualify for the finals of the 2020 Olympic Games football tournament after the former Real Madrid and Netherlands coach was handed the reins of the country's under 21 team on Monday.
yo: Guus Hiddink ti di fifun ni ojuse lati ri i pe iko China pegede si asekagba idije Olympic odun 2020 leyin ti won fa iko odo ti ojo ori won ko ju mokanlelogun lo le akonimoogba iko Real Madrid ati iko orile-ede Netherlands teleri ohun lowo lojo aje (Monday).

en: Hiddink, 71, becomes the latest big name coach to move to China since the country's president, Xi Jinping, stated his desire for the nation to become a global football power.
yo: Hiddink, eni okanlelaaladorin odun, ni akonimoogba nla ti o tuntun ju ti yoo koja si orile-ede China lati igba ti aare orile-ede naa, Xi Jinping, ti fi ife han lati so orile-ede naa di ile agbara ere boolu agbaaye.

en: The Dutchman joins fellow European Cup-winning coach Marcello Lippi on the payroll of the CFA, with the Italian World Cup winner currently preparing the senior team for the finals of the Asian Cup in the United Arab Emirates in January.
yo: Omo orile-ede Neitherland yii dara po mo akeegbere ti o ti gba ife eye ni ile Europe ri iyen Marcello Lippi lori ate isanwo ajo CFA, pelu bi akonimoogba ti o ko iko Italy gba ife eye agbaaye yii n tire se n pese iko agba ile naa sile lowolowo fun asekagba idije Ife ile Asia ti yoo waye ni United Arab Emirates ni inu osu kinni.

en: Top coaches such as Luiz Felipe Scolari, Fabio Capello, Manuel Pellegrini and Andre Villas Boas have also had stints with clubs in the Chinese Super League.
yo: Awon akonimoogba nlanla bii Luiz Felipe Scolari, Fabio Capello, Manuel Pellegrini ati Andre Villas Boas pelu ti ni nnkan se pelu awon egbe agbaboolu ninu idije Chinese Super League.

en: "--- PHOTOS: Super Eagles ""basking in the Seychelles sunshine"""
yo: "--- AWON AWORAN: Iko Super Eagles n ya oorun ile Seychelles"""

en: The Super Eagles are all but set for the make-or-mar AFCON qualifier against Seychelles in Victoria on Saturday.
yo: Iko Super Eagles ti setan lati koju iko Seychelles ninu idije kaka-keku-o -je-ese ti yoo waye ni ilu Victoria ni ojo abameta (Saturday).

en: "With a full house, the Nigerian side have been enjoying the ""sweet sun"" that has swept this enchanting Island."
yo: Pelu bi ile se kun fofo, iko Naijiiria ti n gbadun oorun aran yee ti o gba ori erekusu yii kan

en: --- UEFA NL: France holds Germany to a goalless draw
yo: --- LIIGI UEFA NATION: France ta omi odo si odo pelu Germany

en: World champions France never hit top form and had third-choice keeper Alphonse Areola to thank for a 0-0 draw against Germany in their inaugural Nations League game on Thursday, their first appearance since lifting the World Cup.
yo: France ti ife eye agbaaye wa lowo re ko bode pade o si nilo lati dupe lowo asole keta won Alphonse Areola fun omi odo si odo ti won gba pelu Germany ninu ifesewonse idije Liigi UEFA Nations lole lojobo (Thursday), akoko iru e lati igba ti won ti gbe igba oro ife eye agbaaye soke.

en: On a rainy night, Germany won back some respect with a battling performance after their shock World Cup group- stage exit in Russia, their earliest in 80 years in the tournament.
yo: Ni inu ojo lale ojo yii, iko Germany tun iyi won ra pada leyin ijakuro lati abala akoko ninu idije ife eye agbaaye ti o yani lenu gbaa ni orile-ede Russia, eyi ti o yara ju ninu idije naa lati bi ogorin odun seyin.

en: """It was a tight match and we were better sometimes and at other times they were better,"" said France coach Didier Deschamps."
yo: """O je idije ti o gbona girigiri pelu bi a se n fakoyo ju won lo ti awon naa si n fakoyo ju wa lo nigba miiran.,"" ni Didier Deschamps akonimoogba iko France wi."

en: --- CAF U-17 AFCON: Eaglets target win over Burkina Faso
yo: --- idije AFCON awon oje weewe: iko Eaglets foju sun ijawe olubori lori iko Burkina Faso

en: Mohammed Sanusi, General Secretary of the Nigeria Football Federation (NFF), on Sunday expressed confidence in the ability of the Golden Eaglets to beat Burkina Faso tomorrow.
yo: Mohammed Sanusi, akowe apapo ajo ti o n moju to boolu afesegba lorile-ede Naijiiria (NFF), ni ojo aiku (Sunday) fi idaniloju re han pe iko Golden Eaglets yoo na iko Burkina Faso ni ola.

en: The U-17 West African Football Union (WAFU) B qualifiers gets underway in Niger Republic on Monday.
yo: Idije ipegede Ajo ti o mojuto boolu afesegba ni iha iwo oorun ile Adulawo (WAFU) ti awon odo ti ojo ori won o ju metadinlogun ipin B yoo beere ni orile-ede Niger Republic lojo aje (Monday)

en: Sanusi said the Manu Garba-led boys were fit and ready to crush any opponent in West Africa.
yo: Sanusi so pe iko ti Manu Garba ko sodi yii danto, won si setan atibi iko yoowu ti o je alatako won ni iha iwo oorun ile Adulawo wo.

en: He said they were well prepared to rekindle the glory of Nigeria in the U-17 category of global football.
yo: O ni awon ti setan lati da ogo ere boolu iko awon odo orile-ede Naijiiria ti ojo ori won o ju metadinlogun pada lagbaaye.

en: """We should be prayerful because tactically our boys are good to go; therefore, what we need now is just God's intervention,"" the federation scribe said."
yo: """A nilo lati kun fun adura, ni ti ogbon awon omo wa ni ogbon lori sugbon a nilo idasi Olorun,"" eyi ni osise ijoba apapo yii wi."

en: Nigeria's U-17 team would contend with two opponents in their group because of the disqualification of Benin Republic.
yo: Iko awon odo ti ojo ori won o ju metadinlogun ti orile-ede Naijiiria yoo koju iko meji latari yiyo iko Benin Republic danu.

en: Ten out of 20 Benin Republic players failed the Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) test, leading to their disqualification.
yo: Mewaa ninu ogun awon agbaboolu iko Benin Republic ni won ko pegede pelu idanwo ayewo inu ara (MRI), eyi ti won fi yo iko naa danu bi eni yo jiga.

en: "However, Nigeria is left with Cote d"" Voire and Burkina Faso in the Group."
yo: "Ni bayii iko Cote d"" Voire ati iko Burkina Faso nikan ni yo ku iko Naijiiria ku ninu ipin won."

en: The Golden Eaglets will be slugging it out on Monday by 4 p .m. local time with Burkina Faso.
yo: Iko Golden Eaglets bakan naa yoo maa waako lojo Aje (Monday) laago merin osan aago abele pelu iko Burkina Faso.

en: The WAFU qualifiers is for qualification to the U-17 African Cup of Nations (AFCON) to hold in Tanzania which is a qualifying finale for U-17 World Cup tagged Peru 2019.
yo: Idije ipegede (WAFU) yii je ipegede fun ife eye ile Adulawo (AFCON) awon odo ti ojo ori won o ju metadinlogun ti yoo waye ni orile-ede Tanzania eyi ti o tun je osuwon ipegede si idije ife eye agbaaye awon odo ti ojo ori won o ju metadinlogun eyi ti yoo waye ni orile-ede Peru lodun 2019.

en: --- Team Nigeria departs for World Para Table Tennis Championships
yo: --- Iko Naijiiria gbera lo si Idije Ajemayoteniisi agbaaye.

en: Team Nigeria para table tennis players have left Lagos on for the 2018 World Para Table Tennis Championships in Beijing.
yo: Iko ti o soju Naijiiria nibi Idije Ajemayoteniisi kuro ni Eko lo si ibi idije Ajemayoteniisi agbaaye ni ilu Beijing.

en: The team, comprising one female and three males, departed aboard an Ethiopian Airlines flight.
yo: Iko yii ti o ni obinrin kan ati okunrin meta gbera kuro lorile-ede pelu oko ofurufu Ethiopian

en: The lone female athlete is Faith Obazuaye, while her male counterparts are Nasiru Bello, Tajudeen Agunbiade and Olufemi Alabi.
yo: Obinrin kan soso yii ni Faith Obazuaye, nigba ti awon okunrin akeegbe re je Nasiru Bello, Tajudeen Agunbiade ati Olufemi Alabi.

en: The championships will serve off on Aug. 27 and end on Sept. 3.
yo: Idije yii yoo beere ni ojo ketadinlogbon osu kejo yoo si pari ni ojo keta osu kesan-an.

en: Bankole, speaking before departure, said the athletes were fully prepared for the task ahead.
yo: Bankole, nigba ti o n soro ki won to gbera, so pe awon alayo yii ti mura gidigidi fun ise ti o wa niwaju won.

en: """We believe in them and their abilities and I'm optimistic they will make the country proud. They should however, play all games cautiously with their eyes on the target."""
yo: """A nigbagbo ninu won ati ohun ti won le se, mo si ni igbagbo pe won yoo mu orile-ede wa yangan. Ki awon pelu fi ara bale gba gbogbo ayo naa pelu afojusun."

en: Bankole, who is also a Deputy Commissioner of Police, however, appealed to Nigerians resident in China to come and encourage their compatriots.
yo: Bankole, ti o je Komisanna Olopaa, bakan naa parowa si awon omo orile-ede Naijiiria ti won n gbe ni orile-ede China lati wa wu awon olufokansin wonyi lori.

en: --- I'll ensure I stay long at City - Kompany
yo: --- Ma a rii pe mo duro pe ninu iko City - Kompany

en: Manchester City captain Vincent Kompany says his natural athletic ability and desire to keep improving can help him prolong his career with the English Premier League champions.
yo: Balogun iko Manchester City Vincent Kompany so pe abuda adamo oun lati maa se daadaa le mu ki oun o fa ojo oun gun ninu iko asaaju idije Premier League ile Geesi naa.

en: The 32-year-old Belgian international defender has been forced to overcome a number of injury issues during his 10-year stint at the club.
yo: Omo odun mejilelogbon adieyinmu iko agbaboolu Belgium yii ti gbiyanju lopo lati jaja bo lowo orisiirisii ifarapa lati nnkan bi odun mewaa ti o ti wa ninu iko naa..

en: """I think what people have never really understood with me is that aside from having had some injuries I'm actually lucky to be a good athlete naturally."
yo: """Mo woye pe ohun ti awon eniyan o tii fi taratara mo nipa mi ni pe yato si nini awon ifarapa, mo ri oore-ofe jije alabuda adamo ere sisa gba."

en: """So, I still feel mobile,"" Kompany, whose contract expires next season, told the club's website."
yo: """Nitori naa, ere si si wa lese mi,"" Kompany, ti adehun re yoo tenu bepo ni saa to n bo lo so fun ikanni ayelujara iko agbaboolu naa."

en: Kompany was a substitute in Manchester City's 2-0 win at Arsenal in their league opening fixture, but he returned to the starting side which thumped Huddersfield Town 6-1 last weekend.
yo: Kompany je gbigbe wole ninu ijawe olubori ami ayo meji si odo pelu iko Arsenal ninu idije akoko won, sugbon o beere pelu iko ti o fiya je iko Huddersfield Town pelu ami ayo mefa si okan ni opin ose to koja.

en: --- Hockey: 2018 Super League kicks off on Saturday
yo: --- Ayo Hockey: Idije Liigi odun 2018 yoo beere lo abameta (Saturday)

en: Fatai Atanda, Technical Committee member of the Nigeria Hockey Federation (NHF), on Thursday said the 2018 Super League would kick off on Saturday at the National Stadium, Abuja.
yo: Fatai Atanda, omo egbe igbimo imo ero ajo to n moju to idije Hocky lorile-ede Naijiiria (NHF), so ni ojobo (Thursday) pe Liigi ayo Hockey ti odun 2018 yoo beere ni ojo abameta (Saturday) ni papa isere ijoba apapo, Abuja.

en: Atanda said the tourney would be played on four quarter format, and that 16 clubs, comprising eight male and female categories, would participate in the tournament.
yo: Atanda so pe ipin merin ni won yoo pin idije naa si, o si so pe iko merindinlogun iko okunrin mejo ati obinrin mejo ni yoo kopa.

en: In the previous year, Kada Queens of Kaduna lifted the trophy for the female category, while Niger Flickers won the men category.
yo: Lodun to koja, Kada Queens ilu Kaduna ni o gbe ife ti awon obinrin lo ile nigba ti Niger Flickers gba ti awon okunrin.

en: The league is in line with the efforts of the federation to promote hockey among Nigerians, especially the youth, to enhance professionalism.
yo: Idije yii wa ni ibamu pelu alakale ajo yii lati te ayo hockey siwaju lorile-ede Naijiiria, paapaa julo laarin awon odo lati le se alekun ise owo.

en: --- Falconets can beat Spain - Garba Manu
yo: --- Iko Falconets le lu iko Spain - Garba Manu

en: "Golden Eaglets Coach Manu Garba says he is optimistic of the Falconets"" capability to beat their Spaniard counterparts in the quarter-finals of the ongoing FIFA U-20 Women World Cup in France."
yo: Akonimoogba iko Golden Eaglet Manu Garba so pe o da oun loju pe Iko Falconets ni agbara ati lu akeegbe won lati orile-ede Spain ninu ifigagbaga ipele keji si asekagba ife eye agbaaye awon odobinrin ti ojo ori won ko ju ogun odun lo ni ilu France.

en: Garba, who expressed the optimism in Abuja, said the Falconets had worked well for glory in the World Cup which they were determined to achieve.
yo: Garba, ti o fi aridaju yii han ni ilu Abuja, so pe iko Falconets ti se ise, won si ti pinnu lati le je ki ogo ife eye agbaaye yii je tiwon.

en: """The Falconets have worked very hard to prepare for FIFA Women U-20 World Cup."
yo: """Iko Falconets ti sise takuntakun lati mura sile fun idije asekagba ife eye agbaaye awon odobinrin ti ojo ori won ko ju ogun odun lo."

en: """The quarter-finals is the knockout stage and it is possible to beat Spain if our girls can increase their penetration in the attack,"""" Garba said."
yo: """ipele keji si asekagba je ipele ti a ti n jara eni bo, o si seese lati na iko Spain ti awon omobinrin wa ba le mu aleku ba isowowole lowo iwaju won, ni Garba wi."

en: The coach assured the Falconets of support of the entire country, saying that Nigeria was solidly behind them.
yo: Akonimoogba yii fi atileyin orile-ede yii da iko Falconets loju, o so pe awon omo Naijiiria wa leyin won.

en: He said that the team, with the help of God and hardwork, would qualify for the semi-finals.
yo: O so pe iko yii pelu iranlowo Olorun ati ise takuntakun yoo pegede si ipele ti o kangun si asekagba.

en: The Falconets on had Monday held China to a 1-1 draw to qualify for the quarter-finals.
yo: Iko Falconets lojo aje (Monday) ta omi ami ayo kookan pelu iko orile-ede China lati pegede si ipele keji si asekagba.

en: --- A call for sponsorship has been put out for the sport competition in Nigeria.
yo: --- Ipe fun isonigbowo ti je fifi sita fun awon ere idaraya lorile-ede Naijiiria.

en: Companies and individuals thata have the ability to spend into sport through cooperation of individuals in sport in Nigeria have been urged for sponsorship.
yo: Awon ile ise ati awon eniyan ti won lagbara lati nawo le ori ere-idaraya ni orile-ede Naijiiria ti je riro fun isonigbowo.

en: Mr. Bukola Olapade, one of council in charge of the field sport competition in Africa, called African Athelethics Championship 2018 that came up in Asaba, Delta state said this when speaking to the newsmen in Asaba, Mr. Olapade now used the good work of Rite foods limited as an example, how they provided food and drink for the competitors in the competition.
yo: Ogbeni Bukola Olapade, okan ninu awon omo igbimo ti o n ri si awon idije ori papa ni ile Adulawo, eyi ti won n pe ni African Athelethics Championship ti odun 2018 ti o waye ni ilu Asaba, ipinle Delta state ni o so eyi lasiko ti o n ba awon oniroyin soro ni ilu Asaba, Ogbeni Olapade ni bayii wa lo ise rere ile-ise Rite foods limited gege bi apeere lori bi won se pese ohun jije ati ohun mimu fun awon oludije.

en: When we approach them for their coporation in the sponsorship of the competition, immediately they showed interest, and they fully participated in the sporsorship of the of the field sport competition.
yo: Nigba ti a fi isonigbowo lo won, lesekese ni won fi ife han si i, won si kopa dele ninu isonigbowo idije ori papa naa.

en: Mr. Olapade explained futher in the competition that many people at the opening ceremony were provided withfood and drink by Rites foods, and provided many soft drink and snacks for children in the competition.
yo: Ogbeni Olapade tun salaye siwaju si i pe nibi idije naa opo awon eniyan ti won wa nibi ayeye iside ni won pese ohun jije ati ohun mimu lati odo Rites foods fun, bee ni won pese elerindodo ati ipanu fun awon omo keekeeke nibi idije naa.

en: The senior supervisor of Ritr Foods Ltd, Mr. Saleem Adegunwa established it that the company is trying all her best to support what will show the glory of Nigeria.
yo: Olubewo agba fun ile-ise Rite Foods Ltd, Ogbeni Saleem Adegunwa fi idi re mule pe ile-ise naa n gbiyaju gbogbo ipa re lati satileyin ohun ti yoo gbe ogo Naijiiria jade.

en: """We have the believe that our people can do something different with their gifts, with our different support, by sponsoring, supporting with drums and other activities"""
yo: """A nigbagbo pe awon eniyan wa le da awon ara oto pelu ebun won, atileyin wa orisirisi, isonigbowo, isatileyin pelu ilu, ati awon ohun miiran."

en: He establish this in his words.
yo: O so o di mimo.

en: Mr. Adegunwa said that Rit foods has spent something around Thirty million naira (N30 million) on the foods and drinks provided for the athletes , that which he said they ese as a support for the development of sport in Nigeria and Africa as a whole.
yo: Ogbeni Adegunwa so pe ile-ise Rite foods ti na nnkan bi ogbon milionu naira (N30 million) lori ohun jije ati ohun mimu ti won pese fun awon alayo wonyi eyi ti o so pe awon se gege bi atileyin fun ere idaraya ni orile-ede Naijiiria ati ile Adulawo lapapo.

en: The senior supervisor of the company assured us that, though the competition is coming to an end on Sunday, yet Rite foods will continue in his effort to support Sport competitions. He said the reason for the support of Ritr Foods for filed sport competition in Asaba in 2018 was that provision ofrefreshment for the Champion.
yo: Olubewo agba fun ile-ise yii fi da wa loju pe, loooto ni idije yii n wa si opin ni oju aiku (Sunday), sugbon ile-ise Rite foods yoo tesiwaju akitiyan re lati maa satileyin idije naa. O so pe idi pataki atileyin ile-ise Rite Foods fun idije yii ni ilu Asaba lodun 2018 ni lati pese ohun jije fun awon ajawe olubori.

en: He said the refreshments that will renew their strength afresh when competing.
yo: O so pe awon ohun jije yii yoo so okun won dotun bi won tun se n dije si i.

en: --- Thank you - Ta Lou relishes Asaba triumph, appreciates fans
yo: --- E se o - Ta Lou relishes ijawe olubori Asaba, o du pe lowo awon alatileyin

en: Following her triumph in the 100 metres final of the 2018 African Senior Athletics Championship in Asaba, Ivorien sprint star Ta Lou Marie Josee has expressed her appreciation for the massive support from her countrymen.
yo: Latari ijawe olubori re ninu idije ologorun mita ni asekagba idije awon Agba Asare ori papa ile Adulawo odun 2018 ni ilu Asaba, Gbajugbaja elese ehoro omo ile Ivory coast Ta Lou Marie Josee ti fi emi imoore re han fun atileyin nla lati odo awon ololufe ere idaraya lorile-ede.

en: Marie Josee Ta Lou on Thursday won the gold medal in a time of 11.15 seconds, beating Ghana's Janet Amponsah who clocked 11.54 seconds; and Nigeria's young prodigy Udo Joy-Gabriel who finished with a time of 11.58 seconds.
yo: Marie Josee Ta Lou lojobo (Thursday) gba ami eye wura idije naa pelu ere iseju aaya mokanla-le-iseju-ina-meeedogun 11.15 ti o fi na Janet Amponsah omo orile-ede Ghana ti o sa tire ni iseju aaya mejila-din- iseju-ina-mefa 11.54 seconds; nigba ti odomodebinrin omo Naijiiria Udo Joy-Gabriel pari tire pelu iseju aaya mejila-din- iseju-ina-meji

en: With the 100 metres title now in the bag, Ta Lou will try to consolidate on her global ranking by putting up stronger showings on the IAAF Diamond league circuit later in the year.
yo: Pelu bi o se ti gba ami eye idije ologorun mita sapo re, Ta Lou yoo gbiyaju lati mu igberu ba ikopa ipo re lagbaaye nipa kikopa daradara ninu idije IAAF ti yoo waye laipe yii.

en: --- A disabled dancer encourage the Kenya Citizen.
yo: --- Akanda eda onijo gba awon omo orile-ede Kenya niyanju.

en: The world health organization has said over eighty (81) million Africans that are diabled, and many of them face discouragement and hatred, which can kill their opportunity to take part in the in education, works and their well being.
yo: Ajo Eleto Ilera Agbaaye ti so pe o le ni okanlelogorin milionu awon omo ile Adulawo ti o je Akanda, beeni opo ninu won si n foju wina irewesi okan ati ikoriira, leyii ti o n se akoba fun anfaani won lati kopa ninu eto eko, ise ati igbayegbadun.

en: For someone to dande in air is one of the common dance among the disabled in Kenya.
yo: Fun eniyan lati jo loju ofurufu je okan lara awon ijo ti o wopo laaarin awon akanda lorile-ede Kenya.

en: Nicholas Ouma Odhiambo said that the team gave him the opportunity to showcase in the dance competition.
yo: Nicholas Ouma Odhiambo so pe iko yii fun ohun ni oore-ofe lati le kopa ninu idije ijo jijo naa

en: --- Why i accepted the Juventus challenge - Ronaldo
yo: --- Idi ti mo fi gba ise iko Juventus - Ronaldo

en: "Portuguese striker Cristiano Ronaldo says he joined Italian giants Juventus because he wants to help the ""Old Lady"" win more trophies - particularly the UEFA champions league."
yo: Atamatase iko orile-ede Portugal Christiano Ronaldo so pe oun dara po mo ogbohuntarigi iko orile-ede Italy tori pe oun fe ran iko 'old lady' ohun lowo lati tubo maa gba ife eye si i paapaa julo ife eye UEFA Champions League.

en: Speaking to the media shortly after his unveiling, Ronaldo said he wanted to leave a mark on the Serie A.
yo: Nigba ti o n ba awon oniroyin soro leyin igba ti a si aso loju re, Ronaldo so pe oun fe ni ipa ninu idije Serie A.

en: """I like challenges and I know that this will be a difficult one."
yo: """Mo feran ifigagbaga, mo si mo pe eyi yoo le."

en: """The standing ovation I received here at the Allianz was a spectacular moment for me."
yo: """Idurokini ti mo gba ni Allianz nibi jo mi loju."

en: Ronaldo promised to end Juventus's European barren run.
yo: Ronaldo seleri lati fi opin si oda ife European ti o ba iko Juventus.

en: Ronaldo joined Juventus from Real Madrid in a deal worth over 100 million pounds.
yo: Ronaldo dara po mo iko Juventus lati iko Real Madrid pelu adehun owo ti o le ogorun-un owo pounds.

en: Within nine years, Ronaldo won four UEFA champions league titles, and two La Liga championships.
yo: Laaarin odun mesan-an Ronaldo gba ife eye UEFA Champions league merin ati ife La Liga meji.

en: --- VON wins NUJ Women's Table Tennis Tournament
yo: --- VON gba ami eye idije Teniisi ori tabili Obinrin ti NUJ gbe kale.

en: Voice of Nigeria's Kissit Golit has emerged winner of the Women's 2nd NUJ Chapel Table Tennis tournament.
yo: Kissit Golit ti Voice of Nigeria ti gbe igba oroke ninu idije Teniisi ori tabili Obinrin ti NUJ gbe kale eleekkeji iru re.

en: The annual tournament which enters its 2nd edition was played on Saturday, 14th July 2018 at the Chinese cultural central, Abuja.
yo: Idije olodoodun yii ti o ti wo eekeji iru re je gbigba ni ojo abameta (Saturday), Ojo kerinla, Osu keje odun 2018 ni gbongan ile asa ile China ni ilu Abuja.

en: The Chinese cultural centre is collaborating with the Nigerian Union of Journalist (NUJ), FCT chapel.
yo: Ile asa ile China n se asepo pelu Egbe awon Oniroyin Naijiria (NUJ) eka ti olu ilu ile Naijiria.

en: Tukumbo Adesonya emerged winner of the men's 2nd NUJ inter chapel Table Tennis Tournament, he represented News Agency of Nigeria beating defending champion from the ministry of information, Henry Onosanya, Sangotola Tobi was one of the three people that represented Voice of Nigeria but was unlucky as he was eliminated in the quarter final.
yo: Tokumbo Adesanya ni o gbaami eye idije Teniisi ori tabili Okunrin ti NUJ gbe kale, eleekeji ti eka si eka. Oun lo soju ajo oniroyin ile Naijiria lati na asoju ile-ise oro iroyin ti ami eye yii wa lowo re, Onosanya, Sangotola Tobi yii wa lara awon meta ti won soju Voice of Nigeria sugbon ko bode pade pelu bi won se yowo kilanko re ni ipele keji si asekagba.

en: Also representing Voices of Nigeria was Comfort Babatunde who was eliminated in the first round.
yo: Lara awon ti o tun soju Voices of Nigeria ni Comfort Babatunde ti won ja kuro ni ipele akoko.

en: --- Official: Ronaldo joins Juventus in 105mn pounds deal
yo: --- Irohin gbangba: Ronaldo dara po mo iko Juventus pelu adehun arunlelogorun-un milionu owo pounds.

en: Portuguese striker Cristiano Ronaldo has officially left Real Madrid for Italian giants Juventus of Turin for 105 million pounds.
yo: Atamatase omo orile-ede portugal Cristiano Ronaldo ti kuro ni inu iko Real Madrid bo si inu akinkanju iko orile-ede Italy Juventus ti ilu Turin pelu arunlelogorun-un milionu owo pounds.

en: In a statement released on Tuesday, Real Madrid said it sold Ronaldo to Juventus in-line with the wishes of the 33 year old.
yo: Ni ninu oro kan ti a fi lede lojo isegun (Tuesday), Real Madrid so pe awon ta Ronaldo si inu iko Juventus ni ibamu pelu ife omo etalelogbon odun ohun.

en: """Real Madrid wants to express its gratitude to a player who has proved to be the best in the world and who has marked one of the brightest times in the history of our club and world football."
yo: """Real Madrid fe fi emi imoore won han si agbaboolu ti o ti fi ara re han gege bi agbaboolu ti o dara julo lagbaaye ti o si ti nipa lori awon asiko ti o dara fun wa julo ninu itan boolu afesegba lagbaaye."

en: """Beyond the conquered titles, the trophies achieved and the triumphs achieved in the playing fields during these 9 years, Cristiano Ronaldo has been an example of dedication, work, responsibility, talent and improvement,"" the statement said."
yo: """Yato si awon ami eye yii, awon ife eye ti o gba ati awon ijawe olubori re lori papa laarin odun mesan-an yii, Cristiano Ronaldo ti je apeere ifarajin, isojuse, ebun ati ilosiwaju."" ninu oro naa."

en: Ronaldo leaves the Spanish capital having become the top scorer in the history of Real Madrid with 451 goals in 438 games.
yo: Ronaldo kuro ni olu ilu orile-ede Spaini yii leyin ti o ti di eni ti o ri awon he julo ninu itan iko Real Madrid pelu ami ayo otalenirinwodinmesan-an ninu ifesewonse ojilenirinwodin-meji.

en: In total he won 16 titles, including 4 European Cups, 3 of them consecutive and 4 in the last 5 seasons.
yo: Ni apapo o gba ife eye merindinlogun ninu won ni ife European merin, meta je lera won nigba ti ikerin je saa marun-un seyin.

en: --- Mahrez signs five-year deal with Man City
yo: --- Mahrez towo bo iwe adehun odun marun-un pelu iko Man City

en: Algerian international Riyad Mahrez secured his move to Premier League champions Manchester City on Tuesday, seven months after his hopes were dashed when City refused to pay Leicester's asking price.
yo: Agbaboolu omo orile-ede Algeria Riyad Mahrez pari itokoso re losi iko asaaju idije Premier League, Manchester City lojo isegun (Tuesday), leyin osu meje ti o ti soreti nu latari pe iko City ko lati san owo ti iko Leicester n beere fun.

en: This time though Leicester said they had sold him for what is a club-record fee, with some reports suggesting the champions paid 60 million ($79.6million), which would make it their record buy.
yo: Ni asiko yii, iko Leicester so pe awon ta a ni iye owo ti o won inu iwe itan iko naa, ti awon iroyin kan si n ni I lero pe iko asaaju yii san ogota milionu owo pounds (Ogorin milionu din die Owo dola) leyii ti yoo so o di eyi ti o n wo inu iwe itan.

en: The 27-year-old a pivotal figure when Leicester stormed to a shock Premier League title in 2016 signed a five-year contract.
yo: Omo odun metadinlogbon yii ti o je eekan nigba ti iko Leicester gba ife Premier League lona iyanu lodun 2016 towo bo adehun odun marun-un.

en: """I am so pleased to have joined City, a side playing great football under Pep Guardiola,."
yo: """Inu mi dun lati dara po mo iko City, iko ti o n gba boolu to ta sansan labe Pep Guardiola."

en: Watching them from afar has been a pleasure.
yo: Wiwo won lokeere je oun ti o maa n wu mi..

en: "Pep is committed to playing attacking football, which is a perfect for me, and City's performances last season were outstanding."" Mahrez said."
yo: "Pep je eni ti o fi ara si titi boolu siwaju, leyii ti o se regi pelu mi, bee si ni isowosise Citi ni saa to lo ko legbe"" eyi ni Mahrez wi."

en: ---Spain appoints Luis Enrique as new coach
yo: ---Spain yan Luis Enrique gege bi akonimoogba tuntun.

en: Spain's football federation says former Barcelona coach Luis Enrique has been appointed to take charge of the national team.
yo: Ajo to n moju to boolu afesegba lorile-ede Spain ti so pe akonimoogba iko Barcelona teleri Luis Enrique ti di yiyan gege lati gba akoso iko orile-ede naa.

en: He replaces Julen Lopetegui, who was sacked on the eve of the World Cup after accepting the job at Real Madrid, with Fernando Hierro taking temporary charge for the finals in Russia.
yo: O ropo Julen Lopetegui, ti won yo nise ni ife eye agbaaye ku ola leyin ti o gba ise ninu iko Real Madrid, nigba ti Fernando Hierro ti n tuko awon ifesewonse ni Russia fun igba die.

en: Luis Enrique has signed a two-year contract.
yo: Luis Enrique towo bo adehun odun meji.

en: --- World Cup trophy on display in Moscow
yo: --- Ife eye agbaaye di sisafihan ni Moscow

en: "The FIFA World Football Museum exhibition will present the 2018 FIFA World Cup winners"" trophy for the entire day of Sunday in Moscow."
yo: Ajo to n safihan nnkan isembaye ere idaraya FIFA yoo pate ife eye olujawe olubori odun 2018 fun odidi ojo aiku (Sunday) ni ilu Moscow.

en: It will be displayed alongside the replica of the Jules Rimet Cup, the trophy that was first presented to winners in 1930 when the competition started.
yo: Yoo je sisafihan pelu ife eye iru re, ife Jules Rimet, ti won koko fun eni ti o gba idije naa lodun 1930 nigba ti idije naa beere.

en: "The exhibition, known as ""The History Makers,"""" will hold at the Hyundai Motorstudio on New Arbat Avenue in Moscow."
yo: "Isafihan yii ti a mo si, ""Awon Akotan,"" yoo waye ni yara aworan ile-ise Hyundai Motorstudio ni agbegbe New ni ilu Moscow."

en: The exhibition will end five days after the final match of the 2018 FIFA World Cup in Russia on July 15.
yo: Isafihan yoo pari leyin ojo karun-un ifesewonse asekagba ife eye agbaaye odun 2018 lorile-ede Russia lojo keeedogun osu keje.

en: World football body, FIFA, said in a statement on Saturday that admission to the exhibition was free, adding that media representatives were allowed to visit the exhibition, take photos or film inside.
yo: Ajo to n moju to boolu afesegba lagbaaye, FIFA, so ninu oro kan lojo abameta (Saturday) pe ofe ni iwole si ibi Isafihan yii, o fi kun un pe won gba awon oniroyin laaye lati wole, lati ya aworan ati lati ka aworan sile nibe.

en: """The exhibition ground floor is a tribute to the passion and devotion of fans from all over the world and their role in making the FIFA World Cup a compelling spectacle."
yo: """Ibi isafihan yii je imoriri ife ati ikobiarasi awon alatileyin kaakiri agbaaye ati ipa won lori rira iyi fun ife eye FIFA agbaaye."

en: """There, visitors can see messages from fans of all 32 competing nations and a special display for the adidas Telstar Official Match Balls of the 2018 FIFA World Cup used for the kick-off of the 64 games played in Russia."
yo: """Nibe, awon olubewo le ri atejise lati odo awon alatileyin awon orile-ede mejilelogbon ti won n figa gbaga ati afihan awon boolu ti won lo fun ifesewonse merinlelogota ife eye FIFA agbaaye odun 2018 lorile-ede Russia ti ile ise adidas pese."

en: """After each match, the ball which started the game is added to the growing collection at the exhibition,"""" a statement by Moritz Ansorge, the FIFA World Football Museum collections manager, indicated."
yo: """Leyin ifesewonse kookan, boolu ti o ba beere ifesewonse naa yoo di fifikun ara awon afihan yii,"""""" ni oro ti Moritz Ansorge alakooso Ajo to n safihan nnkan isembaye ere idaraya FIFA se lalaye."

en: --- Tite gets new 4 year contract
yo: --- Tite gba adehun odun merin miiran.

en: Brazil's Football Federation (CBF) is offering head coach Tite a new four-year deal, despite the five-time World Champion's elimination in the quarter-finals.
yo: Ajo to n moju to boolu afesegba lorile-ede Brazil (CBF) n fi adehun odun merin miiran lo akonimoogba agba iko naa Tite tohun tenu ijakuro ninu ife eye agbaaye leemarun-un otooto lati ipele keji si asekagba.

en: According to the Brazilian website Globo, CBF is satisfied with the head coach's work and is offering him a new contract.
yo: Gege bi Globo itakun ile Brazil se so, Isowosise akonimoogba agba yii te Ajo CBF lorun, won si n fi adehun miiran lo o.

en: The 57-year-old took charge of Brazil in June 2016 helping the team qualify for the 2018 FIFA World Cup from the first place among the South American teams.
yo: Eni odun metadinlogota gba akoso iko Brazil ni inu osu kefa odun 2016, o si ran iko naa lowo lati pegede si inu ife eye agbaaye FIFA odun 2018 pelu ipo kini lati inu awon orile-ede ile Guusu America.

en: Under Tite's management, Brazil have secured 20 victories and four draws losing only two games so far, including Friday's defeat to Belgium.
yo: Labe akoso Tite, iko Brazil ti jawe olubori ni igba ogun, won ta omi merin won si padanu leemeji pere, ninu re ni ipadanu ojo eti (Friday) pelu iko Belgium.

en: [Update] As members of SEBIN searched Diaz's and Soto's home, Luz Mely Reyes reported live from the scene.
yo: [Iroyin to tewa lowo] Luz Mely Reyes ti isele naa se ojuu re, fi to wa leti nipa bi awon Agbofinro SEBIN se ye ilee Diaz pelu ilee Soto naa wo.

en: The SNTP also reported the incident:
yo: Isokan awon Oniroyin naa fe oro naa loju:

en: URGENT At this time, 3:30 am, a commission from the Intelligence Forces arrives to journalist and human rights activist Luis Carlos Diaz's home, missing since 5:30 pm #WhereIsLuisCarlos
yo: NI KIAKIA Ni dede asiko yii, ni dede agogo 3:00 owuro kutukutu, igbimo lati ajo Amuninipa de ile oniroyin ati aja-fun- etoo omo eniyan Luis Carlos Diaz, ti o ti di eni awati lati agogo 5:30 irole #NiboNiLuisCarlosWa.

en: Other human rights and freedom of speech organizations joined the campaign through #DondeEstaLuisCarlos (Where is Luis Carlos?) which is, at the moment, a trending topic in Venezuela's twittosphere.
yo: Awon ajafuneto omoniyan ati ajo ominira oro siso naa darapo mo ipolongo yii pelu #DondeEstaLuisCarlos (Nibo ni Luis Carlos wa?), ti o je pe, ni bayii, ni akole ti o gbajumo ni ori ikanni ayelujara Twitter ti Orile Ede Venezuela.

en: Diaz is a journalist and a human rights and freedom of speech advocate who is well known and highly appreciated in Venezuela and abroad for his commentary and criticism of the government of Nicolas Maduro.
yo: Diaz je ajabo iroyin ati a-ja-fun-eto-omo eniyan ti o je ogbologboo ajafuneto ominira oro siso ti won si mo ise re fun un l'orile ede Venezuela ati oke okun fun idasoro ati itako ijoba Nicholas Maduro.

en: He has long worked with Soto producing web-based video and radio programs focused on politics and human rights in Venezuela.
yo: O ti to igba die kan ti o ti n sise pelu iyawo re ati oludasoro oselu ti o gbajumo n ni, Naky Soto, ti won si n se igbejade awon fidio ati eto Igbohunsafefe lori ayelujara eyi ti o da lori iselu ati eto omo eniyan ni Venezuela.

en: He has also worked as an educator and promoter of the creation of citizen media spaces and independent media projects.
yo: O ti sise gege bi akoni ati olugbe-laruge idasile aye oto fun awon ara ilu ati awon akanse eto igbohun safefe ti ko lowo ijoba ninu.

en: Diaz has also been part of the Global Voices community for more than a decade.
yo: Diaz tun je olukopa ninu egbe Ohun Agbaye fun odun mewaa.

en: To me, Luis Carlos is a brilliant person, well versed in information and networks in this chaotic Venezuela of ours.
yo: Lodo temi, Luis Carlos je onilaakaye eda kan, o gbonju ninu iroyin gbigba ati ikansi-ara-eni ninu Venezuela ti wa yii ti ko fara ro.

en: He has been able to make links with society (from criticism to cultural spaces) #WhereIsLuisCarlos.
yo: O ti se awari ijapo ninu ilu (lati itako si ibi isese) #NiboniLuisCarlosWa.

en: Just a few days prior to his disappearance, the state-affiliated media program Con el Mazo Dando showed a video clip of a recent broadcast of Diaz.
yo: Laarin ojo perete to siwaju ipooraa re, eto ikan-sara- eni ti ijoba Con el Mazo Dando safihan fidio ti Diaz soro ninuu re.

en: The program's host, politician Diosdado Cabello, insinuated that Diaz had helped to orchestrate the nationwide power outage that had Venezuelans living in the dark for more than 24 hours on March 7 and 8.
yo: Atokun eto ohun, oloselu Diosdado Cabello, ro kan pe Diaz lowo si ifehonu han aisi inaa monamona ti o lo jakejado orile ede eyi ti o mu ki awon omo Venezuela maa gbe ninu okunkun fun o le ni wakati merin le logun lojo 7 ati 8 Osu Erena

en: There is no evidence to support this.
yo: Ko si eri ti o fi ese rinle.

en: It's been been seven hours since Luis Carlos Diaz has gone missing.
yo: Wakati meje ti re koja lo ti Luis Carlos Diaz ti di awati.

en: [Diaz] is a journalist for Union Radio Noticias and he's a human rights activist.
yo: [Diaz] je oniroyin fun ile ise igbohunsafefe Union Radio Noticias , o si tun je ajafuneto omoniyan.

en: We're at the SEBIN headquarters and they deny having him [in custody there] #WhereIsLuisCarlos
yo: Awa ni olu ile isee SEBIN headquarters ati pe won ni awon ko ni i [ni ahamo awon] #NiboNiLuisCarlosWa.

en: [Update: they later confirmed Diaz was in custody]
yo: [Iroyin ti o te wa lowo: they won papa jewo wipe [Diaz wa ni akoloo won]

en: Journalist Vladimir Villegas denounced that he had been detained by government forces:
yo: Akoroyin Vladimir Villegas so wipe ko ri bee mo wipe ijoba ni o fi owo agbara mu u:

en: We've been informed that @Unionradionet journalist Luis Carlos Diaz, has been detained by State's security forces.
yo: radionet Luis Carlos Diaz, ti wa ninu atimole agbofinro Ilu.

en: We express our concern for his physical integrity.
yo: A ba a kedun ipo ti o wa.

en: We demand any information of his whereabouts and respect for his human rights.
yo: A beere fun itosona nipa mimo ibi ti o wa, ati ibowo fun eto omoniyan-an re.

en: The Global Voices community stands in solidarity with Luis Carlos, his family, and all other independent journalists working to hold power to account in Venezuela.
yo: Egbe Ohun Agbaye duro sinsin pelu Luis Carlos, ebii re, ati oniroyin aladaasise gbogbo awon ti o n mu ijoba se bi o ti ye ni Venezuela.

en: We wish for his safe and speedy return, and will continue to update this story as it develops.
yo: A n retii re ki o de kiakia ni alaafia ara ati emi, a o maa gbe awon iroyin sita nipa iroyin yii bi o ba se n te wa lowo.

en: Nigeria's social media bill will obliterate online freedom of expression
yo: Iwe abadofin ilo ero alatagba yoo pa ominira oro siso lori ayelujara ni Naijiria

en: The draconian bill will legalize internet shutdowns in Nigeria
yo: Iwe abadofin naa yoo fi ase fun isanpa ero ayelujara ni Naijiriaj

en: Senator Mohammed Sani Musa is the sponsor of the social media bill. Screenshot from Channel Television You Tube video.
yo: Asoju Mohammed Sani Musa ni agbateruu iwe abadofin ilo ero alatagba. Aworan ageku lati ibudo Channel Television You Tube .

en: "On November 20, the Protection from Internet Falsehoods and Manipulation of other Related Matters Bill 2019, known as the ""social media bill,"" sponsored by Senator Mohammed Sani Musa, sailed through a second reading."
yo: "Lojo 20 osu Belu, Iwe Abadofin ti o fi Aabo fun Iro ati Makaruru ti o ro mo on ti odun-un 2019, ti a mo si ""iwe abadofin ilo ero alatagba,"" ti Asoju kan ti oruko re n je Mohammed Sani Musa se agbateruu re, ti di kika ninu igbimo fun igba keji."

en: The social media bill aims to curb online falsehoods and mis- and disinformation.
yo: Erongba iwe abadofin ilo ero alatagba naa ni lati dekun awon aheso ati gbolohun ti ki i se otito lori ero ayelukara bi ajere.

en: However, the real intent is not regulation, but rather, the annihilation of online freedom of expression, criminalization of government criticism and legalization of internet shutdowns in Nigeria.
yo: Bi-o-ti-le-je-wipe, ki i se lati fi ofin de ilo ero alatagba ni iwe abadofin naa da le lori, amo sa, o maa pa ominira oro siso lori ayelujara, iso alatako ijoba di odaran ati fifi atipa ero ayelujara fungba die sinu iwe ofin.

en: A similar bill was beaten dead in its track in 2016.
yo: Atepa bi erin ba te koriko ni awon omo Naijiria te iru iwe abadofin bayii pa ni odun-un 2016.

en: Any form of government criticism is a crime
yo: Ese ni bi o ba gbo ijoba lenu (tako ijoba)

en: "This bill aims to ""[prevent] the transmission of false statements or declaration of facts in Nigeria,"" according to Section 1a."
yo: "Gege bi Abala 1A ti se salaye, erongba iwe abadofin yii ni lati ""[maa je] ki igbejade oro ti ko ni otito kan ninu tabi eyi ti erii re ko f'ese rinle to o jade ni Naijiria."""

en: "It will ban the dissemination statements likely to be ""prejudicial"" to Nigeria, including subjects like public health, public safety, ""public tranquility or public finances"" and Nigeria's ""friendly relations with other countries."""
yo: "Yoo yo owo kilanko awon atejade iro ti o le ko orile edee Naijiria si ""iyonu,"" lawo lai gbagbee awon oran bii eto ilera gbogboogbo, aaboo gbogboogbo, ""ibale-okan-an gbogboogbo tabi isuna owoo gbogboogbo"" ati ""awon ibasepo orile-edee Naijiria pelu awon orile ede miiran."""

en: "The bill will also ""detect, control and safeguard against coordinated misuse of online accounts and bots,"" according to Section 1c."
yo: "Abala 1c so bi iwe abadofin naa yoo se ""mu, sakoso ati fi aabo bo ilonilokulo awon isamulo ati ero adanikansise ori ero ayelujara."""

en: In other words, everything is permissible to monitor and control in the proposed law - under the guise of fighting false information.
yo: Ni alaye siwaju si i, ko si ohun ti oju ofin tuntun naa ko lee to bi o ba ti je lori ayelujara - labe aburada a n gbogun ti aheso ati iro ponbele.

en: "The social media bill is omniscient since it will be binding for every Nigerian citizen, regardless of residence or geographic location, as long as the ambiguous ""false statement of fact"" is transmitted within the country."
yo: "Orun n ya bo ni iwe abadofin ilo ero alatagba naa, ko yo enikan sile, gbogbo omo orile edee Naijiria ni yoo ba, ko kan agbegbe tabi ibi ti eniyan fi se ibugbe, maa se e l'oogun maa mo, owo awon ologinni oju tole oju toko ni ""gbolohun iro ti ko ni eri"" ti o ba gba opopona ero ayelukara bi ajere Naijiria yoo bo si."

en: Section 3a to b (i) of the social media bill states that:
yo: Abala 3a si b (i) ti iwe abadofin ilo ero alatagba so wipe:

en: A person must not do any act in or outside Nigeria in order to transmit in Nigeria a statement knowing or having reasons to believe that it is a false statements of fact; and the transmission of the statement in Nigeria is likely to be, prejudicial to the security of Nigeria or any part of Nigeria.
yo: Enikeni ko gbodo wu iwa kiwa kan ninu tabi leyin odi Naijiria lati tari gbolohun ti ko ni otito kan ti a ko lee fi erii re mule sita; ati agbesori afefe ayelujara gbolohun t'o le ko orile edee Naijiria sita bi omo ojo mejo nipa ti aabo ilu.

en: "The nebulous ""national security"" excuse is used to justify the trumping of free expression."
yo: "Oran-an ti ""aabo orile-ede"" ni ori Esu ti ofin naa duro le lati pa eto si ominira oro siso mo."

en: But it does not stop there, the Nigerian government is always right and cannot be criticized.
yo: Amo ko tan sibe, ko si eni to le tako ijoba Naijiria tabi gbo o lenu nitori ki i s'asise.

en: "According to Section 3b (vi), any statement that diminishes ""public confidence in the performance of any duty or function of, in the exercise of any power of the government"" is prohibited."
yo: "Ni Abala 3b (vi), gbolohun ti o ba yepere ""ojuse tabi ise, ti o je ti ijoba loju ara ilu"" ko lee la ori ayelujara koja."

en: "According to Section 3b (v), this applies to any statement that: ""incites feelings of enmity, hatred, directed at persons or ill-will between different groups of persons."""
yo: "Gege bi Abala 3b (v) ti se fi han, eyi ni i se pelu gbolohun ti o: ""fa imunilotaa, ti a so si enikan tabi itara laaarin awon eniyan."""

en: This is dangerous because it leaves regulators open to contradictory interpretations that could be abused by political actors.
yo: Eyi lewu nitori o fi aye gba awon onipo ase lati lo agbara nilokulo.

en: Who defines and approves what incites feelings of hatred?
yo: Ta ni i so boya gbolohun kan le fa rogbodiyan?

en: It means that seeking transparency or even daring to hold a politician accountable could be declared hateful.
yo: Iyen tumo si wipe lilo inu kan tabi mimu awon oloseluu mu ilerii won se le ja si ikoriira lojuu won.

en: The punishment upon conviction for any provisions of the bill is a fine that ranges between 200,000 and 10 million naira [about $556 to $28,000 United States dollars], imprisonment for a term not exceeding three years or both.
yo: Owo itanran fun eni ti ile ejo ba da lebi to laaarin egberun 200 ati egbeegberun 10 owo naira [ti o to $556 si $28,000 owo orile edee United States], itimole fun odun meta tabi mejeeji.

en: Police licensed to shut down the internet
yo: Ase fun Ajo Agbofinro lati san ero ayelujara pa fungba die

en: "The social media bill also grants the government unlimited power to switch off the internet, through the ""Access Blocking Order"" as contained in Section 12, number 3:"
yo: "Iwe abadofin ilo ero alatagba naa fun ijoba lagbara bi o se hu won lati san ero ayelukara bi ajere pa nigbakuugba ti o ba lero wipe o to, nipase ""Ase Idigaga Iraye"" lati lo ayelujara bi o ti se wa ni Abala 12, onkaye 3:"

en: The Law Enforcement Department may direct the NCC [Nigerian Communications Commission - the regulatory agency for the telecommunication industry] to order the internet access service provider to take reasonable steps to disable access by end-users in Nigeria.
yo: Eka Agbofinro lee fi ase fun Ajo Igbohunsafefe Naijiria NCC [Nigerian Communications Commission - ti o n se bonkari itakuroso ori ero ayarabiasa] lati pa a lase fun apese aye si ilo ero ayelujara ki o gbe igbese loju ese ti o ni mu awon onlo ri aye lo ayelujara ni Naijiria.

en: Internet service providers must comply with this blocking order or risk upon conviction a fine within the range of 5 to 10 million naira [$14,000-28,000 USD].
yo: Awon apese ayelujara gbodo tele ofin idigaga yii tabi ki won o sanwo itanran ti o to egbeegberun 5 si 10 owo naira [$14,000-28,000 USD].

en: "In addition, the bill under consideration indemnifies the internet service providers from any ""civil or criminal liability"" incurred from a lawsuit brought against them for ""complying to any access blocking order,"" according to section 12, number 5."
yo: "Ni afikun, iwe abadofin naa fi aridaju aabo bo awon apese ise ero ayelujara ti ko ni mu wahala ""ara ilu tabi bee "" ti ko ba a le jade lati idajo kan ti enikeni ko ba pe won funope ""won tele ofin idigaga iraye"" si ayelujara, iyen bi abala 12, onkaye 5 se fi lele."

en: The human rights violations get murkier because the law grants the police a legal license to command an access-blocking order at whim.
yo: Iteri eto omoniyan naa s'okunkun si i nitori wipe ofin naa gba awon olopaa laye labe ofin lati pa ase idigaga-aye bi o ti se hu won.

en: "Section 15a states that only the ""initiative"" of the police in face of ""overwhelming sufficing evidence"" is needed to cancel an internet shutdown in the country."
yo: "Abala 15a so wipe ""ise opolo"" olopaa ni asiko ""isewadii eri to daju"" je koko lati fagile isanpa ero ayelujara ni orile ede naa."

en: "Consequently, ""no appeal may be made to the High Court"" [Section 13 (2) ] by any party to revoke such a ban without first applying to the police to revoke an existing blocking order."
yo: "Ni ipari, ""ko si aye fun ejoo ko temi lorun ni Ile-ejo Giga"" [Abala 13 (2) ] ti eenikeni le fi ye idigaga sile lai maa koko to olopaa lo lati fagile ofin idigaga naa."

en: The implications of this are obvious - no one can resort to the courts for redress in the face of this violation while the blocking order persists.
yo: Ipa eyi han gbagada - enikeni ko ni lee gba ile ejo lo fun igbeja ifeto eni dunni yii ti idigaga naa si wa.

en: The lawmakers behind the social media bill
yo: Awon asoju-sofin ti o wa leyin iwe abadofin ero alatagba naa

en: Three lawmakers seem to be the arrowhead of the bill in the Senate, the upper house of Nigeria's parliament: Mohammed Sani Musa (the sponsor of the bill), Abba Moro and Elisha Abbo.
yo: Awon asoju-sofin meta kan ni o gbe iwe abadofin naa sori ninu igbimo, ile igbimo agba: Mohammed Sani Musa (agbateruu iwe abadofin), Abba Moro ati Elisha Abbo.

en: Mohammed Sani Musa's company, Activate Technologies Limited, supplied the Permanent Voter Cards (PVCs) machine used for the 2019 general elections, while he was the candidate of the ruling All Progressives Congress (APC) for Niger East Senatorial district, according to the investigate outlet, Premium Times.
yo: Ile-isee Mohammed Sani Musa, Activate Technologies Limited, ni o ko ero Iwe-pelebe Idibo Alalope (PVCs) ti a lo fun ibo odun-un 2019, nigba ti o je ondijedupo labe egbe oloseluu ti o n tuko eto iselu lowo All Progressives Congress (APC) fun Asoju Ila-Oorun Niger, iyen gege bi ile ise asewadii, Premium Times se te e jade.

en: This is an allegation that the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) admitted.
yo: Ajo Eleto (INEC) gba esun naa mora.

en: Musa's conflict of interest raised some doubts about the true independence of Nigeria's election umpire in the last election.
yo: Oran yii fi han pe awon alakooso ibo ti o koja ko sise lai lowo awon alagbara n'nu.

en: Ishaku Elisha Abbo of the opposition People's Democratic Party (PDP) is a senator representing the Adamawa North Senatorial District in Adamawa State, in northeast Nigerian.
yo: Ishaku Elisha Abbo ti egbe alatako People's Democratic Party (PDP) je asoju ti o n soju Ekun-un Ariwa Adamawa ni Ipinle Adamawa, ni ila-oorun ariwa orile edee Naijiria.

en: In July 2019, in the presence of a police officer, Abbo assaulted a female staff member in an adult sex toy store in Abuja.
yo: Ninu osu Agemo 2019, ni isoju olopaa, Abbo se asemase pelu osisebinrin kan ninu iso ohun ibalopo ni olu-ilu Naijiria ni Abuja.

en: After a video of the assault went viral on social media, Abbo offered a public apology.
yo: Leyin ti aworan casemase naa fon ka sori ero alatagba, Abbo offered mo iwaa re lebi, o si bebe.

en: Abba Moro, also with the PDP, is the senator representing Benue South district, northcentral Nigeria.
yo: Abba Moro, ti i se omo egbee PDP, ni asoju fun eka Guusu Benue, aarin gbungbun ariwa Naijiria.

en: On March 15, 2014, Moro, as minister of interior, was responsible for the Nigerian Immigration Recruitment tragedy in which about 6 million Nigerian youths who applied for 4,000 vacant positions in Nigerian Immigration Service were forced to assemble in various recruitment locations in the country.
yo: Ni ojo 15, osu Erena, odun-un 2014, Moro, ti i se oga patapata eto abele, lo wa nidii isele abanilokanje Igbanisise Eso asobode Naijiria ti awon odolangba ti o to bii egbeegberun 6 to fe aye ise egberun 4 ti o si sile ninu ileese Eso Asobode Naijiria ti won kora jo nibi orisiirisii jakejado orile ede naa.

en: The resulting stampede due to overcrowding led to about 20 deaths and multiple injuries.
yo: Isele ti o buruku jai naa ti o seku pa ogun eniyan ati ipalara fun opo eeyan.

en: Moro was a recipient of part of the application fees paid by the job-seekers amounting to 675 million naira [about $1.8 million USD].
yo: Moro gba ninu of owo iwase ti awon awase san ti o n lo bii egbeegberun 675 owoo naira [ $1.8 USD].

en: Moro not only enriched himself but also bypassed the extant procurement laws for the Immigration Service.
yo: Moro ko owo sapoo re bee naa o fo ofin igbannkan Asobode da.

en: """No need for silence, fear or self-pity"" - #SayNoToSocialMediaBill!"
yo: """Ko nilo idake jeje, iberu bojo tabi ikaaanu-araeni"" - #SayNoToSocialMediaBill!"

en: Using the hashtag #SayNoToSocialMediaBill, Nigerian netizens took to Twitter to express their collective indignation:
yo: Nipa lilo ami #SayNoToSocialMediaBill, awon omo ori ayelujara orile edee Naijiria bo sorii Twitter lati so ero okan-an won:

en: "In a statement, Amnesty International condemned the use of ""laws to justify human rights violations"" because it will not only stop Nigerians ""from speaking their minds"" but will also ""send them to jail for doing so."""
yo: "Ninu gbolohun kan, Amnesty International fajuro si lilo ""awon ofin ti o n fidii ifoju eto omoniyan gbole mule "" nitori pe ko ni pa awon omo Naijiria lenu mo ""lati maa so ero okan-an won"" ti yoo si tun ""ran won lo s'ewon fun wipe won se bee ."""

en: The parliament, under the pretext of curbing mis- and disinformation, is considering the enactment of a draconian law.
yo: Labe aburada a n dekun gbolohun iro ati oro aheso, n gbero isofin ti ko ni ife ara ilu lokan.

en: Ironically, the greatest propagators of false information online are political actors.
yo: O je ohun iyalenu, awon oloseluu lo lewaju nibi ka gbe gbolohun iro sori ayelujara.

en: Both Nigeria's ruling and main opposition parties turned Twitter into a minefield of ethnic hate speech, disinformation and propaganda during the 2019 presidential elections.
yo: Egbe oloseluu ti o n je lowo ati egbe alatako gboogi so Twitter di papa ogun fa oro ikoriira eleyameleya, iroyin ti ko poju osuwon ati oro etan lasiko idibo aare odun-un 2019.

en: Read more:
yo: Ka siwaju si i:

en: Social media propelled ethnocentric disinformation and propaganda during the Nigerian elections
yo: Ero alatagba fa oro ikoriira eleyameleya, iroyin ti ko poju osuwon ati oro etan lasiko idibo aare odun-un 2019

en: Twitter was a minefield of false information during the 2019 Nigerian elections
yo: Twitter di papa ogun fun gbolohun iro lasiko idibo orile-edee Naijiria odun-un 2019

en: In these troubling times of freedom of expression in Nigeria, the wise charge from American writer Toni Morrison evokes hope:
yo: Ni akoko bii ti ominira oro siso ni Naijiria ti a wa yii, oro olopolo lati enu onkowe orile-edee Amerika Toni Morrison ti o mu ireti dani:

en: This is precisely the time when artists go to work. There is no time for despair, no place for self-pity, no need for silence, no room for fear.
yo: Eyi ni igba ti awon ayaworan n sise. Ko saye fun isoretinu, ko saye fun ikaaanu-ara, ko nilo idake jeje, ko si aye fun iberu bojo.

en: We speak, we write, we do language.
yo: A so, a ko, a p'ede.

en: The bill is currently at its second reading in the Senate. To become law, it will need to move to committee stage where legislators will review it.
yo: Iwe abadofin ilo ero alatagba naa ti je kika ni igba keji ninu igbimo Asoju-sofin.

en: The committee presents its report to Parliament, the bill is debated, a clean copy is re-presented to the Senate for a final vote and then, there's the presidential assent.
yo: Ki o to di ofin, o gbodo gba igbimo kan ti awon asoju-sofin yoo ye e wo. Igbimooteekoto naa yoo si jabo abajade ayewoo re fun Igbimo agba, lati gbe e ye wo, ti won yoo te omiran jade fun ayewo ti o keyin, ki aare o to bu owo lu u.

en: The Parliament must be hard-pressed to throw out the social media bill in its entirety.
yo: A gbodo faju ro si igbese Igbimo ki won ba ju iwe abadofin ilo ero alatagba naa danu sigbo.

en: This is because Africa's most populous country will slide smoothly into full dictatorship once freedom of expression has been extinguished.
yo: Nitori orile edee ti o gbajumo ju lo nile Adulawo yoo ye gere si ijoba ifipamunisin ni kete ti ominira oro siso ba di tite bole.

en: Tanzania high court upholds ruling to end child marriage despite attempts to repeal it
yo: Ile ejo giga Tanzania pa a lase fun ifopinsi isoyigi laaarin agbalagba ati omode lai wo ti igbese imupadaa re

en: """This is the best decision the court has ever made"""
yo: """Eyi ni ipinnu ti o dara ju lo ti ile-ejo yoo se"""

en: Schoolgirls in Tanzania pose for a photo on July 10, 2007. Photo by Fanny Schertzer, used with permission via Wikimedia Commons, CC BY 2.0.
yo: Awon Omoileewe omodebinrin ni Tanzania duro fun aworan lojo 10 osu Agemo odun-un, 2007. Fanny Schertzer ni o ya aworan, a lo o pelu ase lati Wikimedia Commons, CC BY 2.0.

en: In October 2019, Tanzania's high court upheld the landmark 2016 ruling that increased the minimum age of marriage for girls and boys to 18.
yo: Ninu osu Owara 2019, ile ejo giga Tanzania se idimu sinsin idajo odun-un 2016 ti o pase o kere ju, omobinrin ati omokunrin gbodo pe omo odun mejidinlogun ki o to se igbeyawo.

en: The Tanzanian government attempted to repeal this decision, claiming that girls mature earlier and marriage is a form of protection for pregnant young women, and should, therefore, be allowed to marry earlier than 18.
yo: Ajo oba orile edee Tanzania gbeegbese lati se imupada ipinnu yii, nitori wipe awon omodebinrin n yara balaga ati wipe aabo ni igbeyawo je fun odobinrin alaboyun.

en: But on October 23, 2019, the Tanzanian government lost its appeal and the high court ruling remains: The marriage age for both males and females is 18, reinforcing the ban on child marriage in Tanzania.
yo: Amo ni ojo 23 osu Owara odun-un 2019, ijoba orile edee Tanzania padanu ejoo kotemilorunun re ti ase ile ejo giga si duro: ako atabo gbodo pe ojo ori mejidinlogun ki won o to se igbeyawo, ti eyi si n fi agbara kun igbese isoyigi omode ni Tanzania.

en: According to the United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA), Tanzania has one of the highest prevalence rates of child marriage in the world.
yo: Gege bi United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA) ti se wi, Tanzania ni isoyigi omode po si ju lo lagbaaye.

en: Netizens were quick to express their delight over the ruling.
yo: Awon omo ori ayelujara sira lati fi idunnuu won han lorii idajo naa.

en: Some congratulated Rebeca Z. Gyumi, the petitioner and respondent behind this case.
yo: Awon kan ki Rebeca Z. Gyumi, alafisun ati eni ti o le waju ninu oran isoyigi awon omode naa.

en: Gyumi is the founder and executive director of Msichana Initiative (Young Woman Initiative), a Tanzanian nongovernmental organization that empowers girls through education.
yo: Gyumi ni oludasile ati alakooso agba Msichana Initiative (Eto fun awon Odomobinrin), ileese ti ki i se tijoba ti o n ro awon omodebinrin lagbara nipase ti eko iwe.

en: The fight to end child marriage in Tanzania
yo: Igbese lati fopin si isoyigi omode ni Tanzania

en: In 2016, Gyumi challenged the constitutionality of the Law of Marriage Act, 2002 (LMA) that allowed females under the age of 18 to get married.
yo: Lodun-un 2016, Gyumi na owo ika abuku si agbara Ofin Igbeyawo; Law of Marriage Act, 2002 (LMA) ti o gba obinrin ti ko to omo odun mejidinlogun laye lati se igbeyawo.

en: According to Tanzania Demographic and Health Survey (TDHS), 36 percent of women aged 25-49 get married before their 18th birthday compared to only 5 percent for men the same age.
yo: Gege bi iwadii nipa ilera Tanzania Demographic and Health Survey (TDHS) se ti salaye, ida 36 obinrin ti ojo orii won wa ni 25-49 ni i se igbeyawo ki won o to pe omo odun mejidinlogun, ti awon akegbee won lokunrin si je ida 5.

en: The LMA allowed girls as young as 14 to get married with consent from a court and age 15 with the consent of the parents whereas 18 years was the minimum age for a male.
yo: Ofin LMA fi aye gba omodebinrin ti ojo orii won ko ju odun merinla lo lati se igbeyawo pelu ilowosi ile-ejo, ilowosi obi fun omo odun marun-un-dinlogun, nigba ti odun mejidinlogun je ojo ori ti o kere ju lo fun omokunrin.

en: Through her attorneys, Gyumi argued that the LMA provisions were discriminatory for giving preferential treatment to males in the matter of eligible marriage age.
yo: Nipase awon asoju re, Gyumi salaye wipe alaale LMA ko iyan obinrin kere nitori pe o fun awon okunrin ni anfaani ju awon obinrin lo.

en: They further argued that the provisions infringed the right to equality and they were too vague and too susceptible to arbitrary interpretation to deny female children their right to education.
yo: Nitesiwaju, won so wipe alaale naa fi eto didogba omo eniyan yi erefo ati pe won fi eto anfaani si eko iwe dun awon omodebinrin.

en: Gyumi petitioned the High Court to find the provisions of LMA null and void.
yo: Gyumi ro Ile-ejo Giga lati gbe alaale LMA ti segbee.

en: The High Court never declared the provisions in the LMA null and void.
yo: Ile-ejo Giga ko se bee.

en: But they found the provisions unconstitutional and gave the government one year to correct the anomalies in the LMA provisions.
yo: Amo won ri i loooto wipe ko ba ofin mu won si fun ijoba lodun kan lati se atunse si ohun ti ko tona ninu alaale LMA.

en: Through the attorney general, the government was directed to put 18 years as the eligible age of marriage for both females and males.
yo: Nipase asoju agba awon adajo, a pa ijoba lase lati gbe ojo ori igbeyawo si odun mejidinlogun fun obinrin ati okunrin.

en: However, then-Attorney General George Masaju was aggrieved by the ruling and immediately served a notice of appeal to the High Court:
yo: Sibe, asoju agba ana banuje si idajo naa o si ko iwe atunpe-ejo si Ile-ejo Giga naa:

en: Official: I've been served government documents of appeal in the case of #childmarriage. Case number 204 of September 2017.
yo: Pelu ifowosi ase ijoba: mo ti gba iwe atunpe-ejo lorii ejo #childmarriage. Ejo onkaye 204 ti osu Owewe odun-un 2017.

en: Read more: Mozambique criminalizes child marriage
yo: Ka siwaju si i: Mozambique so isoyigi omode di iwa odaran

en: Grounds for appeal
yo: Aye fun atunpe-ejo

en: In four months of court proceedings, the government sought to appeal the 2016 ruling that required the revision of the provisions LMA that allowed girls to be married at the age of 15.
yo: Laaarin osu merin igbejo, ijoba gbero lati se atunpe-ejo odun-un 2016 ti yo se atunse si alaale LMA eyi ti o fi aye gba omodebinrin olojo-ori marun-undinlogun gege bi eni ti o ti balaga fun igbeyawo.

en: The appellant, represented by principal state attorneys, Mark Mulwambo and Alesia Mbuya, provided biological differences and customary and Islamic laws as grounds for the appeal.
yo: Atejope, ti o je asoju awon adajo ipinle, Mark Mulwambo ati Alesia Mbuya, se agbekale iyato iwa eda obinrin ati okunrin ti won si fi asa ibile ati ofin esin Imale gba atunpe-ejo naa nidii.

en: "Ms. Mbuya argued that biological differences put boys and girls in ""different categories"" and that therefore, the law treats them differently."
yo: "Ms. Mbuya so wipe iyato iwa eda fi omodekunrin ati omodebinrin si ""isori otooto "" ati pe, ofin fi oju otooto wo won."

en: She argued that because girls matured earlier, the law took that into consideration. She argued that marriage could protect unmarried girls who get pregnant at an early age.
yo: O so siwaju si i wipe nitori awon omodebinrin maa n tete balaga ju omodekunrin lo ni ofin fi la alaale bee. O so wipe igbeyawo le fi aabo bo omodebinrin ti ko si nile oko ti o ti di abarameji lai to ojo ori ti o to.

en: "Further, she argued the court erred by ""equating the age of the child and the age of marriage,"" meaning that the court should consider male and female children differently when it comes to marriageable age."
yo: "O so siwaju si i wipe ile ejo kuna bi o se ""se imudogbandogba ojo ori omo ati ojo ori ti o ye fun igbeyawo,"" eyi ti o tumo si wipe oto ni ti tolu oto ni ti toluu wo, oto ni o ye ki ile ejo o la kale fun ojo ori igbeyawo okunrin ati obinrin."

en: Netizens were quick to criticize the grounds the appellant provided in court.
yo: Awon omo ori ayelujara ti yara bu enu ate lu idi ti atejope fi sile ninu igbejo.

en: Read more: Mozambique, Cote d'Ivoire make legal strides for women and children's rights
yo: Ka siwaju si i: Mozambique, Cote d'Ivoire gbe igbese akoni fun eto awon obinrin ati omode

en: Gender equality
yo: Didogba abo atako

en: The court's ruling is a step toward eliminating harmful practices and ending all forms of discrimination against girls in Tanzania.
yo: Idajo ile ejo naa je atoka si ifopinsi awon asa ti o n mu ipalara ba awon omodebinrin ati oniruuru eleyameya toun ifoworoseyin awon omodebinrin ni Tanzania.

en: According to the United Nations, in order to achieve gender equality by 2030, governments need to change discriminatory laws and adopt legislation that proactively advances equality.
yo: Ni ti ajo United Nations, ki a to le yege nibi ti didogba abo atako ni odun-un 2030, ijoba ni lati se ayipada ofin iyasotooto ati sise amulo isofin ti yoo mu imudogba ti a n so waye.

en: Data shows that the age of marriage is directly related to levels of education and wealth (TDHS 201).
yo: Abajade iwadii se afihan-an re wipe ojo ori ti o to lati se igbeyawo ba ipele iwe ti eniyan ka ati oro ti eniyan ti ko jo (TDHS 201) tan.

en: In Tanzania, there is a 6-year difference between the age of marriage between girls with no education and girls with secondary or higher education.
yo: Ni Tanzania, o ni iyato odun mefa ti o wa laaarin omodebinrin ti ko lo si ile iwe ati awon ti o ka iwe giga tabi iwe giga ju lo.

en: In Tanzania, it is illegal to impregnate or marry schoolgirls with 30-year imprisonment as punishment.
yo: Ni Tanzania, ohun ti ko ba ofin mu ni ki a fe tabi fun akekoobinrin loyun, ewon ogbon odun ni eni ba tase agere sofin yoo fi gbara.

en: Pregnant schoolgirls are not allowed to return to school even after they have given birth.
yo: Akekoobinrin ti o ba loyun ki i pada si ile iwe paapaa ti o ba bimo tan.

en: The ban on child marriage will protect all girls, regardless of their school enrollment status.
yo: Ifofinde isoyigi pelu omode maa n fi aabo fun awon omodebinrin, lai ro bi won se wo ile iwe.

en: In Tanzania, child marriage bars girls from education and leads to school dropout, according to data from the Tanzania National Survey, 2017).
yo: Ni Tanzania, igbeyawo omodebinrin ki i je ki omodebinrin o kawe ti won ko si ni anfaani lati pari ekoo won, gege bi esi iwadii lati Tanzania National Survey, 2017 se ni i lakosile.

en: This ban creates better conditions for schoolgirls to finish school without barriers.
yo: Ifofinde isoyigi yii se agbekale igbe aye to dara fun akekoobinrin lati pari ekoo won lai si idaduro.

en: Even so, impregnated schoolgirls are still faced with an unconstitutional ruling that prohibits them from returning to school.
yo: Pelu bee, akekoobinrin ti o ba feraku si n koju ofin ti o ni won ko gbodo pada wa sile iwe.

en: "Kanye West's use of Jamaican symbols sparks national dialogue on ""branding"""
yo: "Aami idanimo orile edee Jamaica ti Kanye West lo di awuyewuye ti o da firigbagboo lori ""isaami"""

en: Jamaica-themed merchandise appeared in the online store
yo: Eru oja pelu akori nipa Jamaica di tita lori ayelujara

en: Kanye West performs at The Museum of Modern Art's annual Party in the Garden benefit, New York City, May 10, 2011. Photo by Jason Persse, CC BY-SA 2.0.
yo: Kanye West n korin nibi ayeye olodoodun Ile-ona ti Ona Igbalode ni Garden benefit, New York City, ojo 10, osu karun-un, 2011. Aworan lati owoo Jason Persse, CC BY-SA 2.0.

en: "American rapper Kanye West brought his ""Sunday Service"" pop-up concert to Kingston, Jamaica, at the start of its National Heroes Day holiday weekend (October 19-21, 2019)."
yo: "Okorin takasufee ti o je omo orile edee Amerika Kanye West gbe ariya ""Isin Ojo Ose "" pop-up concert wa si Kingston, Jamaica, ni kete ti isinmi ojo ose fun Ayajo Ojo Awon Malegbagbe Omo Orile-ede naa (19-21, osu Owara odun-un 2019) yoo bere."

en: This was the first time the rapper had taken his huge gospel choir outside the United States, reportedly at the request of a Jamaican member of his staff.
yo: Eyi ni igba akoko ti okorin naa yoo ko egbe akorin iyinrere re kuro ni Amerika, ni ijepee ti agbe fun ijoba orile edee kan ti o Ja ki o gbe eto naa wa siluu oun.

en: However, the event was besieged with criticism from the outset, culminating with West's unapproved use of Jamaican emblems on merchandise being sold on his website.
yo: Sibe, ariya naa ti ri itako lati ibere pepe, ti o Ho fori sole pelu ami idanimoo orile-edee Jamaica ti West we lori oja ti o n ta lorii ibudo itakun agbayee re lai gba ase lati lo o.

en: "With just two days"" notice, the free concert took place at Emancipation Park in Kingston, the capital city - a location that jarred some commentators because of controversial comments West had made about slavery during a media interview in May 2018."
yo: Laaarin ojo meji ni ikede fi lo sita, inuu gbagede Emancipation Park to wa ni Kingston, olu ilu orile ede naa ni bebe ti waye - oju ibi ti o mu awon sorosoro kan wi tenu won latari awon oro to mu ariyanjiyan dani ti West so nipa owo eru ninu iforowanilenuwo kan bayii losu karun-un odun-un 2018.

en: "The park was opened in 2002 in honour of the ""full freedom"" of 300,000 slaves in Jamaica on August 1, 1838."
yo: "Odun-un 2002 ni gbagede naa di lilo ni ibowo fun ""ominira doju ami"" fun awon eru 300,000 ni Jamaica lojo 1, osu kejo odun-un 1838."

en: That may have been the first bone of contention around the concert, but it was not the last.
yo: O le je eyi gan-an ni oun akoko nipa ariya orin naa, sugbon oun ko ni o gbeyin.

en: "Even as Culture Minister Olivia ""Babsy"" Grange responded to early criticism by saying the country was benefitting from the concert, one music promoter felt the show, which was livestreamed on the Sunday Service website, ""upstaged"" other cultural activities over Heroes Day weekend."
yo: "Paapaa ju lo bi Olootu Eto Asa Olivia ""Babsy"" Grange se benu-ate lu awon alatako nigba ti o so wipe orile ede naa se abapin ninu ere ariya naa, ni eyi ti asagbateru orin kan lero wipe ariya naa ti o se e wo loju ese bi o se n lo lorii itakun agbayee Isin Ojo Ose, ""gba"" awon eto ti o ro mo asa ibile ti o je ti Isinmi awon Malegbagbe Omo orile ede segbee."

en: In addition, Kingston residents, who suffered unusually heavy traffic flows throughout the week, predicted chaos and confusion during the evening rush hour.
yo: Lafikun, awon olugbee Kingston, ti o ba sunkere fakere kodimu lose yen, fo afotele laasigbo ati rotiroti bi awon to siwo ise ba n dari lo sile nirole.

en: Nevertheless, the concert went smoothly, several thousand Jamaicans enjoyed the show and Jamaican media companies earned online kudos for their flawless production:
yo: Lai si ani-ani, ariya naa lo ni irowo-irose, egbeegberun lona egberun awon Nev orile-edee Jamaica gbadun-un ariya naa ti awon ileese agbohunsafefe orile edee Jamaica naa gba igboriyin fun ise takuntakun ti won se:

en: Word on the street is that there may be a move by [Sunday Service] to seek patent/ownership rights on the Kingston, Jamaica logos as well as the fabled streamer-tailed humming bird.
yo: Iroyin etiigbo igboro ni wipe o see se ki igbese wa lati (Isin Ojo-aiku) lati gba ase emi-ni-monii/eto onihun aami idanimoo Kingston, orile ede Jamaica ati ti eye olulana oniru gigun.

en: I have done a fair amount of online searches for information to corroborate the claim without luck but have come across their online release of merchandise bearing these landmark symbols, which coincided with the concert...
yo: Mo ti se awon iwadii kan lori ayelujara ti mo si se awari lati fi ti eri leyin amo kadara ko se mi loore, mo salabaapade ojaa won ti won n ta lori ayelujara to ni awon aami idanimo wonyi, ti o si se dogba-n-dogba pelu ariya naa...

en: "Jamaica's reality is that successive political administrations have never fully appreciated the economic value of the brand ""Jamaica"" nor the symbols that [represent] that brand including its flag and its coat of arms."
yo: "Otito orile edee Jamaica ni wipe awon ijoba ana ko fi igbakan kobiara si igbero eto oro Ajee ""Jamaica"" tabi awon aami idanimo to je ti won bii asia ati asia apata."

en: The same is true for our music and its associated brand marks, Ska, Mento, Rock Steady, Reggae among others.
yo: Bakannaa ni o ri fun orin wa ati ohun ti o ro mo, Ska, Mento, Rock Steady, Reggae ati bee bee lo.

en: That Jamaica was blindsided by the release of clothing bearing the island's important symbols is a classic case of guerilla marketing.
yo: Ile Jamaica ko tete laju si owo aso sise ti o ni aami pataki erekusu ti yoo mu awon eniyan ra a witiwiti.

en: Having a concert to promote the line at the historic Emancipation Park provides tacit assent of not only the line of garments by the government and people of Jamaica, but also of the use of the country's national symbols in their creation.
yo: Bi a ba fi eto ariya se igbelaruge awon oja wonyi ninuu gbagede Emancipation Park ti o mu ilosiwaju ba ohun ti o ju aso lo lati odo ijoba ati awon omo orile edee Jamaica naa, pelu lilo awon aamii orile ede naa ni ona ara.

en: I have noticed that there is now hurried pushback by the Ministry of Culture as well as from the Mayor of Kingston. Both should realize that this isn't a bottle that will be easy to re-cork.
yo: Mo ti se akiyesi wipe Ileese Eto Asa ati Oludari iluu Kingston ti n gbe igbesee pajawiri lati ra nnkan pada. Ki awon mejeeji mo pe atunse ki i se nnkan to ma ya kiakia.

en: I hope that the government has good lawyers.
yo: Mo lero wipe ijoba ni awon agbejoro to ka oju osuwon.

en: Indeed, lawyers may still have quite a bit of work to do to untangle the confusion surrounding the use of Jamaica's national symbols.
yo: Loooto, awon agbejoro si nise lati se lati tu koko awuyewuye eti aso ti lilo asia orile edee Jamaica.

en: Deadly police raids in Guinea as President Alpha Conde clings to power
yo: "Irolu olopaa ti i mu iku ba ""ni ni Guinea bi Aare Alpha Conde se ko lai gbe"" joba sile"

en: """Cities have been paralyzed"""
yo: """Opolopo ilu ti koyin sijoba lori igbese yii"""

en: Screenshot from a France 24 news flash about the situation in Guinea.
yo: Ageku ohun ti o n sele ni Guinea lati iroyin ranpe France 24 kan.

en: Police violence erupted in Guinea on October 14, resulting in the death of several people and massive arrests, following demonstrations protesting against current president Alpha Conde's plans to modify the constitution to run for a third term.
yo: Iwa ipa be sile ni Guinea lojo 14 osu Owara, ti o ti fa iku opolopo eniyan ti won si n ko awon eniyan kiri leyin iyide ifehonuhan ti o tako ijoba aare ti o wa lori oye iyen Alpha Conde, eni ti o n gbero lati yi iwe-ofin pada ki o ba fi aaye gba oun lati lo fun igba keta.

en: The streets of the capital, Conakry, and other cities have turned into battlefields between law enforcement forces and demonstrators.
yo: Ojuu popo olu ilu naa, Conakry, ati awon ilu to ku ti di oju ogun laaarin ajo agbofinro ati awon omo ilu to n fi ehonu han.

en: Police forces have the advantage of new legal privileges that allow them to use deadly force if they deem it necessary for security reasons.
yo: Ileese olopaa ti lo anfaani tuntun ti o fun won lase lati lo ohun ija asekupani bi o ba de oju e.

en: The demonstrations have already killed six people, including one police officer, and wounded many.
yo: Awon afehonuhan ti ran eni mefa si orun ajanto, ni eyi ti o je pe olopaa kan wa ninuu awon ti o je Ogun nipe, opo eeyan lo si fi ara pa.

en: Read more: Security forces in Guinea now have the right to use deadly force
yo: Ka siwaju si i: Awon eso alaabo ni Guinea ti ni ase lati lo ohun ija asekupani

en: Demonstrators oppose any change to the constitution seen as an attempt by the president to run legally for a third mandate.
yo: Awon afehonuhan ko lowo si kilanko ayipada si iwe-ofin ti won ri gege bi igbese aare lati wa lori ipo fun eleeketa.

en: Indeed, the constitution limits the total number of presidential mandates to two in a row. Conde, now 81, should end his mandate in October 2020.
yo: Ni tooto, iwe-ofin naa fi aaye odun meji gba eni ti o ba wa ni ipo aare lati sejoba. Conde, eni odun 81, ye ki saa re o pari ni osu Owara odun-un 2020.

en: Demonstrators are particularly vulnerable as they operate in violation of the law, as Human Rights Watch reminds:
yo: Awon afehonuhan ni a le sa logbe ju lo nitori wipe won tase agere si ofin naa bi Human Rights Watch se pe fun akiyesi:

en: Translation Original Quote
yo: Itumo Itunwi-oro Oloro gan-an

en: The government of Guinea has effectively banned street protests for more than a year, citing threats to public security, Human Rights Watch said today.
yo: Human Rights Watch so lonii wipe, ijoba orile-edee Guinea ti gbese le ifehonuhan l'ojuu popo fun odun kan, o toka si idoju-ija-ko aabo ilu.

en: Local authorities have prohibited at least 20 political or other demonstrations.
yo: Awon alase ijoba ibile ti fon o to bii ogun ifehonuhan egbe oselu ati awon miiran ka yanga.
